loans.name: Lotus Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a tailor. She has run her tailoring business for five years now and works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily. Through her business, she is able to make a small monthly profit. Joyce is in her late 20s and is single with one small child. 
  
This will be Joyce's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She intends to use her loan to buy a Zig-Zag machine and linning material for her business. 

Her dream is someday to be able to build her own house.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group, "Lotus," which has a total of 18 members. They will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy a Zig-Zag machine and linning material for her business

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is single. He is 39 years old and lives in Lower Salug Daku, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. He has a business selling dried fish to earn a living. He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish to sell. He has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, he hopes that he can better support himself financially through the help of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Yeni Dany

texts.es: Yeni es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, elL. tiene una ferretería. Antes trabajaba en Digitación, ahora tiene 2 Ferreterías, una atienda elL. y L. otra atienD. su esposo, agradece mucho a Finca por todo lo que ha realizado y a podido obtener, ahora su meta es tener una Constructora, las capacitaciones y todo lo que enseñan le ayudan a elL. a poder ser mejor persona y sobresalir como empresaria.
texts.en:
Yeni is a member of the Communal Bank “Wiracocha”.  She is 32 years old and has one child.  Yeni has a hardware store.  Prior to that, she worked in data entry.  

Yeni now has two hardware stores, one that she manages and another that is looked after by her husband.  She is extremely grateful to FINCA for everything she has been able to achieve and obtain.  Her goal now is to start a construction business.  The training classes and everything she has learned has helped her to become a better person and an outstanding businesswoman.

loans.use: to acquire inventory for her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married mother of 12 children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns an additional income from raising chickens.  Susan is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is married and blessed with two children. For the past four years, he has been managing a pharmacy. He is also employed and farms for additional income. Isaac has employed one person to help him manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to establish his business. Isaac has managed to boost his business with previous loans from Faulu Kenya. Isaac plans to use this 20,000 KES loan to buy some medicine for resale.

loans.use: To  buy medicine

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 34 years old and is married with three children. He is well-known in the business of selling bed covers, pans and towels. He has been in this business for about two years, and his business hours are from 7am until 8pm every day.

Joseph has requested a loan from Vision Finance Company, a Kiva partner, in order to purchase more pans, towels, bed covers, etc. If successful, Joseph hopes that he will earn more profits than he has in the past.  With these profits, he will keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future and also save for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more bed covers, towels and pans.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 36 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, with one of them currently in school. For the past six years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her grocery store, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food items, such as sugar, maize and rice, and will help Sylvia generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to send her children to school and to open up grocery stores in new locations. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sylvia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food items, such as sugar, maize and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two pigs for his farm

loans.name: Éxito Group

texts.es:
Carmen Indalecia es miembro del Grupo Solidario Exito, es una persona luchadora, su familia esta integrada por su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos. 

Desde hace 5 años Carmen se dedica a la venta de verduras y aprendió del oficio porque todos los fines de semana ayudaba a su suegra en un puesto de verduras que ella tenia. Luego su misma suegra la alentó para que instalara su propio puesto y fue asi como Carmen inició con su negocio. Carmen tiene su puesto de verduras en el Mayoreo y su horario de atencion inicia los viernes por las tardes y culmina los sabados. Su principal ventaja es que vende productos recién cosechados y sus clientes prefieren sus verduras por ser frescas. Y su desventaja es que por la noche tiene que quedarse en el puesto cuidando su mercancia.

Carmen solicita este prestamo para la compra de repollo, tomates, papas, patastes, yuca, zanahorias, chile, remolachas, apio, brocoli, coliflor, platanos, culantro, entre otras verduras. Con el apoyo de este prestamo Carmen podrá surtir su puesto de mas y variadas verduras y asi obtendra mas ganancias. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que tengan una vida mejor. Tambien sueña con tener su propio local y asi seguir ayudando a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Este es el cuarto ciclo de Carmen en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Carmen Indalecia is a member of the Solidarity Group named “Éxito” (Success). She is a determined individual. Carmen’s family includes her husband and their two young children.

For the past five years, Carmen has been selling vegetables. She learned this trade as a result of working every weekend and helping her mother-in-law with the vegetable stand that she owns. Her mother-in-law eventually encouraged her to start her own business, so she followed her advice. Carmen now has a vegetable stand at the wholesale market and her work schedule begins Friday afternoons and concludes on Saturdays. Her main advantage is that she sells products that are recently harvested since her customers prefer fresh vegetables. The main disadvantage is working through the night so that she can look after her merchandise.

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, chayote squash, cassava, carrots, chili peppers, beets, celery, broccoli, cauliflower, bananas, cilantro, and other vegetables. With the help of this loan, Carmen will be able to restock her stand with a wider variety of vegetables so that she can generate more earnings.

Her dream is to see her children become professionals so that they can have a better life. She also wants to have her own shop so that she can continue helping her husband with the family expenses. This is Carmen’s fourth loan cycle with FAMA and she has repaid her loans in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Ufiata

texts.en:
Ufiata is a 45-year-old married mother of 10 children.

Ufiata has started a business venture, selling food products in the local community. Ufiata needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase new items to expand product offerings.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Ufiata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ufiata's 1st loan with SPBD. 


*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya where he owns a retail shop. He is married and has one child. He used his savings of 20,000 KES to launch his business. He has been in business for three years.

After being introduced to Milango by his friends, Mohammed is now applying for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a variety of retail goods such as bread, flour and sugar. 

His future ambition is to own a wholesale shop. The main challenge his business faces is general inflation, which has greatly reduced the purchasing power of most customers. Mohammed will use the extra income to buy more goods and to save for his family’s future needs.

loans.use: to buy retail goods; e.g., bread, flour, sugar etc.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: The grocery shop above is owned by Florence. Florence is married to a farmer and has five children. She has operated her grocery business for eight years, and sells items such as soap, powdered milk, and others. Florence uses her income to support her partner in taking care of their home. She will use this loan to purchase other types of groceries to bring more variety to her shop, an plans to reinvest the new profits into her business.

loans.use: to purchase new products to bring variety to her grocery shop.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a 56 year-old married woman with 8 children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Teodora runs a dry goods store in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells items like ladies accessories, toys, cellphone accessories and flashlights. Teodora is able to support her family financially with her business.

Teodora has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as sandals, toys and accessories.  Teodora hopes her business and family’s living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as sandals, toys and accessories.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre de 32 años. Es casado con Alexandra de 29 años con quien tiene dos hijos de 2 y de 6 años. Viven en la parroquia de "Abrahan Calazacon" en "Santo Domingo" que es cantón y ciudad de la nueva Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, que era parroquia rural de Quito (Capital del Ecuador),  Santo Domingo está entre la costa y la sierra del país, punto de enlace entre algunas ciudades importantes. Situado en los flancos externos de la cordillera occidental, así como en la planicie costeña inferior a los 1000 msnm, es la zona de mayor pluviosidad del país. Tiene una gran riqueza hidrológica: existen cinco cuencas y micro cuencas importantes. Es una zona climática lluviosa subtropical, posee una temperatura promedio de 22 °C.

Walter, hace 8 años inicio su negocio de cerrajería; fabrica ventanas y puertas de hierro. Esta actividad la aprendió de su negocio anterior y hoy en día el trabaja junto a su sobrino en esta actividad. Este hombre trabajador tiene un obstáculo por superar ya que la soldadora de metales con la que trabaja falla mucho, haciendo que su trabajo se retrase por lo que necesita de un crédito para poder comprar otra más grande y moderna. Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución que intermediará entre el cliente y los prestamistas a nivel mundial, le brindará a este pequeño empresario, capacitación y asesoramiento para que el pueda crecer sosteniblemente.

Mientras Walter trabaja, su esposa se hace cargo de las tareas del hogar y de la crianza de sus hijos, es por esto que él se preocupa mucho por tener mayores ingresos y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Walter is 32 years old, married to his wife Alexandra (29) and lives with his two children, ages 2 and 6.  They live in the Abrahan Calazacon parish, located in the new Santo Domingo province of Tsáchitas, which used to be a rural parish of Quito (the capital city of Ecuador). Santo Domingo is located between Ecuador's coastline and sierra regions.  At nearly 3,280 feet in elevation and with an average temperature of 72 degrees, it acts as an access point to other key cities and is situated in the outer edges of the western mountain range in a subtropical coastal zone.  The region has five water basins and accounts for the country's greatest rainfall, making water an abundant resource. 

Walter is a hard worker.  He began working as a metalsmith eight years ago and continues working today alongside his nephew.  While they work, Walter's wife cares for the home and the upbringing of their children.  Walter is very concerned with increasing his income in order to improve his family's quality of life. 

A malfunctioning welder has become an obstacle and has caused him to get behind in his work. Walter plans to use the loan to buy a newer, more modern welder.  Fundación Alternativa, the intermediary organization between the client and international lenders, will administer the micro-loan and offer training and counseling to help Walter's business achieve sustainable growth.

loans.use: purchase a new welder

loans.name: Jokker Endam De Bantagnel 02 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe tessito a été créé le 24 Août 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur Banc villageois. Il compte 19 membres qui  vivent dans un même quartier. Ce groupe est caractérisé par un bon climat social. Le nom Bantagnel est emprunté du quartier qui abrite.  Leur  activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Binta (assise à l’extrême droite) est responsable de groupe.  Elle est âgée de 29 ans, est célibataire et vie avec ses parents. Elle est vendeuse de jus fruit à  base de produits locaux par comme le « bissap, jus de pain de singe, gingembre, de tamarin … » au marché central et dans son quartier. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans cette activité pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plus de trois ans.

Son nouveau prêt va lui permettre de mieux s’approvisionner  en quantité en intrant pour la préparation des différents jus destinés à  la vente.

Avec  les bénéfices, elle compte en partie développer  son commerce, aider ses parents en les appuyant sur la dépense quotidienne et surtout gagner en autonomie financière.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on August 24, 2011 at the inauguration of their <i>banc villageois<i/>. The group comprises 19 members who live in the same district. This group is characterized by a good social atmosphere. The name Bantagnel is borrowed from the district that houses it. The group's main work involves small-scale commerce.

Ms. Binta (seated at the far right in the photo) is the group's official. She is 29 years old and unmarried, and she lives with her parents. She sells fruit juices made from local products, such as <i>bissap<i/> (hibiscus flowers), the juice from 'monkey bread' (the fruit of the baobab tree), ginger, tamarind…. She makes her sales at the central market and in her district. She enjoys good experience in this business for having worked in it for over three years. 

Her new loan will enable her to stock up more in quantity with the ingredients for making different juices for resale. 

With the profits, she plans in part on developing her business, helping her parents by supporting their day-to-day expenses, and especially achieving financial autonomy.

loans.use: to stock up on ingredients for making different juices for resale

loans.name: Vision Artesanal Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores uno de ello es Juan Manuel tiene 23 años de edad  es artesano de pinturas desde hace 10 años como negocio, pero desde su niñez ha practicado su arte como pintor. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como pinturas, marcos de cuadro, botellas, pinceles, olio, engrapadoras, base blanca, tela dril etc. Patricia vende cosméticos y frutas y Bladimir José vende tortillas.
texts.en: This is a group made up of three enterprising members. One of them is Juan Manuel. He is 23 years old and has been painting as a business for more than ten years. But he has been been practicing his art as a painter since his childhood. He will invest his loan in purchasing materials like paints, picture frames, bottles, paint brushes, oil paint, staplers, white base, twill fabric, etc. Patricia sells cosmetics and fruit and Bladimir José sells tortillas.

loans.use: to buy materials like paint, picture frames, bottles, paint bushes, oil paint, staplers, white base, twill fabric, etc.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs. Faith O. is 35 years old. A specialist in sales of foodstuffs, a business she learnt from her mother. She has proved her credit worthiness for the past three (3) years she has been benefiting from LAPO loan. She needs the above amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Maman

texts.en:
Maman A. is a very energetic young lady. Making beignets (a kind of doughnut) has made her the favorite of her village. She is married to a peasant farmer, has five children that she supports, in addition to her brothers-in-law, making a total of nine persons in her household. To cover the numerous expenses of each day, she has invested the profits from selling sandals into purchasing wheat, oil, sugar, and other things to produce beignets. Schools are where she sells her beignets. These ingredients, bought at retail prices, are becoming very pricey for her. Today, she is requesting a loan of $750 to build a wholesale inventory of the sugar, flour, and oil that are necessary to increase her production. This plan will augment her revenues in order to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Maman est une jeune dame très dynamique. La production de ses beignets, fait d’elle le « chouchou » de la population de son village. Mariée à un paysan, elle est mère de cinq (5) enfants qu’elle supporte en plus de ses beaux frères, soit un total de neuf (9) personnes au foyer. Pour venir à bout de ses nombreuses dépenses quotidiennes, Madame A. Maman a investi les recettes tirées de la vente des sandalettes dans l’achat du blé, de l’huile, du sucre et autres pour produire des beignets qu’elle vend dans les établissements scolaires. Ces denrées alimentaires, achetées en détail reviennent très chères pour A.. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $750 qui va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en gros en sucres, farines de blé et en huile nécessaires pour augmenter la production de beignets. Ceci augmentera ses revenus afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock sugar, flour, and oil at wholesale prices for making beignets

loans.name: Farkhad

texts.en: Farkhad was born in 1960 in the Salyan region in Khaladj village. He is married and has three children. This kind man has had this business since 2002. In the beginning of his business, he borrowed  $400 and bought two small, meaty calves. He needs a loan of $1000 to buy 15 pregnant sheep.

loans.use: To buy 15 pregnant sheep

loans.name: Sixta

texts.en:
Sixta is an elderly lady who has been working in her "Colmado" or mini-market for over six years. In her Colmado she sells rice, beans, salami, cooking oil, and other foodstuff.

Sixta is a widowed mother with 7 children who was born and raised in her community of L. Caños and she travels to the markets around her community like "comercial altagracia" to buy her products for the colmado.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 35 years old, married with four children. She hails from Benin City. Mary sells plantains, yams and vegetables; she has been a LAPO member since 2005. She has 6 years' experience in her business. Mary hopes to buy more plantains and vegetables for resale if she is granted the requested loan of US$ 475.

loans.use: To buy yams, plantains, and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Esta

texts.en:
Esta is a 24-year-old mother with 2 children. In the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam, she has run a nursery school for the past five years. The school now has 120 pupils. She received business and entrepreneurship training from the Youth Self Employment Foundation.

Esta requests a loan of $400 to construct more buildings to expand the size of the school.

loans.use: Construct school buildings

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
At Yamoransa station near Cape Coast is the well-known chop bar operator Madam Grace C.. She has lots of customers. Her customers are drivers, passengers who use the Accra – Cape Coast highway, and people in and around the Yamoransa area. She is married and has three children aged 22, 12 and 7 years. Her husband is a driver, and he has his own vehicle. Madam C. is a hardworking woman. She has a drinking spot, also. To help the finances of her family, she also sells all kinds of assorted drinks including minerals and some locally-made drinks such as kasapreko, oprim quansah, and schnapps.

One challenge that Madam C. faces is that she always runs out of drinks because she has to make an advance payment before she receives the shipment from her suppliers. Her suppliers include the Coca Cola company of Ghana and the Ghana Breweries.

She is therefore asking for a loan of US $1,000 to enable her to buy more crates of minerals (Malta Guinness, Coca Cola, Fanta, and Sprite) to fill her drinking spot attached to her chop bar.

loans.use: To buy more crates of minerals (Malta Guinness, Coca Cola, Fanta, and Sprite) to fill her drinking spot attached to her chop bar.

loans.name: Relina Vasco Cumbe

texts.pt:
Relina Vasco Cumbi, 44, lives with her husband and 8 children in Maputo, Mozambique. She just joined the credit program and plans to use her first loan to improve her poultry-breeding business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva volunteer.

Relina Vasco Cumbi B. , portadora do BI nº 110103199Z, casada com 9 filhos os quais faleceu 1 este é o primeiro ciclo dela vai tomar o valor de 6000 mt a pagar em 4 meses ela faz crianção de galinhas com o valor vai aumentar o negocio tem o seu negocio na Machava nascida a 30-12-1963.

loans.use: Improvement of poultry-breeding business

loans.name: Reducinda

texts.en:
Reducina B. is a divorced mother who lives in the city of Guayaybi. All of her children are grown and living on their own but she still needs to pay the bills. She is in the business of selling cellular phones. She has her own store in a good location. Reducina's business has been successful for five years. Her customers say she is a hardworking woman and is dedicated to her customers' needs.

With the loan, Reducina will continue to purchase cellular phones and accessories to keep the business vibrant and competitive.

loans.use: to buy cellular phones

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor is a native of Huertas, an agriculture zone in which the inhabitants dedicate themselves to the manufacture of brickwork and bricks, throughout her infancy she dedicated herself to the knowledge of the manufacturing of bricks, her skill and effort in this activity today serves her and helps to sustain the economy of her home, she is happily married and has 3 children whom she watched with much happiness and cares for because she wants them to form good habits that will allow them to be honorable. She has completed 10 years of work and is very content because her bricks are the most wanted in her area thanks to the excellent quality of their components. Her desire to establish a cattle farming space to satisfy the necessities of her family without obstacles during the time in which the demand for her bricks decreases, she knows that money is very important and she wants to initiate this project by requesting a loan for the purchase of a cow.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Flor, es natural de Huertas, una zona agrícola en la que sus pobladores se dedican en su mayoría a la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos, es así que durante toda su infancia ella se ha dedicado al conocimiento y a la fabricación de tejas, su destreza y esfuerzo en esta actividad hoy le sirve y es un sostén en la economía de su hogar, ella está felizmente casada y tiene 3 hijos a quienes atiende con mucha alegría y cuida porque quiere formarlos con buenos hábitos que les permita ser honrados.Ha cumplido diez años de trabajo y está muy contenta de que sus tejas sean las más solicitadas en el lugar que habitan gracias a la excelente calidad de sus componentes. Su deseo es establecer un espacio ganadero a fin de satisfacer las necesidades de su familia sin obstáculos durante el tiempo en el que la solicitud de las tejas disminuyan, sabe que para este hecho es muy importante el dinero e inversión y desea iniciar este gran trayecto solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una vaca.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Sre Ompel I Group

texts.en: Mr. N. T. was born in 1951 and is married. He is a fisherman and is the Village Bank President of Sre Ompel I. He and his wife have eight children: two children are working, three children are attending school, and the other three children are too young to work or go to school at the present time. His wife, Run Vanphea, is a fish seller who usualL. assists her husband gather fish and then sell them in the market. On average, his wife can earn approximateL. $1.75 per day of income. Mr. Ny T. is in need of baskets in which he can put fish and shells, etc. Thus, he is seeking a loan to buy more baskets to help him with his work.

loans.use: To purchase additional baskets to hold fish and shells.

loans.name: Hilda's Songambele Group

texts.en:
Hilda is 29 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 12 and 10 years old. Hilda owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 1999. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Elizabeth, Malilo and Tano, who have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto is 46 years old. He and his wife have been married for 26 years. They have three children. The oldest daughter is 26 years old and has just become a lawyer. Their second son is 18 and is studying commercial engineering. The youngest son is twelve and is still attending primary school. Ernest relates that he has been committed to the same activity for 26 years, which is the sale of polyethylene bags of all sizes for carrying purchases from small shops, supermarkets, pharmacies, etc. He tells how at first he decided to fabricate these bags, and for that work he bought all the necessary equipment and tools. However, it turned out to be more economical to buy and sell the ready-made products, so he decided to resell that equipment. Today he goes out every day, including Sundays, to offer his products, his principal clients being the owners of supermarkets, small shops and kiosks, etc. At this time, he needs a loan to build up his inventory, to buy a wide variety of bags of various colors and sizes because there is big demand.

Translated from Spanish by Charlie Kehler, F. P. Volunteer

Ernesto tiene 46 años, está casado hace 26 años con Lidia. Tienen 3 hijos, la hija mayor tiene 26 años y acaba de recibirse de abogada, el segundo hijo tiene 18 años y está estudiando ingeniería comercial y el menor de todos tiene 12 años y aún va a la primaria.

Ernesto comenta que hace 26 años se dedica a la misma actividad que es la venta de bolsas de polietileno de todas las medidas utilizadas para cargar mercaderías en las despensas, supermercados, farmacias, etc. Cuenta que primeramente se propuso fabricar dichas bolsas, por lo que compró todas las maquinarias que se utilizan en dicho trabajo, sin embargo le resultaba más rentable comprar y vender directamente las mercaderías, por lo que decidió vender nuevamente dichas maquinarias.

Actualmente sale todos los días, inclusive los días domingos y feriados a ofrecer sus productos, siendo sus principales clientes los propietarios de supermercados, despensas, kioskos, etc.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para aumentar su stock de mercaderías debido a que tiene mucha demanda.

loans.use: Buying polyethylene bags of different sizes.

loans.name: Rose Kasoma’S Group

texts.en:
Rose K. is a self-taught beautician who has been working with two other women at the JML beauty salon for the past four years.  She is a 38-year-old single mother with four children, ranging in age from 9 to 18 years old.  She works seven days a week, providing styling and braiding for her customers.  Both are time-consuming activities, taking several hours to style and longer to braid hair.

Rose has been a member of MCDT for two years and she and her group have received numerous loans.  The loans have helped her to invest in her business and to pay school fees for her children.  With this new loan, she will buy chemicals and braids for her business.  Her future goal is to get enough money to buy a plot and build a house for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase accessories for her salon

loans.name: Abdulla Najeeb

texts.en:
Abdulla Najeeb is 22 years old and single. He has a dress shop that he has been involved in for more than 5 years. Najeed was in Iran for a long time where he worked in a shop. When he came back he started working in Kabul and his business is going well.

He would like to expand his business so he wants to take out an individual loan to complete his stock and enlarge his shop. He is sure that he can further his business with this loan and make a better future for himself .

He is happy with this loan and he hopes that he is going to a great business dealer in the future. He would like to thank Kiva lenders who help poor people around the world, especially In Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock and enlarge his shop

loans.name: Hok

texts.en: This is the fourth time Mrs. Hok S. has taken out the loan to improve her business. She owns a rice store in Kann Yuor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, Mrs. Hok S. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Hok S. wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to resell. Her husband, Mr. Sam Nath, assists his wife in business in order to improve their living conditions together. Mrs. Hok S. is 53 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Hok S. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell.

loans.name: Fatma's Apewae Hapokonyeki Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 36 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 18 and 10 years old. She has owned a small food vendor store since 2003. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Fatma is now looking for a loan to buy more products for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Rehema and Safinia.

loans.use: To buy more products for her business

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Mr. Ung K. was born in 1948 and lives in Kor Village in Kandal Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Pul Bo, are farmers. They are faced with a serious obstacle because their field is not fertile and is producing poor crop yields. To solve this problem, Mr. Ung K. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to produce better crops. He hopes to increase his rice revenue and improve his family's living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to produce a better crop.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet B. is a 48-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. For the past 10 years, Janet has been selling frozen foods at the local market of Koforidua, including chicken, pork, mutton, fish, and other meats.

Unfortunately, she does not have adequate capital to support her business at this time, especially due to increasing food prices. As such, she is seeking a loan so that she can purchase more cartons of frozen foods (e.g., fish, chicken, pork, and other meats) to increase her sales and to thereby generate additional revenue. Janet belongs to the community group known as the God is Good Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To generate an increase in sales while food prices are high by purchasing additional food (e.g., fish and meats)

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun S., 52, is married and lives with her husband and five children in the Prey Veng province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$3 each day. Her husband fishes and grows rice. Her husband makes about US$2.50 each day. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also contributed to the high prices. Hun S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase more groceries and fertilizer. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase grocery and fertilizer.

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María Lourdes P. acaba de quedar viuda su esposo falleció en un accidente.
Tiene la necesidad de la elaboración de una losa de concreta en la parte posterior de la casa, uno de los  motivo es porque  cuando llueve se acumula el agua en el patio. 
Y desea que su hijo este mas seguro cuando ella no se encuentre en la casa, ya que trabaja casi todo el día en una empresa de trasportes  en el departamento de contador financiero este es su ingreso para su familia y con el cual desea pagar este préstamo.
texts.en:
María Lourdes P. just became a widow after her husband died in an accident. She needs to build a concrete slab in her back yard, to prevent water to accumulate when it rains. She also wants his son to feel safer when she is not at home, as she works almost all day in a transport company at the financial accounting department. This is her source of income and she intends to repay this loan with the money the makes out of this job.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a slab in the back yard.

loans.name: Hyacinthe

texts.en:
Greetings From Hyacinthe K. in Kanombe Sector, Kicukiro District, Kigali (the capital city of Rwanda)! Hyacinthe is 28 years old, married with 3 children and 2 other dependents.

Hyacinthe started her business three years ago. Hyacinthe runs a charcoal store where she sells charcoal wholesale in her local area. She employs 4 people to help her run her business.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf. She said with this loan, she would be able to further expand her charcoal business. She will be repaying in eight months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Expansion of her charcoal business

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey C. is a pig breeder in Ang village in Kandal province. Her husband, Mr. Mao Mab, is a rice farmer who works his own plot of land. He faces an obstacle because the field has become infertile, and he does not have enough money to buy fuel in order to obtain water to irrigate the field. Mrs. Srey C. has therefore decided to ask for a loan. She is 26 years old and the mother of three children: two who are enrolled in the local school and one who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To help cultivate rice.

loans.name: Zainullahbudin

texts.en:
Zainullahbudin, 51, son of Jalaludin, is married and the father of seven children.  He has been living in Khewa of Nangrahar province for a long time.  Zainullahbudin is an educated man and the governor of a district of Khewa, who works in agriculture on his won land.
  
He has a lot of experience in agriculture.  Now Zainullahbudin wants to buy animals for his land to sell milk and yogurt in the bazaar.  Because of the expense he want to increase his income.  Therefore he requested an individual 50000AF (1,075US) loan.

He would like to thank all lenders, Kiva and AFSG in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.  They support poor people in the poor countries.

loans.use: Buy animals for his farm.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Oumar Dembélé  est un célibataire de 31 ans qui réside  à Wayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné  l’école en classe de neuvième année scolaire, il  tenta  plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus sans succès. Il opta finalement de s’initier aux activités  d’achat et de vente des matériels électroniques (T.V., Radios Mini chaîne, DVD, VCD, Panneaux Sattelitaires, Antennes Paraboliques, etc.) depuis maintenant trois ans. Il jouit d’une forte réputation et  reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout des  jeunes gens.
Dans ses recherches de financement complémentaires, il sollicite la collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier  prêt  individuel qui lui permettra d’acheter, 2 T.V., 3 radios Mini chaîne, 2 panneaux satellitaires, 2 antennes paraboliques, 2 DVD, 3 VCD, et 100 CD afin de pouvoir satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre. 
Il  s’approvisionne à Accra (république du Ghana) pour venir les revendre à Sikasso dans son vidéo club sis à Wayerma. En plus de vente de matériels, il les loue. Certains de ses clients payent au comptant, d’autres à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Oumar Dembélé is 31 years old, single, and lives in Wayerma I, a working-class area in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). Having left junior high school in the final year, he tried his hand unsuccessfully at various incoming-generating activities. He eventually decided to start buying and selling electrical goods (TVs, radio hi-fis, DVDs, VCDs, solar panels, satellite dishes, etc.) three years ago now. He enjoys a well-established reputation and receives a lot of orders, particularly from young people. In his search for financial assistance he is requesting the help of Soro Yiriwaso, with whom this will be his first individual loan. This will allow him to buy 2 TVs, 3 radio hi-fis, 2 solar panels, 2 satellite dishes, 2 DVDs, 3 VCDs and 100 CDs in order to meet ever-increasing customer demand. He gets his supplies in Accra (Republic of Ghana) and sells them on at his video store in Wayerma. He both sells and rents out equipment. Some of his customers pay in cash and others by credit. He intends to bring in a monthly profit of 200,000 CFA francs using this loan. Having achieved his profit target he hopes to make back the bulk of his outgoings, including family expenses, pay off the interest on his loan, and invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of electronic equipment (TVs, radio hi-fis, CDs, DVDs and VCDs, solar satellite panels, satellite dishes etc.)

loans.name: Jowena

texts.en:
Jowena C. is a farmer. Her main crop is rice. She sells most of her harvest to the village to earn a living for her family. She also reserved some of her harvest for family consumption. She is 31 years old and has no children yet. In addition to rice farming, she raises pigs to supplement her income.

She wants to avail a loan from CEVI. ( First Filipno MFI partner to go active in KIVA microfunds). She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. The loan will be a great help to her family farm to increase their yield.

Based on research, Philippines has land area of 30 million hectares, 47% or 13 million hectares of which are use for agriculture. CEVI is reaching more farmers to sustain their livelihood. It not only provides loans, but also gives training and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm necessities

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
H. Nguyen Thi is forty-nine years old and lives in the town of Hung Nguyen.  She is married and has four school-age children.  To make a living, H. owns and operates a business of raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising water buffalo for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately $110 a month from these activities.


In 1999, H. joined the Kiva field partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to get the ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund.  These loans were used to add to the shelters for her livestock.  H. is now requesting a new loan that will be used to purchase a transport vehicle for the business.  This will be her tenth loan from TYM Fund.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle for the business

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita F. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 59 years old. Pablita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Pablita owns & operates a business venture providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling scrap metal for local businesses and community members. Pablita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Pablita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pablita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Pablita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Pablita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en: Jonas N. is 25 years old and married with two children. He sells provisions and drinks. Jonas is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 46 years old and married to Renato, a house carpenter in their village in Masaya, San Agustin, Isabela. They have three children: Renalyn - 24 years old, a college graduate and now working as a teacher; Mark Gil - 23 years old, a graduate of a two year course in college; and Gilbert - 21 years old, a college undergraduate.

Now, Leonora would like to obtain a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy sacks of feed for her hogs. She is hoping to become successful in her hog-raising business and for it to become bigger through the support of the lenders and her hard work.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed for her hogs

loans.name: Nsozibiri B Nakilijja Jane Group

texts.en: N. Jane is 35 years old, married, and blessed with six children and two dependents, who are all in school. She is representing her group. Jane is a farmer and she deals in livestock. She has been in this business for three years. She is using her loan to purchase feed, drugs, pumps, fertilizer, etc. for her livestock and plants. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to prosper.

loans.use: To purchase feed, drugs, pumps, fertilizer, etc. for her livestock and plants

loans.name: Maria Nelfie

texts.en:
Maria Nelfie P. is from the village of Catadman, Manabay, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Maria Nelfie is single. To make a living, Maria Nelfie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a sari-sari or general store.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Maria Nelfie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maria Nelfie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Nelfie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering and to invest in a new business such as snack vending. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maria Nelfie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering and to invest in new business such as snack vending

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de materia prima para elaboración de especias.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela sells crates of drinks, and she also has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 140,000 Nigerian naira (NGN) to purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

Angela is 42 years old and married with five children. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en: B. Purevjav is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. Her oldest daughter attends a local secondary school and her youngest is in kindergarden. Purevjav operates a firewood selling business in her town, while her husband runs a carpentry business. In Bayan-Ulgii province, there is much demand for their businesses as many residents live in gers and use firewood to heat their gers (Mongolian felt tent homes). Purevjav and her husband hire a driver and large truck, travel to a nearby forest, collect old wood, and transport it to the province center to sell. Her husband started his carpentry business in 2000 but already had much experience in the production after helping his father in the business since he was a child. Today, their businesses are very popular among the locals. For the future, Purevjav and her husband hope to start a small ger wall and supplies factory, as he has experience producing these products. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~ 350 USD) loan to pay transportation fees for her firewood business.

loans.use: to pay transportation fees for her firewood business

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa G. is age 20, and has a 1-year-old child. She lives in Norala, South Cotabato.

Jessa started her rice farming business in 2004. She has a hectare (2.5-acre) rice field which is the main source of income for her family. At present, she would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 to purchase additional farm supplies and to pay for a hand-tractor.

Jessa likes the program offered by Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) for it helps people like her to finance their business. She has been a member of CEVI since 2008. She is thankful that she will be able to finance her business with a lower interest rate.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Managing a general store is what Adelaida C. does for work. She is 47 years old, and she is married to Ferdinand C.. They have been blessed with three children: Benjie, who is 21 years old and a high-school graduate; Dave, who is 20 years old and a high-school graduate; and Maribel, who is 19 years old and an undergraduate in college.

Adelaida would like to purchase more merchandise for her store, but she does not have enough capital; that’s the reason why she is asking for additional capital from Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 PHP. She is hoping that her request will be granted. She is lucky because her husband is in full support of her business. They work hard to improve their way of living. Adelaida hopes that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.en:
"H. Nguyễn Thị is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh, Hà nội. H. is the group leader of a five-member group L. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đản Mỗ 05 (3).


H. is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, H. operates a family member's fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling lake-caught fish in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 6,996,000 VND from SEDA. This previous L. was used to purchase additional fish to sell. She is now requesting a new L. of 7,194,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. The L. will be the eighth L. taken out by the borrower from SEDA. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Y. is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 6,322,000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Trần Thị L. is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 7,194,000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Trần Thị H. is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 4,142,000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Nguyễn Thị

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Mrs. Lydia A. is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married and is blessed with four adult children. Lydia owns and operates a business buying and selling coconuts in the local community, earning 4,000 monthly. In 2003, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old and married with two children, one of whom is attending school. He runs the Kiragu Retail Shop and sells a variety of household goods. He's been in business for five years and has successfully completed a previous loan for Kes. 35,000 through Faulu. He is now requesting Kes. 50,000 to increase the stock of household goods in his shop.

In the future, Joseph would like to own land for both a home and his business. He says that in Faulu he has learned how to keep business records and he feels optimistic that he can improve his standard of living and expand his business.

Joseph's wife is depicted on the profile photo at the Kiragu Retail Shop.

loans.use: To buy stock of household products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy felt and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Ngô Thị's Group

texts.en:
S. Ngô Thị (10105030031) is a 60-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội.  S. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Hội Phụ (4).


S. is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, S. manufactures & sells bamboo products to local businesses and community members.  S. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, S. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,270,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4,578,000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Chử Hồng N. (10105030035) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her food stall.


2.  Phạm Thị T. (10105030034) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


3.  Đỗ Thị L. (10105030051) is a 59-year-old female who is requesting a 4,142,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


4.  Trịnh Thị Q. (10105030032) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business imaking & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


S. Ngô Thị (10105030031) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  S. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Hội Phụ (4).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng tre cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  S. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, S. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2006, S. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  S. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.270.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.578.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Chử Hồng N. (10105030035) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  Phạm Thị T. (10105030034) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


3.  Đỗ Thị L. (10105030051) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


4.  Trịnh Thị Q. (10105030032) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia S. is a 48-year-old single woman who lives in Barangay Minapasok, Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and a videoke place. Videoke is the local term for karaoke to distinguish that the singer can actually follow the lyrics on a TV screen as opposed to the old karaoke which only played the music and the singer used a songbook to view the lyrics. Lucia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 in the hope that she would be able to help improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by running a general store and a videoke place. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6,400 from her business activities. Lucia is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund operations of her videoke and general store, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 10,000 for her 18th loan which she intends to use to maintain her videoke machine and sustain her general store. Lucia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store and her videoke business

loans.name: Gleen

texts.en:
Gleen L. is from the village of Cabu-an, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. He is 29 years old. Gleen is single. To make a living, Gleen owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services using his motorcycle as a "habal-habal" driver. Gleen has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gleen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gleen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. Gleen decided to request the same loan amount as his previous loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gleen from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partnersof Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Philoméne

texts.en: Philoméne F. is 38 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 13 years and has always paid back her loans on time. As her main activity, she raises sheep, which she sells at the grand agricultural market in nearby Bambey. This loan allows her to buy 15 new sheep. With the revenues generated by this activity, she can improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase young sheep

loans.name: Saili

texts.en:
Saili  Taupou is 52 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Saili  has 3 years of experience in this business.  Saili  needs a loan of WST $2000 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 750 talas or US $313 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Saili  joined SPBD.This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Saili 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Saili  Taupou are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.7 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Villa Florida Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Villa Florida inicia su octavo ciclo con 17 socias, las socias son de la comunidad de Huanchos, Distrito de Paucarbamba, Provincia Churcampa, Departamento de Huancavelica.
Las actividades principales de las socias son crianza de animales menores, agricultura, tienda de abarrotes, compra y venta de animales.
Como es el caso de la Señora Flor que es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Flor se dedica a la venta de animales menores, que compra en las comunidades de la zona, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de animales menores. Los sueños de Flor son comprar un terreno en la ciudad de Huancayo y construir su casa.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de préstamo como 200 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total de 6,600 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The Villa Florida communal bank is starting its 8th loan cycle with 17 members. The members are from Huanchos, Paucarbamba district, Churcampa province, Huancavelica department. The main commercial activities of the members are: farming, raising small farm animals, grocery stores, and animal sales. Such is Flor’s case. She lives with her life partner and has two children. She sells small farm animals that she buys in area communities. Her husband helps her with this work. She will use the funds to buy small farm animals. Flor’s dream is to buy a lot in the city of Huancayo to build her house. The members need varying amounts: 200 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles adding up to a total group loan of 6600 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Suy S. is 44 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She makes cow ties and raises pigs to earn a living and is able to make about $1.30 US of profit every day. Her husband is a construction worker building houses. On average, he makes about $3.30 US per day. This couple together has three children, one is in school and two are employed as workers. Suy S. is asking for a loan of $800 US to purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation.

loans.use: To perchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Mayramhan Gaynazarova Group

texts.ru:
Майрамхан, 53, вдова. У нее два сына. Оба активно помогают в бизнесе. Она занимается сельским хозяйством, выращивает хлопчатник и животноводством. На кредит она планирует купить одного бычка для откорма и последующей продажи. 

Мухтасархон, 50, замужем. У нее 3 детей: дочерям 23 и 18, сыну 16 лет. Ее супруг работает сварщиком. Старшая дочь замужем, младшая дочь помощница по бизнесу, сын учится в школе.Клиент занимается откормом КРС и овец. На кредит она планирует закупить корову и корм для живности.

Мамлакатхон, 46, разведена. У нее двое детей. Дочку выдала замуж, сын частный строитель. На земельном наделе клиент выращивает картофель и хлопчатник. За счет бизнеса выдала дочь замуж, закупила приданное. Мамлакатхон планирует закупить минеральные удобрения.

Илхамжон, 35, женат. Его супруга работает преподавателем в школе интернат имени Тургунова. Он сам занимается откормом доенной коровы с теленком и телкой. На кредит он хочет закупить еще одного бычка для откорма и разведения.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Mayramhan is 53 years old, a widow. She has two sons, both of whom actively help with the business. She is involved in agriculture (grows cotton) and animal husbandry. Mayramhon plans to use the loan to buy one bull for fattening and subsequent sale. Muhtasarhon is 50 years old, married. She has 3 children: daughters are 23 and 18, and son is 16 years old. Her husband works as a welder. The oldest daughter is married, the youngest is a helper with the business, and the son is in school. The client is involved in fattening cattle and sheep. She plans to use the loan to buy a cow and livestock feed. Mamlakathon is 46 years old, divorced. She has two children. She married off her daughter. The son is a building contractor. The client grows potatoes and cotton on her land plot. This business enabled her to buy dowry and marry off her daughter. Mamlakathon plans to purchase mineral fertilizers. Ilhamjon is 35 years old, married. His wife works as a teacher at the Turgunov special needs school. He is involved in fattening of a dairy cow with a calf and a heifer. He wants to use this loan to buy an additional bull for fattening and breeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Judit

texts.en:
Judit A. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Judit owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells tuba (coconut wine) in the local community. Judit has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Judit joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used as additional capital for her business. Judit is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tuba for sale. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tuba for sale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is from the city of Prenza Tangub City. She is 33 years old. Virginia is married and has 3 adult children. Virginia owns & operates a a service-based business, providing machete making services to local community members. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Virginia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is a single mother with four children, all of whom go to school. She used to make a living selling second-hand clothes but recently opened a pub in the Najjanankumbi Stella Zone, where she sells many types of beer and a locally-made gin. She has applied for this loan to buy more beverages to sell to her customers, and to help pay her business rent. She works six days a week and sells her goods in both retail and wholesale markets. Her main challenges include coping with the rainy season and customers who occasionally fail to pay their bills. Her goals include expanding her business and building her own home that has electricity and running water. She joined MCDT as a way to help achieve these goals, and to help pay monthly expenses that include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beverages to sell in her pub

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
A hardworking mother and wife, Anita Sta. M. dreams of having their own fishing boat so that her husband, who is a fisherman, will have his own means for fishing and have bigger earnings than working with other people financing his business. With this, the woman who handles the cash flow for her family would be able to have a strong financial source to support their needs, as well as to support the immediate needs of her six children and their own family members. Someday, she hopes that through the business she has been able to grow, she can help improve their lifestyle, especially that of her grandchildren.  

With the loan Anita is requesting presently, she believes that a step to achieving her above mentioned desires will be undertaken. She will purchase a motorboat for fishing. That way, she will have more fish to sell directly to people within their village and in the neighboring villages. Her selling activity would also be more regular because her husband’s time wouldn’t be controlled by other people or an employer perhaps.

loans.use: To purchase a motorboat for fishing

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina A. is from the village of Bagong Silang in Iligan City. She is a 53-year-old widow with 7 grown children. To make a living, Sabina owns & operates a specialized retail store selling new clothes as well as "ukay-ukay" or secondhand clothing. Sabina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month. Sabina has recently joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more clothing products to sell.

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Amil

texts.ru:
Amil M. 21 let. On ne jinat . Amil jivet v Absheron regione v poselke Bine. Amil uje 2 qoda nachal zanimatsya etim biznesom prodaji naskov optavuyu. 

Nachat etot biznes emu pomoq brat starshiy kotoriy i nauchil eqo etomu delu. Seychas Amil nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye tak kak on prodayet v optavuyu yemu nujno mnoqo mestno. Amil  xotelbi v budushem v svoyom maqazine prodovat i druqiye tovari v optavuyu.
texts.en:
Amil M. is 21 years old. He is single. Amil lives in the Absheron region in the village of Bila. Two years ago, Amil started his business of selling socks wholesale. His older brother helped his start this business and taught him this work. Currently, Amil needs 2000 AZN to expand his space. Since he sells wholesale, he needs a lot of room. In the future, Amil would like to sell other goods wholesale in his shop.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the size of the shop

loans.name: Mr. Vun Chhun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank has eleven people who live in Kaoh Kosal village in Takeo province. Mr. V. Chhun is the village bank president selected by the other members. He was born in 1965 and is a village chief. He is also a fisherman, while his wife, Mrs. Srey Keo, is a farmer who owns a 2 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice which she sells to support the family.
