He is the father of two children: one is a farmer while the other attends school. 

Mr. V. Chhun's problem is that his wife’s field has a lot of insects. So, to improve production, Mr. V. Chhun is seeking a loan to buy pesticide.

loans.use: To buy pesticide

loans.name: Our God Is Able Group

texts.en: Comfort K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Our God Is Able'. She is 44 years old, is married, and has six children who are between the ages of 6 and 24. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. For twelve years, she has been selling fashion clothes, such as blouses, skirts and other clothes, at the Thinkers’ Village Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more fashion clothes. She describes herself as a respectful woman whose goal is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more fashion clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mario José

texts.es: El Sr. Mario José L. M. es trabajador activo de la empresa CEMEX   él  se desempeña  como soldador industrial, tiene diez años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente, tiene tres niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL el primero lo  realizo para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para gastos escolares, estos créditos con la financieras le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que ayudan a mejorar el nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mario José L. M. is a current employee of CEMEX, a business where he works as an industrial welder.  He has been working there for ten years, is married, and has three school-aged children.

He has had two credits with CEPRODEL.  He used his first loan to buy construction supplies to make some improvements to his house.  He has requested this second loan to help him pay for educational expenses.  

The access to credit provided through this means has helped him a great deal, as they help him improve his standard of living.

loans.use: For personal educational expenses.

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia M. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Jovencia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jovencia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Jovencia has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovencia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Jovencia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a married man with one child who attends school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent bills.

He has operated his fresh water selling and food vendor business for over one year. He sells at the market from home.  His potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Issa faces a major challenge of theft because of lack of security in the area. He hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase a water tank and cement to put up his tank with. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and cement to put up his tank with.

loans.name: Emenciana

texts.en:
Emenciana V. is from the city of Kinuman Sur Ozamiz City. She is a 72-year-old widow with eight adult children. To make a living, Emenciana owns and operates an agriculture business raising crops. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Emenciana has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. 

Emenciana joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2005 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emenciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Emenciana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve her general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in business expansion

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen B. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and junk food in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Straton

texts.fr: Straton est commerçant.  Il est marié, et son niveau d’éducation est primaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des robes de mariages sacs et tricots (bodies pour femmes).  Son stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, est l’augmentation  de l’affaire.  Il voudrait l’augmentation ou la capacité d’accueillir beaucoup de clients.  Il voudrait aussi construire une nouvelle maison.
texts.en: Straton is a business man. He is married and has primary education. He will use his loan to buy wedding accessories, bags and ladies' bodysuits. His strategy to develop the business is to save and to increase the activity. He would like to grow and to be able to accommodate many customers. He also would like to build a new house.

loans.use: Purchase of wedding accessories, bags and bodysuits.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun S., 24, is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. The family has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a new business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new business.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamadou Diabaté est un homme marié de 26 ans polygame qui est père de deux enfants. Il  vit avec son épouse à Socourani, l’un des villages de la sous-préfecture de Fakola  dans une  famille traditionnelle élargie, Préfecture de Kolondièba  dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du  Mali. 
 Monsieur Diabaté  adhéra au programme crédit du prêt individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier cycle.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter,  20 tonnes  de maïs pour les revendre à Bamako aux grossistes. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  50. 000  F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les frais scolaire, de santé, de nourriture et acheter des petits ruminants..
texts.en: Mr Mamadou Diabaté is a married 26 year old polygamous man and the father of two children. He lives with his wife Socourani and his extended family in a village in the sub-district of Fakola, in the District of Kolondièba, in Sikasso, the third largest region of the Republic of Mali. Mr Diabaté is a member of the individual loan program for stocking and selling cereals and grains provided by Soro Yiriwaso, and is asking for his first loan. He plans to use this loan to purchase 20 tons of maize from surrounding villages and resell them in Bamako to wholesalers. He hopes to gain an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA [approximately 102 USD] which will be spent on school fees, health, nutrition and to purchase small grass-fed animals.

loans.use: Purchasing grains/cereals

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a married lady with a five-year-old child.  She runs a grocery shop for a living.  She started the business ten years ago.  She has witnessed her business growing through the help of Faulu Kenya.  She is a hard-working business-lady who hopes to run a big business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy carrots.

loans.use: To buy carrots

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 49-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a business buying and selling vegetables and spices. She lives in Narra, Palawan. Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through her own efforts, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty.

Teresita's previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,600, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she will use to buy stocks of vegetables and spices to sell so that she can continue to save up for future business improvements. Teresita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of spices and vegetables

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline P. is from the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province.  She is 40 years old.  Magdaline is married and has 8 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Magdaline owns and operates a business making and selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks & other delicacies like banana & sweet potato fried in the local community.  Magdaline has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Magdaline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Magdaline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like bananas and sweet potatoes.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Magdaline from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed like bananas and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is 25 years old and has one child who is two years old. 

Claudette owns a shop in which she sells food such as rice and peanuts and other items such as candles. She runs the shop together with her husband. 

Claudette is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Las Escogidas 2, & 3 Group

texts.en:
Didina is a 27-year-old borrower from a small community outside San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is a member of her group, Las Escogidas 2, 3 & 4 ("The Chosen"), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

Didina lives with her only child in a batey (a rural community built by sugar companies for their workers). Didina and her daughter have a difficult life – little access to electricity, no running water or medical services, and insufficient roads. Bateys are filled with some of the poorest people, not just in the Dominican Republic, but in the entire Western Hemisphere.

Despite these difficulties, Gina runs a successful fantasia (a small store with miscellaneous sales). With her loan, Didina plans to buy clothes, cosmetics, shoes, accessories, etc.

Didina is very thankful for this loan, her fourth with Esperanza, and she hopes to continue her successful borrowing in the future. Thank you for lending to Didina and Las Escogidas Group!

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, shoes, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida lives in Jaranwala which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Madni Park with her family in a 2-room brick house for many years. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who operates a motorbike rental business. He has two motorbikes which he rents to people and charges on an hourly basis. He is very good in customer dealings and has been doing this business for the past 8 years. With the loan, he will buy another motorbike to further improve his rental business. 

Abida has given birth to four daughters. Two of them study while the others are very young and are not of school-going age yet. Abida is a housewife and does her household responsibilities, staying at home. She is a very active lady and always shows full support to her husband in difficult times. She also does sewing work as a part-time job to financially contribute to the family. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit record and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Abida.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for motorbike rental business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, es un hombre seguro de si mismo, tiene 48 años y vive en concubinato con Nidia, de 37 años, ambos tienen a Henry de 18 años, que es su único hijo. En armonía familiar ellos viven solos en la comunidad rural de Santa Clara. Hace algunos años, su hijo ingreso a la universidad de Ica (costa del Perú), y según Carlos, en ese momento cambiaron sus deseos y aspiraciones; pues su prioridad es sacar adelante a su hijo y verlo como todo un profesional. Cuando tenia 17 años se dedicó a la agricultura, en ese entonces trabajaba con ahínco para que su producción de papa, arveja y habas sean rentables y generen muchas ganancias, con el tiempo, consolidó una familia y desde ahí pudo adquirir mayores ganancias y con el dinero ahorrado compró más terrenos agrícolas. A pesar de tener dificultades no existe nada imposible, si bien tiene que enviar dinero mensual para los estudios de su hijo, continuó sembrando y trabajando con mucho optimismo. Cuenta que tiene sembrado papa de la variedad “yungay”, que dentro de unos meses cosechará. Ahora vende papa en grandes cantidades, “con mi producción puedo educar a mi hijo”, afirma. Sin embargo, él, planea comprar una pequeña casa en la ciudad de Ica, ya que quiere estar en compañía de su hijo, ahí piensa abrir una pequeña bodega de comestibles. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo obtenido en todo este tiempo, asegurando conseguir muchos éxitos y alegrías. Carlos, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá en su próxima siembra de papa de la variedad “yungay” y “única”.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very confident man who is 48 years old and lives with his partner, Nidia, age 37.  Their only son, Henry, is 18.  They live alone harmoniously in the rural community of Santa Clara.  A few years ago their son went off to college in Ica (Peruvian Coast) and, according to Carlos, at that time they changed their dreams and goals since their main priority was to make sure he received his education to become a professional.

When he was 17, Carlos began his farming activity, working hard so his potato, pea and lima bean crops would be profitable and generate a good income.  Over time he formed a family and was able to earn more money and save enough to buy farmland.  Despite the difficulties, nothing was impossible even though he had to send money every month to his son to cover education costs.  But he continued planting and working with optimism.

His "yungay" potato variety will soon be ready for harvest.  He is now selling large quantities, "with my production I am able to educate my son", he says.  However, he would like to buy a small house in the city of Ica so he can be close to his son, and there he plans to open a grocery store.  He belongs to the communal bank "Trabajemos unidos" and this is his fifth loan through MFP.  He is grateful for the support he has received all this time, which has helped him attain success and happiness.

Carlos plans to use the loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer which he will use on his future "yungay" and "unica" potato varieties.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Gladys Ricarda

texts.es: Gladys Ricarda tiene su actividad que es la venta de granos básicos. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy humilde y sincera. A pesar de los problemas que ha enfrentado como es la difícil situación económica por la que el país atraviesa. Tiene dos hijos, a su cargo Ella además de estar al tanto de sus hijos también se dedica al comercio,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Lleva 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien. Este crédito es para comprar más productos como arroz, aceite, frijoles, concentrado, maíz entre otros productos.
texts.en: Gladys Ricarda has a business selling basic grains. She has demonstrated herself to be a very humble and sincere person. She has faced the problems from the difficult financial situation that the country is going through. She has 2 children in her care. In addition to caring for her children she is also a merchant. She works every day from 6 in the morning until 7 at night. She has been in business for 12 years and it has gone very well. This loan will be used to purchase more products, such as rice, cooking oil, beans, bullion powder, and corn.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, beans, corn, and other products for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years old and he is married to Alice, a farmer who also contributes to the family income. Joseph is also a farmer and he has been growing pineapples for about 22 years.  He gets an income of about KES.13,000 Kenyan shillings per month.

He is taking out his second loan from KADET after having repaid the previous one successfully. He wants to use the loan to buy more pineapples for sale. 

He hopes to grow cash crops and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to use the loan to buy more pineapples for sale.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.es: Tereza, reside en la localidad de Puente Capelo (selva central peruana). Ahí formó una fuerte y unida familia, que lo conforman su esposo Roy, con quien lleva casada 20 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos Pol y Kiefen, a los que cuidan y protegen. Como hija de agricultores; comenzó con el sembrío de café, palta y tangüelo en los terrenos heredados de sus padres, de eso hace más de 8 años. Su buena disposición en el trabajo y la entrega de su esposo por seguir adelante la impulsaron a ahorrar el dinero que recibía de las ventas de sus cosechas a los acopiadores de la zona. Con ello pudo abrir una farmacia hace 5 años. Paralelo a este negocio, tiene una casa que hace poco terminó de construir y donde arrienda habitaciones para estudiantes y peones que llegan a la zona. Asimismo alquila en una parte de su casa, un restaurante a terceras personas, obteniendo de ello un dinero extra cada mes. Su principal preocupación es el capital de trabajo; ya que cada tres meses invierte un promedio de 5 mil nuevos soles para abastecer su farmacia. Pero ello no la desanima al contrarío su objetivo es poder tener la rentabilidad necesaria para generar su propio capital. Asimismo vio conveniente tener su propio restaurante por considerarlo más rentable. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Flor de café”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta de recibir el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Tereza, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la instalación de su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Tereza lives in the town of Puente Capelo (central Peruvian jungle).  She is part of a strong, close knit family that is made up of her husband Roy with whom she has been married 20 years.  They have 2 children, Pol and Kiefen,  who they care for and protect.  As a daughter of farmers she started planting coffee,avocados and tangerines on the land she inherited from her parents more than 8 years ago.  Her willingness to work and her husband's dedication to getting ahead prompted her to save the money she received from her crop sales to the middlemen in her region.  With her savings she was able to open a drug store 5 years ago.  Along with her business, she has a house that they recently finished building where she rents rooms to students and laborers that come the region.  She also rents part of her house as a restaurant to three people for extra income every month.  Her main concern is her working capital since every 5 months she invests an average of 5,000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] in stock for her drug store. This doesn't discourage her from striving toward her goal to be able to be profitable enough to generate her own capital.  She also thought it would be advantageous to have her own restaurant because she thinks it will be more profitable.  

She belongs the communal bank "Flor de café" and this is her sixth loan with MFP.  She is happy to receive the financial support that is much needed.  She is also committed once again to making her payments on time as she did with previous loans.  She is also grateful for being a part of her communal bank because all the members are very supportive and responsible.  

Tereza will use the loan requested to start her own restaurant.

loans.use: start her own restaurant.

loans.name: Larediza

texts.en:
Larediza is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Larediza has a shop that sells canned goods, biscuits and noodles. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Larediza has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Larediza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en: Maria lives in the town of El Paraiso in southern Honduras, where she runs a small convenience shop for a living. Maria operates the shop out of her home and has had the business for the past six years. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Honduran lempira (HNL) to purchase merchandise for her store. Aside from running the shop, Maria cultivates coffee on a small piece of land she owns.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, cornmeal, corn, milk, cheese, butter, chicken, beef, sausage, fruits, vegetables, soft drinks, snacks, candy, household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, 33, is married woman with six children, aged 2 to 17. She began farming 10 years ago and now helps her husband till their land in Surallah, South Cotabato. They grow rice crops to sell. Helen has requested a loan because they need financial assistance for their farm. She plans to use the loan to purchase fertilizer and other farming supplies.

In the future, Helen hopes for a stable business for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Graciela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Graciela, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 14 años de edad, la casa donde viven es familiar y trabaja desde hace 10 años con la venta de mariscos, ofrece a diario a los clientes diferentes clases de pescado.
Ella actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de pescado fresco como langosta, camarón, corvina, boca colorada entre otras especies que sus clientes consumen, el propósito del financiamiento es comprar todo al contado para luego de las ganancias cubrir las cuotas del préstamo.
Su objetivo en el corto plazo es comprarse un vehículo para transportar la mercadería y de ser posible generar rutas de venta, para poder crecer en clientes y en ventas.
texts.en:
Graciela earns a living selling seafood. She lives with her husband and a son who is 14 years of age. The house where they live is the family home and she has worked for ten years selling seafood, offering daily to her customers various types of products of the sea. 

She currently is seeking a loan to purchase fresh seafood such as lobster, shrimp, sea bass, and red snapper among other species consumed by her customers. The purpose of the financing is to purchase everything with cash so that the earnings then may cover the loan payments. 

Her objective for the short term is to purchase a vehicle for herself in order to transport the merchandise, and if possible to generate sales routes so that she may grow in customers and sales.

loans.use: to purchase fresh seafood such as lobster, shrimp, sea bass, and red snapper.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: El joven Domingo es una persona  responsable y  muy  trabajador, el   cual  se  preocupa   enormemente   en brindar  una excelente  calidad de  vida a  su  familia  ya  que  son lo mas  importante  en  su  vida, su  mayor  sueño es  acondicionar  su   domicilio es  por  ello  que  en  este  momento  requiere  pintar  el exterior  de  su  vivienda para   poder  brindar  una  mejor  imagen a su  hogar,agradece  el  apoyo   brindado   para  la realizacion de su proyecto.
texts.en: Young Domingo is a very hardworking and responsible person who is greatly concerned about providing an excellent quality of life for his family since they are what are most important in his life.  His greatest dream is to fix up his home and because of this he needs to paint the exterior of his dwelling now so that it will look better. He is grateful for the help provided him to undertake this project.

loans.use: to paint the exterior of his house.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a determined individual who aims to improve the business she manages. She is 46 years old and separated from her husband due to family conflict and unavoidable circumstances. She lives with her three children in the village. She is engaged in selling dry goods in the market like bags, jewelry, belts and electrical supplies to earn an income and satisfy their basic daily needs. 

Being a single parent, it is difficult for her to send all her children to school. But still she has the strong determination to improve their status of living and give her children a bright future. She aims to improve her business to increase her income for the sake of her children. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy additional stock of bags, jewelry, belts and electrical supplies to sell in the market. She believes that the loan will help her to improve the business in the future through her patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy additional bags, jewelry, belts and electrical supplies to sell in the market

loans.name: Maitre Cecilia

texts.es: Maitré de 39 años de edad vive al suroccidente de Barranquilla con su esposo y su hijo en la edad de 10 años. Ella tiene un negocio de droguería y miscelánea, que surgió cuando Maitre, observando al sector donde habita,  encontró que  no existía  un negocio,  que respondiera a las familias con la  necesidad medicamentos. Gradualmente ha ido fortaleciendo su negocio y así mismo agregando otras mercancías,  como cosméticos, perfumes y accesorios femeninos. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y lograr capital de trabajo para invertir en productos que rotan rápidamente, para tenerla siempre bien surtida. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará medicinas alopáticas sin restricción médica, cosméticos y fantasías femeninas. Mientras trabaja para alcanzar sus metas obtiene una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menores del 22%, una rotación de inventarios de 7 días y una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 6 días, indicadores financieros desde los cuales proyectamos su crecimiento y su potencial inversión exitosa con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Maitré, age 39, lives with her husband and ten year old son to the southwest of Barranquilla.  She has a drugstore and miscellany business.  The business emerged when Maitre observed that the area where she lives did not have another business that could meet the families’ pharmaceutical needs.

She has gradually been strengthening her business and adding other merchandise like cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories.  Her goal is to expand her business and to get working capital to invest in products that turnover quickly.  She will do this in order to always be well stocked.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy allopathic medicine, over-the-counter medicine, cosmetics, and women’s novelties.

While she works to achieve her goals she gets a profit margin of no less than 22%, an inventory turnover of seven days, and an accounts receivable rotation of six days.  These are financial indicators from which we predict her growth and the potential for the successful investment of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy allopathic medicine, over-the-counter medicine, cosmetics, and women’s novelties.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Elizabeth has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.
Elizabeth is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Wardja

texts.fr:
Wardja est un homme âgé de 34 ans. Il  est marié à une couturière et père de 3 enfants. 
Wardja travaille comme chauffeur depuis 2007. Il  conduit un taxi interurbain destiné aux déplacements des passagers de Lomé et ses environnants. Il travaille seul et sa difficulté principale du moment est que sa voiture a une panne de moteur.
Wardja a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter un moteur pour la réparation de sa voiture. 
Dans les prochaines années, Wardja voudrait voir sa voiture travailler sans panne. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit rendre sa famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Wardja is a 34-year-old man. He is married to a dressmaker and has 3 children.
Wardja has been a chaffeur since 2007. He drives a taxi and transports passengers from Lomé and the surrounding areas. He works alone and his main difficulty for the moment is that his car's motor has broken down.
Wardja his requesting his second loan through WAGES to buy a new motor for his car. 
In the coming years, Wardja would like for his car to work without breaking down. With his profits, he plans on making his family happy.

loans.use: to buy a new motor.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, six of whom are in school.  Margaret has a business of a pub. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Margaret has requested  for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerycans of local Gin and crates of Beer. The main business challenges for Margaret include rainy season and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked pub. Margaret lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerycans of local Gin

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has 3 children, with ages ranging from 4 years to 6 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a mobile money transfer services business where she provides mobile money transfers to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 9 months. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be network delays slowing down the services. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to add operational float. Her business goal is to grow her business and open another M-pesa shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will diversify into the real estate business.

loans.use: To increase float for her M-pesa (Mobile money transfer services)

loans.name: Neptali

texts.es:
el sr. Neptalí tiene 27 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha procreado 2 hijos, su actividad principal es la caficultura, tiene 6 años de experiencia en el manejo y cultivo del cafe, esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos para el sustento de su familia.
 Neptalí utilizara el credito para la compra de un sistema solar, es lo que ha anhelado en toda su vida,  nunca ha gozado de este servicio tan básico.
Neptali no desea que sus hijos crezcan inhalando el humo de los candiles, que es muy dañino para la salud.
texts.en:
Neptalí, 27, lives in a common law relationship and has two children.  His main activity is growing coffee; he has six years’ experience farming coffee.  This activity is his family’s source of income.

Neptalí will use the loan to buy a solar generator; it’s something he’s wanted his entire life having never enjoyed this most basic of services.  He does not want his children to grow up inhaling candle smoke that’s very damaging to health.

loans.use: to buy a solar generator.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: El señor Jhonny se dedica a la refacción de vehículos (chapería y pintura de vehículos ) desde hace cinco años en taller de su propiedad el tipo de trabajo que realiza son en vehículos de origen americano vive en domicilio familiar con sus dos hijas y su esposa solicita el monto del crédito  para la compra de repuestos ya que en varias oportunidades los repuestos de vehículos, los vende a los propietarios de los vehículos que refacciona y así termina el trabajo mucho mas rápido, es una persona muy trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Jhonny repairs vehicles (paint and auto body work). Five years ago, he started his own repair shop where he works on American vehicles. Jhonny lives in the family home with his wife and their two daughters.

The amount of this loan will be used to buy spare parts. He frequently sells these parts to vehicle owners and also uses them in his job so that he can finish his work more quickly. Jhonny is a hardworking individual who is grateful for the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a single mother of one school-going child. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mwanamkuu has operated a retail shop for the past year; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of a lack of enough capital to expand her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the loan for 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of their fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Alma Marisol

texts.es: Alma, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de incrementar su negocio, invirtiéndolo en variedad de ropa y cosméticos, blusas, falsas, ropa interior, crema, Lociones, para mejorar ventas y la atención a los clientes. El efecto de los préstamos anteriores en el negocio de Alma fortaleció la mercadería y le dio una mejor capacidad de respuesta a las demandas de los clientes, con ello mejoró sus ingresos y la disponibilidad económica para cualquier gasto familiar; su familia está mejorando, sus hijos han avanzado en el estudio y ella se encuentra contenta y agradecida por este apoyo.
texts.en: Alma decided to request a loan because she needed to expand her business, by investing in a variety of clothing, cosmetics, blouses, skirts, undergarments, creams, and lotions, to improve her sales and customer service.  The previous loans have helped strengthen Alma’s business, gave it more merchandise, and gave it a better ability to serve customer needs.  This allowed her to increase her income and financial availability for any family expense.  Her family is improving her children are advancing in their studies, and she is happy and grateful for this support.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: Emiliano, tiene la edad  de 42 años, está en unión libre  y vive con su esposa e hijo de 2 mese que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El comprara abono, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra de las labores en su cafetal y así podrá darle una ayuda extra a su cafetal para producir este año. El cuenta desde varios años atrás con el terreno en producción y este año le quiere dar una ayuda extra para así generar un aumento en su producción de café. El quiere generar el máximo de las ganancias para así tener una mejor estabilidad económica y brindarle cada día a su familia un mejor bienestar de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Emiliano, 42, is married and lives with his wife and 2-month-old son, who are his main priorities. With the loan he plans to buy inputs to attend to his coffee plantation. He will buy compost, herbicides and hire laborers so that he can give his crops some extra help so that they produce well this year. He says that he has been working this land for some years and this year he wants to put in extra effort so that he can increase his coffee production. He wants to generate as much income as he can so that he can have greater financial stability and be able to give his family a better quality of life every day. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He hadn't taken out loans with other banks in the past, but FUDECOSUR made it easy and gave him a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to attend to his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Aulio Moises

texts.es:
El señor Aulio Moises es casado, tiene 33 años de edad, esta diplomado como contador, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la atención de una tienda en general, inició este negocio por iniciativa propia y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien se dedica al mismo oficio.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de productos para la tienda que tienen, aguas gaseosas, golosinas, embutidos, cereales, etc. Espera que su negocio sea prospero.
texts.en:
Aulio Moises is 33, married, and a graduate in accounting.  He has two children who are in school.  He has a business running a general store. He started this business through his own initiative, and so far has six years of experience. He has the support of his wife, who has the same occupation.

He is applying for a loan in order to buy products for their store, such as soft drinks, candy, cold cuts, cereal grains, etc. He hopes that his business will prosper.

loans.use: To buy products for his store.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with one child. Mejumaa sells Khanga’s (African women wrap cloth).  On top of this, she also sells charcoal, which she earns as her other source of income.

Mejumaa can count on many customers, and she says that thanks to her job she has succeeded in making improvements to her house and in providing her child with the mandatory education.

The reason she needs this loan is to purchase clothes to stock-up her inventory in order to keep on selling her products.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo est de femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 49 ans, 3 enfants et qui vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de l’arachide, des articles divers et de  la restauration.                                                                
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêts solidaires. 
La cliente Konimba  1 ère  à droite  fait le commerce d’arachide tous les jours. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 300 kilos d’arachide auprès des paysans producteurs. Elle effectue ses ventes en détails, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité et aider le mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The Djenkafo group is made up of married women who, on average, are 49 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Warassala, Kouliloro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group knows each other from kinship, neighborhood, and friendship ties. 

Members of the group engage in selling condiments, groundnuts, and other various products, and food preparation. The women of the Djekafo group are on their 22nd group loan. 

Konimba, the first woman on the right [in the photo] sells groundnuts for a living. With her loan, she plans to buy 300 kilos of groundnuts from producers in the countryside. Konimba makes her sales at retail, for cash and sometimes for credit, to men and women customers.

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 45,000 francs CFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to help her husband support the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Cruz Jackeline

texts.es:
Cruz Jackeline tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de plátano, cuenta con bastante clientela que posteriormente lo trasladan a otras ciudades, es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono y limpieza de su cultivo de plátano y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cruz Jackeline is 27 years old and lives with her spouse and children in the district of Buenos Aires, a community with hot weather that is dedicated to agriculture, animal husbandry and trade, located in the Province of Morropon in the Piura Region, north coast of Peru.

She sells plantains and has enough customers that subsequently she moved to other cities.  She is an entrepreneurial mother who has requested a loan of 1500 soles for the purchase of fertilizer and to clean her plantain crop and thus have good production to offer customers.

loans.use: to purchase manure and clean her plantain crop.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
She is the owner of a medium-sized wood carving firm. The firm produces local wood carvings for citizens in the country. The carvings have high demand as they are purchased and used for ceremonial activties such as traditional festivals and other social engagements including marriage ceremonies.

She has acquired skills in business planning and keeps simple records of her business operations.She has been a very good participant in our TEACH lending sessions and a good applicant of the skills learnt.

loans.use: WOOD CARVING AND MOULDING MACHINE

loans.name: Líder

texts.en:
Líder sells convenience products. He has 14 years of experience in this business. He started out working in a business and was able to save a small amount of capital. With his savings he left his job and was able to buy a plot of land where he could build his house and locate his business. From there he has grown his business. His wife and sons help him. He tends to the business from 6 AM unti 10 PM. His business is very well located and is the only store in the neighborhood. The growth of his business has allowed him to have his own house.

He needs the loan in order to buy more products: rice (wholesale), sugar, oil.

Lider was born in Manabí. He is 30 years old. He is married; his wife helps him in the business. They are very enterprising and reponsible people who from a very young age have worked to improve their quality of life. Thanks to their savings they have been able to buy their house, which was originally made of cane and wood and is now made of cement. Their business has also allowed them to give their children an education. Their dream is to continue running the store and grow the business, since it is a secure source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Líder se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad. Tiene 14 años de experiencia en ésta actividad. Comenzó trabajando en una empresa y pudo ahorrar un pequeño capital. Con sus ahorros dejó su trabajo y pudo adquirir un terreno para su casa y ubicar su negocio. Desde allí él ha crecido en el negocio. Su esposa y sus hijas le ayudan también. Él atiende de 6:00AM hasta 10:00PM. Su negocio esta muy bien ubicado y es el único en el sector. Su crecimiento en el negocio le ha permitido tener su casa.

Él necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos: arroz al por mayor, azúcar, aceite.

Líder nació en Manabí. Tiene 39 años. Con 3 hijos. Está casado y su esposa le ayuda en el negocio. Son personas muy emprendedoras, responsables, que desde muy joven han trabajado para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. Gracias a sus ahorros ellos han podido comprar su casa que antes era de caña y madera y ahora es de cemento. Su negocio también les ha permitido darles la educación a sus hijos. Su sueño es seguir manteniendo la tienda y crecer en el negocio ya que es una de las fuentes más segura.

loans.use: Buy rice (wholesale), sugar and oil.

loans.name: Mang

texts.en:
Mang works as a day laborer while his wife works as a farmer. They must support 6 family members and their youngest daughter has a problem with her heart. The government and neighbors helped them to build their house. Their income is about $12.50 per person per month.

Mang wants to borrow $75 to buy a cow to raise. They will pay back this money in a period of 7 months.

loans.use: Mang would like to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
For 20 years Juana Francisca has been in sales. She has 2 children. She started her business to help cover the household costs and the costs of her children’s education as her husband’s salary was not sufficient. She started off selling clothes and then started to sell other things such as jewellery, cosmetics and shoes, depending on what her clients wanted. This is how her business has grown, inspired by the love of her children and the faithfulness of her husband.

In order to meet her client’s demands Juana is now asking for a loan of $475 which she will use to buy merchandise. She promises to repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Juana thanks you very much for the trust and support you can offer her so that her business can grow and improve.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 20 años Juana Francisca se dedica a las ventas, inició su negocio ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene dos hijos y con el ingreso de su esposo no se podían cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, ella empezó vendiendo ropa, después fue incorporando la venta de otros artículos ante la demanda de sus clientes, como joyería, cosméticos y zapatos, de esta manera es como ha hecho crecer su negocio impulsada por el amor que tiene hacia sus hijos y el fiel compromiso con su esposo.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, en este momento Juana solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Juana agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que le puedas brindar para mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Señora Milena belongs to the Ricardo Palma Community Bank in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old, and is widowed with four children. Her husband was the one who contributed to the household until be passed, and she didn't know what to do. A neighbor soon encouraged her the become part of her Community Bank, and with her first loan of 300 Sol. (US$94 approx.), she decided to sell artisan brooms of piasaba and taminchi (material that they harvest from the mountain), but with the passing of time she decided to improve her product, and it was thus that she started to purchase pieces worked like cues for the handle of the broom. With the recent loan granted by Manuela Ramos in the sum of 800 Sol. (US$254 approx), she will buy 300 cues, 10 kilos of staples, and 50 wooden handles. Now, jointly with her children she takes care of the business and assembles the brooms they take to sell. Señora Milena hopes to be able to take her products to the capital (Lima).

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Milena pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 51 años, y es viuda con 4 hijos. El esposo era quien aportaba en la casa hasta que falleció y no sabia que hacer. De pronto una vecina la anima a integrar a su Banco Comunal, y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) decide vender escobas artesanales de piasaba y taminchi (material que extraen del monte), pero con el transcurrir del tiempo decide mejorar su producto, es así que comienza a comprar piezas trabajadas como los tacos, palo de la escoba. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 800 (US$ 254.00 aprox.) comprará 3 cientos de tacos, 10 kilos de grapas, 10 kilos de piazaba y 1/2 ciento de palos de escoba. Ahora conjuntamente con sus hijos atienden este negocio y arman las escobas que llevan para la venta. La señora Milena aspira poder llevar sus productos a la capital (Lima).

loans.use: Purchase of primary materials

loans.name: Evéwonou

texts.fr:
Ms. Evéwonou A. was born in 1962 in Tsévié, in the Zio prefecture, and is a widowed mother of seven (07) children. Growing up in a big family, she was not able to go to school and thus began to sell foodstuffs to earn a living. To meet the financial needs of her family, she set up a small African roadside stand (“Cuisine Africaine”) to sell foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of $1000 that will serve as working capital to buy a large stock of corn, root vegetables and other cooking ingredients in order to make a consistent profit. This new loan will generate additional income and will allow her to meet her family’s needs with dignity.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Evéwonou A. née en 1962 à Tsévié dans la préfecture de Zio est veuve et mère de sept (07) enfants. Issue d’une famille nombreuse, elle n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études et a commencé à petit coup la vente des denrées alimentaires. Voyant la charge financière de sa famille, elle a su installer au bord de la route un petit bar Africain pour la vente des denrées alimentaires consommables (Cuisine Africaine). Elle sollicite $1000 qui va lui servir de fonds de roulement pour un stock important de maïs, de tubercules et d’autres intrants pour la cuisine pour en tirer une marge bénéficiaire consistante. Ce nouveau crédit apportera également un revenu supplémentaire et subvenir dignement aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of corn and fish for her restaurant

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeun C. (age 58) and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Oeun and her husband (age 62) have been married since 1971. They have five children, the youngest of whom still studies in high school in the village.

Oeun is requesting this, her first loan with Maxima, to help her son expand his carpentry business in Phnom Penh. He learned his building skills from his father. (See photo for Oeun, husband and one, shy granddaughter.) He has been working at this business for three years.

Oeun's and her husband’s house could be a model of cottage industry. In addition to taking care of the home, Oeun weaves cloth, something she has been doing since she was fifteen years old. Her husband still does construction, repairs, fills motorbike and bicycle tires, and re-charges auto batteries (for electrical use in homes and on farms). Oeun expressed hope that, with this loan, her son will be able to continue to expand his business in the city.

loans.use: To help her son purchase tools and materials to expand his carpentry business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, age 30, is married with 2 children, ages 10 years and 1 month old. Her 23-year-old sister also lives with them. Mary owns a grocery shop where she sells beer. She started this business in 2006 and now she makes a monthly profit of about $135 from her sales. The shop is open from 10am to 10pm daily. Mary hopes for a loan to buy more beer to increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana S. sells different products in her neighborhood store in the city of Leon in Nicaragua. She started her business as a street vendor, but with time she decided to ask for financing in order to install her business in a place that provides better conditions for her work. Despite the tough economic situation that she is going through, Mrs. Juana states that the economic support that she has received from CEPRODEL has been vital and that it has allowed her to developed her business as well as improve her quality of life. She no longer works as a street vendor but has her own place of business and one of her dreams is to be able to improve the conditions of her shop so that she can be a good merchant in the city of Leon.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Juana S. se dedica a la venta de productos varios teniendo su pulpería en la ciudad de León de la bella nación de Nicaragua. Inicia su negocio ambulante pero en el transcurso del tiempo decide solicitar financiamiento para instalar su negocio en su casa de habitación que presenta mejores condiciones para esta actividad. A pesar de la dura situación económica que le ha tocado vivir a la señora Juana manifiesta que el aporte económico que la han brindado en CEPRODEL ha sido decisivo en el desarrollo de su actividad y le ha permitido mejorar la calidad de vida de modo que ya no anda ambulante sino que ahora tiene un local propio y uno de sus mayores sueños es mejorar las condiciones de su pulpería para ser una gran comerciante en la ciudad de León de donde es originaria.

loans.use: To buy products for her business

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angelica Maria C. Hernández is a twenty-eight-year-old farmer. In spite of being so young, she has learned to work the land. She lives in Ticuantepe and her main source of income is working the land. Angelica uses some of her land to harvest pineapples and the other to harvest bananas. While one portion of the land is being used to produce pineapples, the remaining of the land is given maintenance in order to keep the quality of the crop. She is a single mother and has two children. The father of the children helps her with the school expenses for the children but Angelica takes cares of the rest of the expenses. She is a tenacious lady who has raised and supported her children by harvesting pineapple and bananas. While the crops are getting ready so they can be sold, Angelica buys produce from other producers and sells them in the city streets using a wicker basket, which helps her generate additional monthly income. Angelica needs this loan to buy products to maintain her crops, which represent the largest part of her income.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Angélica Maria C. Hernández, es una mujer agricultora de veintiocho años de edad, a pesar de ser joven ha aprendido a trabajar la tierra, habita en Ticuantepe y su principal fuente de trabajo es el trabajo en la tierra ella siembra una manzana de piña y media de plátano mientras una produce, a la otra se le da mantenimiento para no perder la calidad de la cosecha. Ella es madre soltera de dos hijos el padre de los niños le ayuda con los gastos de colegio de sus hijos y el resto corree por su cuenta. Es mujer luchadora que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos con la siembra de piña y plátano mientras sale la cosecha compra productos varios a otros productores y los vende en canasto en las calles de la ciudad lo que le genera ingresos mensuales. Necesita su préstamo para comprar productos de mantenimiento de la cosecha la cual representa su mejor ingreso.

loans.use: To Buy Products to Maintain the Crop

loans.name: Diluvina's Group

texts.en:
Diluvina is fifty-nine years old and a proud mother of twelve children. To make a living, she sells homemade ice cream and ripe fruits, operating her business in the public school of the community. The entrepreneur says that it’s a profitable business, and that she would like to augment her production in order to increase both her sales volume and her income. Profits from her activity will allow her to pay for the children’s educations and to deal with some other financial issues.

Diluvina will take her loan with a group of four other women who all own businesses. They are: Lidia F. P., who owns a cafeteria;. Rosa P., who operates a small beauty products store; Cruz Antonia M. G., who will purchase silver jewelry, and Candida A. G., who will use her loan to buy jewelry.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and  raw materials to prepare her delicious ice cream.

loans.name: Abeda's Tujibe Moyo Group

texts.en:
Abeda, age 30, is married with three children (ages 14, 13, and 11). She owns a small cafe and works there from 8am to 7pm daily. From this business, which started 5 years ago, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $50.

Abeda hopes for a loan to purchase more food items for her cafe. She will share this loan with her subgroup, fellow members of the loan group Tujibe Moyo. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy food items for her cafe

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Ms. Natividad is a 57 years old widow, who lives in the Hugo Chávez neighborhood. She has two children who work and are independent.

Ms. Natividad has had a grocery store for seven years. Meager sales volumes are amongst the difficulties she faces. With the loan, she intends to buy basic products to offer to her clients, in order to sell more and obtain a greater profit. Her future plans include the improvement of her store’s infrastructure and the increase in her merchandise stock, in order to improve her life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Natividad tiene 57 años de edad, es viuda, y habita en el barrio Hugo Chávez. Tiene dos hijos que trabajan y son independientes.

Doña Natividad tiene una pulpería y lleva siete años de experiencia. Entre las dificultades son las ventas bajas, que muchas veces son superables. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos básicos para tener bastante para ofrecer a sus clientes y vender más y obtener más ganancias. Sus planes futuros son mejorar la infraestructura del negocio y hacer más grande la pulpería con diversos productos, y así mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of basic products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corn seeds, beans, clearing and labor

loans.name: Yerusolem Group

texts.en:
Anna has owned a business selling clothing in Arusha since 2006. She is married with two children, ages 5 and 7. She works every day from 6:30 am to 7:00 pm, which allows her to earn approximately $50 each month. She is hoping to take out a loan so that she may purchase more items for sale in her shop.

Anna will share this loan with her group member, Nangidare, who owns a shop selling food.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhoem T. was born in 1967 and she now lives in Kouk Romeat Village in Kandal Province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is pursuing Bachelor's Degree in Phnom Penh, Cambodian city. The remaining two are attending school. Since Mrs. Nhoem T.'s living conditions are poor, she cannot afford the school fees for her fist child so she decided to ask for a loan to pay for them. Mrs. Nhoem T. hopes to improve her child's knowledge with this loan.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to pay for her child's college fees.

loans.name: Rosales Group

texts.es: “Rosales” es la denominación que adoptan 10 mujeres, agrupadas para trabajar junto a la institución de Pro-Mujer. Ellas se reúnen cada 14 días en el centro focal Los Andes ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto. Varios son los negocios de éste grupo, por ejemplo alguna de ellas se dedica a la venta de plantas, Emiliana teje chompas en lana, otras de ellas se dedican a la confección de busos y chaquetas deportivas. Estas prendas son comercializadas al por menor en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Ellas necesitan capital para la compra de materia prima para poder aumentar su producción y vender al por mayor, de esta manera generar mayores ganancias y conseguir mejores ingresos  para sostener económicamente a sus familias.
texts.en:
"Rosales" is the name of a group of 10 women, working together with the institution Pro-Mujer. They meet every 14 days in the center of the Andes in the city of El Alto. This group has a variety of trades. For example, one woman sells plants, Emiliana weaves wool sweaters, and the others focus on making clothes such as sweatshirts and sports jackets. These products are sold retail in the street market 16 de Julio in the city of El Alto. These women need capital for the purchase of basic materials in order to increase production and sell their products at wholesale. In this way, they can generate more profit, continue improving their affairs, and economically support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: These women need capital for the purchase of basic materials in order to increase production and sell their products at wholesale

loans.name: Nun

texts.en:
Mrs. Nun S. lives in Bakong Keit Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece land on which she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Chhoy Technich, is a worker a in bicycle repair store. Since his workplace is far from home, he spends a lot of money on transportation, so Mrs. Nun S. is requesting a loan to help buy him a motorbike for traveling to work.

Thus, she hopes to reduce family expenses and improve her living conditions. Mrs. Nun S. is 37 years old and the mother of two children who all attend the local school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use in traveling to work.

loans.name: Justacio Ramiro

texts.es:
El señor Justacio Ramiro P. tiene la edad de 66 años, su estado civil es casado, este Señor tiene 6 hijos Mario de 40 años que trabaja por cuenta propia, José tiene la edad de 38 años de edad que trabaja con el de forma individual, Luis Ramiro de 31 años labora como docente, Marlon tiene la edad de 25 años y labora reparando y armando bicicletas y su hija mujer mercedes tiene la edad de25 años que esta en 5 año de su carrera, su compañera de vida  trabaja en la administración  de una  venta de refrescos y gaseosa en su vivienda, en sus propósitos esta el darle mejoras a su vivienda y obtener mejores condiciones de vida y en sus deseos es que Dios le proporcione mas vida para seguir trabajando y así el pueda ganarse el pan de cada día.


El tiempo que ha tenido de tener su negocio es de 30años, su actividad económica es la de zapatería, el inicia este negocio por que a la edad de 12 años empezó a trabajar en talleres pero al pasar el tiempo los talleres tuvieron perdidas muy fuertes y fueron cerrados fue entonces que el decide instalar un negocio ubicado en las afueras del Mercado Santos Barcenas por lo que en este lugar es donde hay mas afluencia de clientes, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita  realizar las compras de hilo encerado, pega y suela debido a que la compra de este se hace en Managua por lo que al por mayor le resulta mas conveniente y así con todos los materias que necesita podrá realizar los encargos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Mr. Justacio Ramiro P. is sixty-six years old, married, and has six children: Mario is forty and is self-employed; José is thirty-eight and works independently; Luis Ramiro is thirty-one and a teacher; Marlon is twenty-five and works repairing and assembling bicycles; and his daughter Mercedes is twenty-five and in the fifth year of her career. His wife works in soft drink and soda sale administration in his house. His goal is to improve his housing and living conditions, and one of his wishes is that God supply him with more life so that he can continue working and providing bread for his family. He has had his business for thirty years. It is a shoe store. He started worked in workshops when he was twelve. As time went on the workshops began to have great losses and closed. It was then that he decided to start his own business outside of the Santos Barcenas market, since there is more traffic there. The loan is for resources for work -- he needs to be able to purchase waxed thread, glue, and proper shoe soles, which are bought in Managua because wholesale is more convenient for him. With all these materials that he needs he will be able to fulfill the orders he has pending.

Translated from Spanish by HannahLily P, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty G. is 39 years old, married, and has five children, who are all in school. She lives with her family in Obuasi, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. Gifty is a very skillful and talented hairdresser. With six years of experience, she has three apprentices who are currently training under her. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, hair-dryer machines, and so forth to serve her customers better. She belongs to the community group called “Tumi wura” (Almighty) Trust Group. Her picture was taken at a group meeting. In this group, members provide social collateral for one another to guarantee the repayment of loans. She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy salon supplies

loans.name: Chanroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanroeun S., 28, and her husband, Mr. Chhai Chhoun, 33, who live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1998 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Three of them are in school. Beside of her children she also has one mother living with her.

Chanroeun has been selling grocery items and rice for 18 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She buys rice from Vihea Sor district about thirty kilometers from her home for resale in her village. Her husband has been building a wooden house for three years. He sometimes works at other places far away from his house. Chanroeun is requesting a loan of 1000 to purchase rice for resale.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Greetings from Betty M. in Nyamirambo Sector, Nyarugenge District, Kigali (the capital city of Rwanda)! Betty is 30 years old, married with one child.

She started her business 9 years ago. This entrepreneur operates a shop where she sells different kinds of clothes. Betty employs one person to help her to run this business; she earns about 150,000 Rwf in monthly income.

Betty is requesting a loan worth 500,000Rwf, which will help her to expand her business. This loan will be repaid in 8 months on monthly basis. Betty believes that once she gets this loan her profit will increase.

loans.use: Expand her clothing business

loans.name: Raem

texts.en: Mrs. Raem C. was born in 1946 and lives in Prochum Angk village, Kandal province. She is a laborer who can make a little income to support the family. Apart from being a laborer, she is a farmer who cultivates vegetables to earn a living. Raem is a widow with two children: one is a construction worker, while the other is employed in a garment factory. Although they work hard, they still earn less income to support the family. They live in an old house which is flooded during the dry season. In order to renovate her house, Mrs. Raem C. requests a loan to buy soil to fill in her flood-affected land.

loans.use: To buy soil to fill in her flood-affected land.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Cửi, 49 tuổi ở Mê Linh - Hà Nội. Anh chị có 3 con và đều đã lớn, đi làm tạo thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 1999 với số vốn vay được anh chị đã đầu tư mở rộng chăn nuôi lợn.Bên cạnh đó chị còn làm công nhân môi trường nên hàng tháng đều có nguồn thu ổn định từ lương. Hiện nay thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị là 5.000.000/tháng. Vòng vốn tới anh chị mong muốn được vay thêm 10.000.000 để mua thêm lợn và mua thức ăn chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi C. is 49 years old, living in Me Linh, Ha Noi. She has three grown children who are working and supporting the family. She joined TYM Fund in 1999. With her loan, she and her husband invested in expanding her pig raising business. Additionally, she also works as a sanitation worker so her family has a stable income from her salary. Currently, her family's income grosses at 5,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in buying more pigs and livestock feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan has owned a bakery for a year. He is 37 years old and lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Marwan is special in his work because he opened his bakery in front of a school. His clients are mainly students as well as people from his region. He does “mankoucheh”. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Marwan decided on this business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. When he first started, he had to face the competition. Thanks to his previous loans, Marwan was able to open his bakery and did improve his financial situation. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. Marwan is requesting a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase baking supplies like flour and oil. In the future, he plans on improving his bakery.

loans.use: To purchase baking supplies like flour and oil

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn G. has been managing a small rice farm for 19 years. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She married her childhood friend, Ronald G.. They have been together for 20 years already. In addition to farming rice, Annelyn supplements their income by selling food in the school canteen. By grace from God, she was able to support the needs of her family, especially in managing the budget for her children's school and books.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. Fertilizer is important to improve soil condition of her farm. The loan will help her and the whole family increase their yield.

CEVI is reaching out to farmers like Annelyn to help sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm necessities.

loans.name: Khamidov

texts.en:
Khamidov S. is a 35-year-old butcher who keeps his own store. He started his business in 2001 and since that time he has been able to accumulate income to purchase his own store. Meat selling is a very profitable business because meat it is in very high demand among Azerbaijani people.

S. is married and has two children. His dream is attached to both his children. He dreams of providing them with better education and for this purpose he is already making some savings.

But to both keep his family and make savings is not easy and so he decided to expand his business. For this purpose he applied for a $1500 loan to increase the amount of meat he sells in a day.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to increase his sales

loans.name: Noor Hussain Muhammad Jamil Group

texts.en:
Noor Hussain baji is married to M. J., and has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Noor's husband has run a dairy business for the past 6 years. Noor baji is a simple, hard-working lady. She sews clothes for her neighbors to earn income. She saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband's milk-selling business. 

She is the group leader of five other women from her area. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Parveen Akhtar baji and Azra Parveen baji are each seeking loans to buy timber to sell. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy bakery items (bread and butter) to sell. Nabila baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa A. is 60 years old and she is a widow with six children. She has a store where she sells provisions. She hopes for the loan of N40,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Hazzan
