texts.en: B. is 34 years old and married with two children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. B. sells table water and cooked foods and has been in this business for the past two years. She is requesting the loan of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and table water. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more bottled water and more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Mamuli A Nalugenge Christina Group

texts.en:
N. Christina is the group representative of “Mamuli A”. She is forty-eight years old, and married with five children.

Christina is a farmer and, also, she raises pigs for sale. She has been in her business so far for five years. She is using the loan for purchasing pig feed, fertilizer for her farm, and so forth. She is very much encouraged with whatever she is doing and her future hope is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed, fertilizer for her farm, and so forth

loans.name: Kuyendu

texts.en:
Kuyendu R. brews and sells local alcohol wholesale. She is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials in order to improve her business. Kuyendu is 40 and her husband is a businessman at the Konyokonyo market. They have two children who attend school at Gumbo Primary School. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up her brewery.  

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase brewing materials

loans.name: Julio Jose

texts.es: Julio Jose Cáliz M.  tiene 34 años es padre de familia y tiene 3 hijas. La actividad económica del señor Julio es la elaboración de artesanías en una propiedad que está ubicada en la carretera nueva a León. Realiza la actividad de manera manual, Hace 10 años tiene este negocio. Inicio porque tenía que proporcionarle a su familia una estabilidad económica y a sus hijos una educación. El es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta mucho su trabajo por que las artesanías son su medio de vida.  El empezó trabajando como ayudante y luego aprendió a fabricar piezas de barro. El financiamiento es para compra de materia prima y elaborar artículos de barro para su venta. Sus deseos son tener dinero suficiente para trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Julio Jose Cáliz M. is a 34 year old family man with 3 daughters. He makes handcrafted items from his property, located along the new highway to León. Julio started his business 10 years ago because he wanted to provide financial stability for his family and an education for his children. He is a very responsible man who enjoys his work as an artisan.

He began working as an apprentice and then learned to make pottery. His loan will be used to buy raw materials for making clay pots. Julio hopes to have enough money to use as operating capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma manages her own business. She is 38 years old and married to Jimmy, who is 40 years old and a farmer. She is a mother to eight; six boys and two girls. She lives in Antipolo City, Rizal province in the Philippines.

Farming is the major source of income among Filipinos. Philippines is an agricultural country. Vilma took the opportunity to farm since rice is the staple food for Filipinos and she believes that her farm products will always be sold. In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with the intention of having access to loans to finance her farming.

Farming without capital is hard since she needs to supply and invest in the farming inputs, which include labor, fertilizers and pesticides among many others.

Now on her second loan, she proposes a loan of 10,000 pesos to be used to pay for sacks of assorted fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and labor costs.

She is hopeful that with the support of ASHI, she can put in good farming inputs that would mean sound output or great production. She aspires to send all her children to school and to have a comfortable and durable house.

loans.use: To pay for sacks of assorted fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and labor costs

loans.name: Mrs. Mut Nhaem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of sixteen people, is located in Roleang Kreul village in Takeo province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. M. N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. M. N. is farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates vegetables for a living. In the plantation, she now faces a problem because her field is not fertile, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support the field. She will use the rest of the loan to buy cucumber seeds to grow. Her husband, Mr. Yos Hean, helps her on the farm. Mrs. M. N. does not have any children to help her.

Three members in this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cucumber seeds

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5  hijos; 2 mayores de edad, Angie de 23 y Grace de 20; y 3 menores, Mery de 11, Jhonny de 9 y Antuannete de 5 años. Todos viven en su casa propia que es de material noble y está ubicada en el populoso distrito de Ventanilla, en Lima.
Ella tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa y desde hace tres años la volvió a establecer, ya que durante un tiempo la dejó al olvido. La comodidad de este negocio en su hogar la animó a continuar con él, ya que le era muy  rentable para lograr sostener a su familia. Mery peude trabajar en la comodidad de su casa y a la vez atender a sus hijos menores y en estas labores la ayuda amablemente su esposo Oscar. 

El momento difícil y en el que según ella “corretea más”, es al mediodía, ya que atender a los clientes se le junta con la hora de almuerzo en la que debe atender a su familia también. Mery atiende en su bodega casi el día entero y los fines de semana el horario de atención puede llegar a extenderse hasta la medianoche.

Para el futuro piensa arreglar las instalaciones de su  negocio, abastecerlo con más mercadería y hasta llegar a vender comida afuera de su casa.

Ya ha tenido 4 créditos a través de MFP y le ha gustado siempre colaborar con su banco comunal, pero por cuestiones de tiempo esta vez pide un préstamo individual. La mitad del dinero que solicita lo destinará a comprar más mercadería, mientras la otra mitad será para arreglar su local, esto para darle una mejor presentación ante sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mery is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and their five children. Two are already grown, Angie, 23 years old, and Grace, 20. Three are younger: Mery, 11, Jhonny, 9, and Antuannete, 5 years old. They all live in her home made from simple materials and located in the popular Ventanilla district in Lima.

She has a small shop in her home and has returned to it after three years, during which time she had to leave it aside. The convenience of having this business in her own home inspired her to continue with it, since it has been very profitable and can sustain her family. Mery can work in the comfort of her home and, at the same time, care for her younger children. Her husband, Oscar, also cheerfully helps with the work.

The hardest time, according to her means “run around more,” is midday, since she has to attend to her customers on their lunch hour and also to her family. Mery attends the store almost the entire day and on weekends the hours can extend until midnight.

In the future, she thinks she will update the facilities in her business, stock it with more merchandise and eventually sell food from outside her home.

She has already had 4 loans with MFP, and she has always liked collaborating with her communal bank, but for matters of time, she is requesting an individual loan this time. Half of the money that she requests will be used to purchase more merchandise, while the other half will be used to update her shop in order to have a good appearance for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Awawou

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et est mère de 02 enfants. Elle s’est spécialisée dans la vente de denrées alimentaires dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer. Elle vend des épices pour la cuisine, de l’huile blanche et bien d’autres ingrédients indispensables. En ce moment elle a besoin de renouveler son stock presque épuisé ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 bidons d'huile, 04 sacs d’arachide, 01 sac d’épices et divers ingrédients. Elle a une ferme assurance de rembourser son prêt dans les délais qui lui seront exigés.
texts.en:
This woman is married and has two children. She specializes in the sale of foodstuffs in the Agoè district in Lomé. This business allows her to contribute financially to the management of her household. She sells spices to be used in food, white oil, and many other essential ingredients. At the moment, she needs to replenish her almost-depleted stock; this is why she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 5 cans of oil, 4 bags of peanuts, 1 bag of spices, and other ingredients. She is very confident that she will repay her loan within the given deadline.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell foodstuffs

loans.name: Nhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhorn M. is a villager in Thkov village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living.

Mrs. Nhorn M. is a widow with one child who is a construction worker. Since his workplace is far from home, Mrs. Nhorn M. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her child to drive to work. This will reduce expenses.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her child to drive to work

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mrs. Asha M., a resident of Tangal, lives in a nuclear family with her husband and one child. Her husband's name is Shyam M. and he is a house painter. Her daughter is studying in grade 2.


Mrs. M.'s family's living conditions are miserable, as her husband’s work is not permanent. Sometimes he may not get a job for a month. So they can hardly fulfill their basic needs. They can’t send their child to boarding school.



So to overcome this problem, Mrs. M. decided to open a momo (meat dumplings) shop. But due to lack of money, she is unable to open her shop. So Mrs. M. is requesting her second loan of Rs 15,000.00 to open the momo shop.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make products to sell

loans.name: Simon Ngatia

texts.en: Simon, has operated the Simrut General Shop in the Utawal Estate for the last seven months.  He sells home products and cereals, including flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice, sodas, snacks and poultry feed.  He has one employee and considers his business challenges to be lack of funds  and strong competition.  He is using the proceeds of this KES20,000 loan to restock the shop.  In addition to the store, Simon works as a property agent.  His goal in life is to become a wholesaler.  Simon is married and describes himself as hardworking and disciplined.

loans.use: 2 sacks of sugar and rice, 3 bags of poultry feed, 4 bales of flour and 40 mobile phone cards

loans.name: Majua

texts.en:
Majua H. is currently in the business of selling used clothes in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dozens of used clothes and shoes to sell.  Majua is 30 years old. She is married and her husband is a soldier. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a boutique and ladies salon.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more dozens of used clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Patricia Maria

texts.es:
Patricia C. de 36 años, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su estado civil es divorciada, tiene 2 hijos los dos estudiando en escuelas fiscales. 

Patricia comenzó como comerciante vendiendo todo tipo de cosas ya son 13 años que sigue como comerciante vendiendo perfumes, ropas, cremas, lociones etc. Patricia sale a recorrer las calles de Guayaquil todos los días para vender su mercadería. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es cuando sus clientes se demoran en pagar.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa, perfumes, joyería para poder tener más variedad en su mercadería. En el futuro quiere poner ya un negocio establecido en su casa.
texts.en:
Patricia C. is 36-years-old and lives on the outskirts of Paraíso de Guayaquil. She is divorced and has 2 children who attend public school. Patricia began selling all types of products and after 13 years, she continues as a vendor, selling perfume, clothing, creams, lotions, etc. Patricia takes to the streets of Guayaquil every day in order to sell her merchandise. One of the complications that arise is when her customers delay payment. She wants to buy clothing, perfume and jewelry with this loan so that she can offer a greater variety of merchandise. In the future, she wants to have an established business in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: clothing, perfume, creams

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane R. is a 36-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Bulwang, Mabinay, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by manufacturing herbal products and food supplements.

Mary Jane’s husband, Rochel, is a 36-year-old truck driver who earns PHP 12,000/month. They have three children who are between 12 and 18 years old. The children are currently going to school and help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Mary Jane joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in herbal products and food supplements. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000 from her business activities.

Mary Jane is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 was used to fund operations of her herbal products and food supplements business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her sixth loan in the amount of PHP 20,500, which she intends to use on herbal products and food supplements. Mary Jane is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy machine for production & additional working capital

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Mrs. Jesusa A. is 45 years old. She is from Upper Santo Nino, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with 4 children. She owns a duck raising business to earn daily income and her husband is also a farmer which supports their daily needs. Their farm serves as their main source of income. From her duck raising she approximately earns 3800 PHP a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access for financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 20000 PHP from PMPC. As of now, she has a new loan of 30000 PHP from PMPC and the purpose of that loan is buy a new set of ducklings. It is her 6th cycle of loans from PMPC.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her duck raising business.

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario el Buen Pastor esta ubicado en el mercado viejo de San Lorenzo, esta integrado por tres personas las cuales tienen mucho tiempo de conocerse. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
 
la señora Maria Pricila O. tiene 43 años de edad,  tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, es madre soltera, esta solicitando el credito para la compra de frutas.
 
la señora Zoila Ernestina A. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Jose Francisco Hernandez. Zoila se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, las vende en el mercado viejo de san lorenzo, esta solicitando el credito para comprar harina de maiz, leña, cal y agua.
Tiene la ayuda de sus hijas para la produccion de sus tortillas.
 
la señora Kledyn Yolibeth R. F. tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos pequeños,  no tiene casa propia. Kledyn se dedica a la venta de tamales y chorizos. Kledyn esta solicitando el credito para comprar carne de cerdo y pollo para hacer los tamales. su deseo es tener algun dia su casa para darle un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Buen Pastor Communal Bank is located in the old market of San Lorenzo. It is comprised of three people who have known each other for a long time. What follows are the details of their different business activities: Maria Pricila O. is 43 years old and has two dependent children. She is a single mother. She is requesting the loan to buy fruit. Zoila Ernestina A. is 44 years old. She is in a common law marriage with Jose Francisco Hernandez. Zoila makes and sells tortillas. She sells them in the old market of San Lorenzo. She is requesting the loan to buy corn flour, firewood, lime, and water. Her daughters help her make the tortillas. Kledyn Yolibeth R. F. is 24 years old. She is a single mother, and she has two small children. She does not have her own house. Kledyn sells tamales and sausages. Kledyn is requesting the loan to buy pork and chicken to make the tamales. Her dream is to one day have a house to give her children a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit, corn flour, lime, firewood, pork, chicken, sausages, vegetables and condiments

loans.name: Ing

texts.en:
Ing C., age 54, is widowed and resides with one of her children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of desserts at her home, earning approximately USD 3 in revenue per day. She has been in this business since 2002. She also rents part of her house to workers at the garment factory in front of her house.  Her son helps his mother in the business and is a civil servant, earning an income of USD 3 per day. 

Their standard of living has improved since they have had these businesses, so they want to have a loan to expand their businesses. C. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to repair her rental rooms for the workers. This is her second loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva. (C. is pictured with her son and his family.)

loans.use: repair the rental rooms for the workers

loans.name: G.s. G.m.s Group

texts.es: La Señoras Flor de Maria, Maria Ignacia y José Antonio. Forman el grupo solidario G.M.S ellos tienen diferentes actividades económicas, por lo que siempre se preocupan por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Su compañero José  se dedica a la  crianza y venta de pelibuey, por lo que se unió a Flor y Maria Ignacia ya que necesitaba mejorar su negocio, el tiene muy pocos animales y es por eso que solicita el financiamiento para la compra de pequeños pelibuey y así criarlos y venderlos. Por lo que juntos se han unido para proporcionarles mejores aportes a su negocio. el sueño de los tres integrantes es mantener activo su negocio.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria, Maria Ignacia and José Antonio are the members of the G.M.S. communal bank. Each has a different commercial activity through which they each strive to improve their living conditions. José raises goats of the pelibuey breed; he joined Flor and Maria Ignacia in order to improve his business. He only has a few animals and this is why he is asking for funds to buy small pelibuey goats to raise for sale. They have banded together to provide better support for their businesses. The three group members dream with keeping their businesses active.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goats.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem C., 38, lives with her husband and five of her children in Takeo province. She grows rice, but her plantation is just enough to support her family members. Her husband is a construction worker building houses. He has been doing this business since the year 2000. On average, he is able to make about US$ 4 in profit a day. Two of their children are in school, whilst three are construction workers. Every month, Hem C. spends about US$ 30 on food, US$ 3 on utilities, US$ 15 on her children's education, US$ 15 on family transportation and other US$ 20 on miscellaneous items. To reduce transportation costs, Hem C. needs to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Kimlot

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimlot P., and her husband, Mr. Savun Pork, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2001 and have three sons. Two sons attend school and one is still young and stays at home.

Kimlot has been a silk weaver for more than five years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. Her husband is a silk weaver as well. They sell their finished products to a middle man in the village, who in turn sells in the Phnom Penh market.

Kimlot has asked Kiva for a loan one time already. She is now requesting her second loan of $600 to fill in the land behind her house. She will also use a part of her loan to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To fill in the land behind her house and buy silk material for weaving

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario C.  is from the village of Zamora. She is 48 years old, married, and has 2 grown children. To make a living, Rosario owns & operates a hog raising business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising and selling pigs in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.  

In 2006, Rosario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be Rosario’s 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: 

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya is the wife of K. M. and lives in Vehari, Pakistan, with her husband and two children.

Suraiya does embroidery work and provides additional services to her customers of sewing clothes as well. She is very good in her work and gets regular orders, but she faces problems fulfilling them most of the time because of her lack of capital to buy material.
 
Now, Suraiya has decided to obtain a loan to overcome this problem. She will buy embroidery material in bulk which will help her to complete larger orders on time.

Suraiya has a little daughter who is in 9th class. Suraiya wants her daughter to complete her education and also wants to marry her to a very good family. She is hopeful that, by receiving a loan and investing it in her business, she will be able to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material in bulk

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married and has four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of other family members. Margaret used to make a living selling bananas in Kalerwe's market, but recently began selling mattresses and cushions. She is applying for a loan to buy more mattresses and cushions to sell to her customers, and to help pay expenses such as rent and the transportation of mattresses from factories in a nearby town. She works six days a week and faces challenges that include the seasonal nature of her business, transportation and lack of capital.  Margaret joined MCDT to help address these problems. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more mattresses  and cushions to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima P. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 52 years old. Maxima is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Maxima owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Maxima has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Maxima joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maxima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from ASKI. Maxima is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Maxima from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita B. is from the village of Dumalogdog. She is 60 years old and widowed with eight adult children. To make a living, Esterlita runs a general store selling a variety of different products. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Esterlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday R. is currently in the business of selling ice cream, bread and groundnut paste at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bread to sell. Monday is 39 years old and is married, with a husband who is a builder. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Tuoi

texts.en: Tuoi  T. N. is 42 years old. She has 2 children. One of them is studying at Technological University. She has a small grocery shop in a local market. Her business has been quite stable for many years. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy more products for the shop. She hopes to increase her income in order to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more products for the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets for trapping crabs

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Julia C. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como comerciante donde su negocio consiste en la venta de granos básicos en su casa de habitación donde tiene 12 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Tiene tres años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado cuatro créditos para su negocio. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de maíz, frijoles y trigo.
texts.en: Julia C. is originally from the village of El Sauce. She works as trader. Her business is the sale of basic grains from her house. She has been in this line of business for 12 years. She has worked with Ceprodel for three  years and she has received four loans for her business. She requests the loan to buy corn, beans and wheat.

loans.use: Buy corn, beans, wheat

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion C. is from the village of Miaray, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 67 years old. Asuncion is widowed and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Asuncion owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector growing rubber trees. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  rubber trees wherein it produces raw rubber to make rubber products in the community. Asuncion has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Asuncion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asuncion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Asuncion is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Asuncion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima V. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 49 years old. Prima is married and has six children. Her eldest child is 28 years old and the youngest is only 10. To make a living, Prima runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Prima is working hard to sustain her children's education and to provide for the increasing needs of her household.

Prima joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Prima has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Prima is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa T. is from the village of Brgy. Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 28 years old. Vanessa is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Vanessa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Vanessa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vanessa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vanessa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Vanessa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Vanessa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 50 years old and married with two children who are 15 and 20 years old. He also takes care of two relatives who are 15 and 20 years old.  Jean is a self-employed businessman selling a variety of goods.  His business is open from 6 AM to 8 PM every day. 

Jean has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing a large quantity of biscuits and other food items, as they are highly in demand.  With the purchase of this large quantity he will also start wholesaling. In doing so, Jean hopes to earn more profits which in turn will allow him to buy a motorcycle and continue paying school fees for his two relatives as well as building a secure future for his own children.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Rukiri Tukore Group B-Ibanda

texts.en:
O. Gilva, 35 years old, pleads a cause with Rukiri Tukore group B. For 7 years now, he has been in business selling agricultural products in Rukiri-Ibanda.

Principally, he has been selling maize and coffee. The fact that he does agriculture has worked in his favor. Needless to say this has made it easier for his business as he has been selling mostly what he harvests. He says his business began when he sold off his goats. The money he got enabled him to improve his farming gardens; hence, improving his harvests. Gilva is happily married with 6 kids. He says he is going to buy more bags of coffee for resale with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more coffee for resale

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch C., 28, weaves traditional silk products, earning an income of USD 2 per day. C. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband transports fresh water to sell in the village, earning an income of USD 5 per day. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 50 on other necessary expenses every month.

C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to produce silk products.

loans.name: Miriam Marlene

texts.es: Miriam Marlene R. C. de 37 años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cabañas, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor, y así mismo junto a cuatro hijos. Miriam posee una venta de ropa para caballeros, mujeres y niños, la cual comercializa en el mercado de Sensuntepeque, lugar en el cual se ha dedicado a este oficio desde hace varios años atrás. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar ropa por mayor, de manera que surta su negocio para este año que esta por iniciar de manera que su producto llame mucho la atención a nuevos clientes. De esta manera Miriam espera aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Miriam Marlene R. C. is 37 years old and lives in Sensuntepeque, in Cabañas department.  She lives together with her husband, who works as a farmer, and her four children.  Miriam has a clothes stall where she sells men's, women's and children's clothes.  She makes her sales in Sensuntepeque market and has worked in her business there for several years.

Miriam is requesting a loan so that she can buy clothes wholesale and stock her business for this year which is about to begin.  She wants her products attract the attention of new customers.  In this way, Miriam hopes to increase her sales and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CENTRAL PATAQUEHUAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emilia; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 5 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende quinua, kiwicha, maíz entre otros cereales, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cereales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cereales al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of communal bank named "Central Pataquehuar". It is located in the district of Quiquijana, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and in the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Emilia: She is 53 years old, divorced, and the mother of 5 children. She alternates her daily activities with the sale of cereal grains. She sells quinoa seeds, kiwicha grains, corn and other cereal grains. She makes her sales itinerantly. It is through this business that she is able to support her children. She wishes to expand and improve her cereal business. She requests a loan to purchase cereal grains in wholesale. 

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of her loan.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains in wholesale.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Lon S., 27 years old, owns a kiosk in front of her house where she sells a variety of Khmer cakes. She typically makes around US$ 2 in profit each day to use for the family. She has a life partner in her husband, who works as a motor taxi driver and earns an average income $3 per day. Lon has one child who does not yet go to school. 

Lon S. says that husband always helps her buy products to sell before beginning his workday as a motor taxi driver.  Unfortunately, his existing motorbike often breaks down during use. Because of that, Lon S. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva, which she will use to replace the broken motorcycle for her husband.

loans.use: To replace broken motorcycle for her husband's taxi business

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a food vending business. She lives in Cadiz, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000. Letty is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase raw materials. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 140,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Letty aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Turunguka Group

texts.fr:
Christine K. est une commerçante âgée de 34 ans qui habite  la commune urbaine de Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce des habits appeles communément friperies au Marche de Kanyosha il ya de cela 1 an et 6 mois. Elle a fait ses études secondaires techniques jusqu’en 3e année en Comptabilité . Elle est mariée a Leonard Minani ,un commercant de matelas, et ont ensemble 6 enfants dont 4 sont a l’école. Ils prennent aussi en charge un 1 enfant de sa famille proche. Elle   arrivait au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame, mais elle intègre maintenant le crédit solidaire. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  diversifier son business en y ajoutant les produits alimentaires comme l’huile de palme, du poisson sec, et autres articles pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Elle espère  atteindre le niveau d’une grande commerçante dans l’avenir si elle ne rencontre pas encore des problèmes lies au manque de produits sur le marche.

Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« Turunguka»
texts.en: Christine K., aged 34, is a shopkeeper who lives in the urban commune of Kanyosha, in the capital Bujumbura. For a year and six months, she has had a business involving clothing, commonly called friperies (second-hand clothing), at the Kanyosha Market. She has attained the third year of trade schooling in accounting. Christine is married to Leonard Minani, a mattress seller, and together they have six children, of whom four are in school. They also support a child from the immediate family. Christine is now on her fourth community loan cycle with Turame, but she is now part of a solidarity loan. She is asking for a Kiva loan to diversify her business by including grocery items, such as palm oil, dried fish, and other item, so as to make a large profit. She aspires to the heights of a major merchant in the future if she does not encounter any more problems related to product shortages on the market. She is a member of the solidarity group “Turunguka”.

loans.use: Diversifying her business by including grocery items, such as palm oil, dried fish, and more

loans.name: Nermi

texts.es: Nermi, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jorge de 48 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado cultivar Nermi, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas trabaja en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus plátanos, cítricos y café dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve crecer abundantemente, tiene 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es el lugar donde lo vende, ya que los sacos en donde lleva los productos son muy pesados. En adelante, espera mejorar sus productos, para así poder obtener mejores precios. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuota puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar la producción de sus plantaciones.
texts.en: Nermi, 38, is a friendly, hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband, Jorge, 48, and their 3 children, in a house that they own.  She and her husband work hard to provide a better quality of life for their children.   Nermi is a farmer and the money that she earns from her land greatly help the family.  She works the farm every morning, growing platanos, citrus fruits and coffee, and she knows the quality of the crop depends on the care she takes.  What she most likes about farming is taking care of her crop and watching it grow by the day.  She's been a farmer for 10 years and says that the most difficult thing about farming is getting her crop to market.  She has to cart the crop to the town of Pichanaki because that's where she sells it, but the sacks are very heavy and difficult to move.  For the future, she wants to improve her crop so that she can ensure the best price for it.  This is Nermi's fourth MFP loan.  She knows that she has to repay it on time and is committed to doing so.  The members of her community bank consider her to be a reliable and responsible partner.  She will use this loan, for two-thousand new soles, to buy supplies of manure for improving her crop yields.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure for farming business

loans.name: Choen's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members who will each use their part of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. Mrs. Choen is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. She is a married woman who has two children who are too young to work or study. She is a pig breeder and can earn some profit to support her family while her husband, Mr. Vun, is a farmer who owns more than one-hectare plot of land where he can grow rice. He sells some part of the rice and with the rest of the rice, he supports his family. He is also a duck breeder. 

Since her husband’s business is getting on well at the present time, Mrs. Choen wants to expand it. So Mrs. Choen is applying for a loan to buy more ducks.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to raise.

loans.name: Transito Edenilson

texts.es:
Transito, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y crianza de ganado, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta labor,  trabaja todos los días de la semana y su padre fue quien le enseño el proceso, él vive con sus padres, es soltero y no tiene hijos.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, ya que para iniciar el proceso de la siembra debe tener a disponibilidad estos materiales.
Su objetivo es tener esta fuente de ingreso por un largo tiempo para ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Transito lives in "El Transito", in the department of San Miguel, and grows corn and raises livestock for a living.  He has been in this business for 10 years and works every day of the week.  His father was the one who taught him the trade.  He lives with his parents and is single, with no children.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer because he has already begun the planting process and needs the supplies available.  His goal is to have a strong source of income for a long period of time to help his parents.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
A sus 56 años de edad, Luz Estela R. B. es una emprendedora consagrada a su negocio, confección de pijamas. El oficio lo aprendió desde pequeña al lado de su madre y sus hermanas. 

Luz Estela es una luchadora incansable que espera conquistar nuevos mercados con sus pijamas hasta convertirse en una gran comercializadora no sólo en Medellín sino en todo el país. Esta emprendedora considera que su trabajo ha sido no sólo la manera de seguir adelante sino una forma de superarse después de la separación de su esposo, lo que la llenó de valor y fuerzas para luchar por lo propio. 

Actualmente Luz Estela necesita de un préstamo para comprar telas y así incrementar su capacidad de producción así como mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
At 56 years old, Luz Estela R. B. is an entrepreneur who is devoted to her business making pajamas.  She learned the trade when she was a young girl from her mother and sisters.

Luz Estela is an relentless fighter who hopes to capture new markets with her pajamas and become an important seller not only in Medellín but throughout the country.  This entrepreneur considers her work to have been not only a way of getting ahead in life but also a way of improving herself since she separated from her husband.  It filled her with courage and the strength to stand up for herself.

Luz Estrela currently needs a loan to buy fabric and thereby increase her production capacity and improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Raida

texts.en:
Raida is 30 years old and married, with two children.  Neither of her children go to school.  Raida sells sugar and cooking oil.  

Raida requests a loan to stock more sugar and cooking oil to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Julia

texts.es: Nancy es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica al  negocio de preparaciones  de pasteles,  leche asada entre otros postres que son  elaborados con la ayuda de su hijo, y son distribuidos en kioscos, colegios, bodega etc.  Donde gracias a sus esfuerzos y perseverancias le va bien en su negocio. La señora Nancy cuenta con un horno que compro con el  préstamo que solicito, gracias a ello puede elaborar con mayor cantidad y facilidad sus productos. El anhelo de Nancy es poner  una juguería en su casa y así seguir generando utilidades para su familia. Con la ayuda del crédito  solicitado piensa comprar insumos para la preparacion de sus postres como harina, leche, huevo, etc y poner una pequeña dulcería donde le permita exhibir sus productos y ya no tener que salir a repartirlos.
texts.en:
Nancy is a very hard-working woman.  She devotes herself to the business of making cakes and “leche asada” (crème caramel), among other desserts.  The desserts are made with her son’s help, and they are distributed to kiosks, schools, and grocery stores, etc.  Thanks to her efforts and perseverance, the business is going very well for her.

Nancy has an oven that she bought with the loan she requested.  Thanks to the oven, she is able to make her products in greater quantities and with more ease.  Nancy’s hope is to establish a café with a juice bar in her house.  That way she will continue generating profits for her family.  

With the help of the requested loan she plans to buy ingredients for making her desserts.  She will buy ingredients like flour, milk, and eggs, etc.  She will set up a small sweet shop where she can display her products and not have to leave to deliver them.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, and eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old single man. He has owned a furniture gallery since 2000, with 16 years of experience in this field. Ali’s  work is going just fine. He sells living room, bedrooms and dinning room furniture.

Ali is a hard worker, his clients like dealing with him because his prices are competitive. Many of his clients recommend him to others who would like to buy or change their home’s furniture.

To improve his business, Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy new furniture styles necessary to attract new customers.

He hopes this loan will improve his business in the future and he will be able to open a new branch.

loans.use: To increase his furniture collection with new styles and models.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 47 años de edad. Actualmente, Miguel vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con sus dos hijos. Miguel tiene un puesto de venta de comestibles en el centro comercial “Confraternidad”.  Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Inti Quilla” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Miguel is 47 and lives in Cusco, Perú with his two children. Miguel runs a small store in the “Confraternidad” Market, which he has managed for three years with good results.  He seeks this credit in order to increase his store's inventory of rice, sugar, pasta and other staples.  He is known to be a hard worker and is well-regarded in his community; for these reasons he was invited to participate with the communal lender “Inti Quilla” and Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to increase store inventory of rice, sugar, pasta and other food items

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, 35, is the married mother of one child. Caroline is a green grocer in Majaoni, Mombasa and her business has been in operation for the last six years. Her business has been doing well.

She is a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to expand her business by purchasing more stock of vegetables. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand her business further. Her dream is to become a successful business lady and to open a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Flor De Retamas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE RETAMAS” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Sindolfa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Sindolfa  indica que hace año y medio que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace tres años atrás. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que comprará de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración de sus productos los venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Flor de Retamas" will start its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer in the central office of Senkata.  This group has 10 members, and is led by a board of directors headed by Sindolfa.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses such as: retail trade, production and services.

Sindolfa says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for a year and a half, and joined at the invitation of a loan officer.  Now she works selling woven blankets, an activity that she has been doing for 3 years.

The loan that she will take now will increase her capital; she will purchase wool in the Ceja (a commercial area in El Alto) that she will use to make her products.  She will sell the products via advance orders.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as best she can, as she is married and has 2 children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Emmanuel, a small business entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 4,000,000 to invest in his business.  Emmanual was born in Kenema city about 30 years ago.  He is a married and has one child. 

Emmanuel runs a bar and a games centre where European football/soccer games are shown for a fee.   He will use this loan to recharge his DSTV cardd, buy chairs and fans, and do some renovations in his games centre.

loans.use: improve his games centre business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy timber for his workshop.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela de 46 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su compañero de vida en zona semi urbana,  Graciela se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo. Cuenta con muchos años de dedicarse a este negocio y gracias a Dios y su trabajo ha logrado mantenerlo activo y sacarle el fruto de su esfuerzo. La mayoria de sus clientes son empleados de oficinas de la ciudad en la que vive, es decir cuenta con cartera fija, también ocasionalmente va al mercado regional de donde vive y promueve sus productos. Ella es una mujer con muchas metas y entregada en  su trabajo. Muchas personas le tienen confianza y la prefieren ya que siempre cuenta con las mejores promociones en los artículos que ofrece. Ella además se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos de engorde en su casa, a fin de generar mas ingresos a su hogar. En esta ocasión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar mayor variedad de productos de belleza y del cuidado personal de sus clientes.- Todo esto lo hace  con el fin de aumentar su nivel de ventas y de ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Graciela, 46, lives in her own house with her life partner in a semi-urban area.  Graciela has sold cosmetics by catalog for many years.  Thanks to God and her job, she has been able to keep her business active and profit from her effort.  The majority of her customers are office workers in the city where she lives, so she has a steady clientele.  She also occasionally goes to the regional market where she lives and promotes her products.

Graciela is a woman with many goals who is committed to her work.  Many people trust her and prefer her, since she always has the best deals on the articles she sells.  She also buys and sells broiler chickens in her home to generate more income.

Graciela has made the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to buy a greater variety of beauty and personal care products for her customers.  She is doing this with the goal of increasing her sales and income, which will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lotion, and face and body creams.

loans.name: Procelda

texts.en:
Procelda is 39 years old and married. She has 3 children ageds11, 8 and 3. Procelda is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Procelda also raises pigs in her backyard.

Procelda has requested a loan to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tania Carolina

texts.es:
Tania, solicita nuevamente un préstamo, porque lo necesita para incrementar su negocio para tener variedad y tener más clientes, y aumentar en sus ganancias; comprara mariscos en distintas especies, pescado, camaron, filetes.
Ella ha logrado mantenerse en el negocio a traves de los prestamos, ya que son oportunos y rapidos.
texts.en: Tania requests a new loan because she needs it to grow her business in order to have more variety and more clients and to increase her profits. She will buy different types of shellfish, fish, shrimp, and fillets. She has been able to stay in business due these loans, since they are timely and fast.

loans.use: to buy seafood like shellfish, fish, shrimp, and fillets

loans.name: Odili

texts.es: Odili se dedica a la venta de cosméticos ambúlate. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio. Tiene 1 hijo de cuatro años a su cargo, pues la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan diferentes pedidos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cremas, tratamientos, shampoo, polvos, perfumes entre otras cosas. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y al mismo tiempo obtener nuevos clientes y al mismo tiempo proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Odili sells cosmetics from door to door. She has had this business for more than three years. She has one four year-old son in her care.  The majority of her customers place various orders with her.  

The purpose of the loan is to buy creams, treatments, shampoo, powders, and other beauty products. She dreams of expanding her business, obtaining new customers and making improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy creams, treatments, shampoos, powders, perfumes and other beauty products.

loans.name: Entesar

texts.en:
Entesar is a 35-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of four children. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to do maintenance for her home.

An aspiration of Entesar's is to improve her house and renew her home appliances.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home.

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es:
Laureana pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación provincia de Manu departamento de Madre de Dios. 

Laureana tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Sicuani y desde hace 20 años vive en la ciudad de Salvación y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura donde siembre plátanos, piñas y otras frutas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Laureana requiere el préstamo para plantar plátanos y piñas. 

Laureana agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Laureana belongs to the community bank "Tesoritos del Manu" (Manu's Little Treasures) and meetings take place every 30 days in the city of Salvacion, in the province of Manu in the state of Madre de Dios.

Laureana is 44 years old, married and has two children.  She was born in the city of Sicuani and has lived in the city of Salvación for 20 years where she carries out her economic activities.  Her main economic activity is banana, pineapple and other fruit farming.  She’s been in this business for several years and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

On this occasion Laureana needs the loan to plant bananas and pineapples.  Laureana is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to plant bananas and pineapples.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 21 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica. Es soltera, vive en compañía de su hermano de 14 años de edad, su tío, su abuelo, su madre, su padrastro y su primo, habitando la casa que es de propiedad de su madre. La actividad que realiza Ana es la venta de cervezas, para lo cual cuenta con una congeladora en su propia casa, en donde puede guardar su producto a la temperatura que le agrada a su público consumidor. Tiene  4 años dedicándose a esta actividad, y contando con la ayuda de su tío en la venta del producto a los clientes. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le genera, y poder apoyar a su familia con algunos gastos, también le gusta el tiempo libre que tiene y lo puede usar en otras actividades como el estudio. Tiene planes de crecer su negocio y convertirse en una distribuidora. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con el crédito recibido. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser personas comprometidas con sus obligaciones y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza en mayor cantidad, buscando menores precios, así podrá tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
21-year old Ana is a dynamic, hardworking woman. She is single and lives with her 14-year old brother, her uncle, her grandfather, her stepfather, and her cousin in a house that belongs to her mother.

Ana earns her living selling beer which she keeps in a fridge in her house so that it remains at the right temperature for her customers. She’s been doing this job for four years; her uncle helps with sales to her customers. Ana really enjoys earning an income as it enables her to help her family with various expenses. She also enjoys the free time she has to do other activities such as studying. 

Ana plans to expand the business and become a distributor. This will be her second loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the money she has received. She enjoys working with the members of her community bank as they are committed and supportive. With the money from the loan she plans to buy large quantities of beer, always seeking the lowest price so that she will earn the best profit possible.

loans.use: to buy cases of beer

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. Her husband is a teacher who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Margaret has operated a clothes-selling business for the past four years; her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of low sales in some months. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the loan for 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase more clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loan facilities.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, está muy satisfecho con  la compra de mercancías, telas calzado masculino,  femenino y deportivo que hizo con su anterior financiamiento, porque todo lo vendió y ganó descuentos. En la actualidad con su nuevo crédito comprará juguetería y ropa para responder la época decembrina que se avecina. Su inversión será exitosa porque está basada en la solicitud que hicieron sus clientes de mercancías que él comprará en descuentos. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Que sigan apoyándonos con sus credikiva, que de esta forma nosotros, que somos un renglón importante en la economía, podemos ayudar al crecimiento del país. “
texts.en: Rafael is applying for a new Kiva loan.  He is very happy with the merchandise (men's, women's and sports shoes) which he bought with his previous loan.  He sold everything and earned discounts.  He will use this current loan to buy toys and clothes to respond to the season which is approaching in December.  His investment will be successful because it is based on his customers' demand for merchandise which he will buy at discounted prices.  His message to Kiva lenders is the following: "Please continue supporting us with your Kiva loans.  We are an important link in our country's economy and can help our country to grow".

loans.use: to buy toys and clothes to respond to the December season

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena integrante del grupo del Banco comunal “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 9 años. Además trabaja de manera dependiente en una fábrica.
La mercadería que vende generalmente es de acuerdo a la temporada del año y durante todo el año también se dedica a vender ropa interior. 
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Arica, al norte de Chile. Su hija vive en ésta ciudad, por lo que aprovecha de viajar tres veces al año para surtir su negocio con ropa y productos de bazar, entre llaveros accesorios para dama y niños. Comenta que los precios para comerciantes son muy convenientes. 
El horario que utiliza para su negocio es totalmente flexible, ya que distribuye sus tiempos de acuerdo al horario de su trabajo dependiente.
Además cuenta con un gran número de clientes, quienes realizan sus pedidos, cuando María Elena le corresponde viajar para comprar su mercadería.
Con el crédito comprará ropa exclusiva y al por mayor, aprovechará de visitar a su hija para Año nuevo y comprará su mercadería.
Una de sus metas son independizarse e instalarse con un local establecido, en lo posible tener un bazar o una boutique.
Ella vive junto a su marido y sus sueños son prosperar en su negocio.
María Elena está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio e incrementarlo.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía y apoyo del grupo del Banco comunal, del cual forma parte. Comenta que es un grupo muy comprometido y responsable. 
Por su parte las capacitaciones le han servido para organizar la contabilidad de su negocio. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
María Elena is a member of the communal bank “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” of Talca.  She has sold new clothing for 9 years and also works as a clerk in a factory.  She generally sells clothing according to the season and she sells underwear throughout the year.

She buys the merchandise in Arica, a city in the north of Chile.  Her daughter lives there and she takes advantage of that to travel to Arica three times a year to supply her business with clothing and bazaar products such as women’s and children’s key chains.  She says that the prices there for merchants are very good.
Her work schedule is totally flexible since she fits it around her hours as a clerk.
She also has many customers who give her orders and María Elena fills them when she travels to buy the merchandise.
She will use the money to buy exclusive clothing wholesale and will visit her daughter for New Years when she buys the merchandise.
One of her goals is to be independent and set up a permanent stand and possibly to have a bazaar or a boutique.  She lives together with her husband and her dreams are to prosper in the business.
María Elena  is very happy and appreciative for the help offered her by Fondo Esperanza since it has allowed her to invest in her business and expand it.  She also feels very comfortable with the company and the assistance of the communal bank of which she is a member.  She says that it is a very committed and responsible group and  the trainings have helped her organize the accounting in her business.

Talca is in the Maule region, located in the center of the country.  It is the commercial and cultural center of the region since it is the most important of the Chilean central valley.   There is a curious reference in Chile about Talca, the phrase “Talca, Paris and London”.  Some say it originates with the English saying, “Talca looks like London” because of the thick fog that frequently covers the city in the winter, as in the capitol of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy exclusive clothing wholesale

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna is 36 years old. She is married and has three daughters and a son. Her two elder daughters do decorative embroidery and the other two children are getting their education.
 
Her husband is a master tailor and Amna is an embroidery expert. She does embroidery on clothes for her neighboring clients and earns reasonably good profits. Now her two daughters also work with her and support her in completing the orders on time. 

Amna has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s tailoring business. With the loan investment, he will buy a new sewing machine and will also hire a worker for his assistance. This will allow him to complete the orders on time and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for the past many years and Amna is confident about his success after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and hire an assistant

loans.name: Mirna Jannette

texts.es:
Mirna Jannette, de 48 años de edad, casada desde hace 22 años, su esposo es mecánico industrial, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 19 años de edad, vive en Cofradia, Cortes.
Doña Mirna muy trabajadora, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a vender productos Helados como ice crean, conos, paletas y otros. su producto tiene bastante demanda, todo este tiempo ha logrado obtener los ingresos que necesita en el hogar. Vende desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 10.00 p.m. ha solicitado este préstamo de L.5,000.00 para invertir en productos que no tenia, como paletas y ice crean en panitas.
Ella esta contenta por el financiamiento ya que con esto va incrementar sus ventas
texts.en: Mirna Jannette, 48, has been married for 22 years; her husband’s an industrial mechanic and she has two children who are 12 and 19 years old.  She lives in Cofradía, Cortes.  Mirna is very hardworking.  She’s been selling frozen treats like ice-cream, ice-cream cones, popsicles and others for fifteen years; her products are in very high demand.  During all this time she’s managed to obtain the income she needs for her home.  She sells from 10am until 10pm and has asked for this L.5,000.00 loan to invest in products she needs like popsicles and ice-cream cups.  She is happy about the loan because this will help her increase sales.

loans.use: to stock up on frozen treats.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezl is 40 years old and lives in Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Liezl has a dried fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 

Leizl has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Otrra Oportunidad Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras que una de ellas se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 1 años, tiene 21 años de edad con hijo y madre soltera, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pacas de ropa usada, Scarleth vende comida y cerveza y Jeannette tiene una venta de fritanga.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising women. One of them has worked selling second-hand clothing for a year. She is 21 years old, and is a single mother with a son. She will use the loan to buy bales of used clothing. Scarleth sells food and beer and Jeanette sells fried foods.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melinie aged 46 years. She is married with 5 children aged between 4 and 19 years. 4 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 9 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees of her children. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.
