For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
The lack of capital has been a great worry in the life of Teresa, a woman who is dedicated in body and soul to agriculture. For the past ten year, she has been actively involved in mixed farming. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows. She is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cows, she is able to get between 10-15 litres of milk a day, and this helps her support her family. Teresa also practices crop farming. She has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements. This is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through this loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profit levels. Teresa is very visionary. Her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Teresa believes that through this loan, she will be able to turn around her family's life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Teresa’s way out of poverty.
You can be part of Teresa's story. Please lend now.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Isack

texts.en: Isack lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam.He is married and has six children. Two of his sons are in secondary school.Isack keeps chickens and cows.Alongside keeping animals,Isack grows vegetables.He uses manures from animals for vegetables growing.He has been in this business for five years now.Isack is worried in this coming rain season.Animals and vegetables are frequently attacked by deseases during rains.He need a sufficient stock of insectcides.He couldn’t managed  buying by himself because he recently paid school fees for his elder son.Isack is in need of USD 400 to have enough stock of insecticides

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase freezer

loans.name: Lai

texts.en: Lai's husband died and she must work hard to support her family. She wants a loan of $75 to raise a cow to get more income for her family. She will pay back it during 7 months.

loans.use: Lai wants to buy a cow to support her family since her husband died.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela is married and has 3 kids of 16, 18 and 20 years of age. Due to a lack of work in Mexico, her husband decided to go to the USA to work. Their kids were young and in order to meet their everyday needs Estela decided to start her own business 15 years ago. She offered her services as a seamstress, and her love of doing this has helped her to go far. She started making clothes for relatives and she soon acquired an industrial sewing machine with which she was able to increase production. Fortunately she has a lot of clients and she makes some school uniforms.

Estela's effort has helped her to grow as a micro-businesswoman and she now has a lot of demand for school uniforms. It is because of this that she is asking for a loan of $475 which she will use to buy materials. She will repay the amount over a period of 6 months. Today you can help someone who really needs it. Estela and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Estela es casada y tiene tres hijos de 16, 18 y 20 años de edad. Ante la falta de empleo en México, su esposo decidió irse a trabajar a Estados Unidos, sus hijos estaban pequeños y para poder cubrir sus necesidades básicas Estela decidió comenzar su propio negocio hace quince años, ofreciendo sus servicios de costurera, su gusto por este oficio le ha permitido sobresalir, empezó elaborando ropa para sus familiares y poco después adquirió una máquina industrial con la que ha podido incrementar su producción, afortunadamente hoy cuenta con muchos clientes y maquila uniformes para algunas escuelas.

El esfuerzo de Estela la ha llevado a crecer como microempresaria y ahora tiene mucha demanda de uniformes escolares por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien mas lo necesita, Estela y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy materials/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Martha Isabell

texts.es:
Martha Isabel M. and her husband, who works as an assistant at a rehab center, had fixed stable income from with both of their salaries. However, one day, Martha was laid off from her job. She was left with payments to make for her living costs and rent. Little by little, with her husband's help, she started to buy some material to make floral arrangements and sold them amongst her neighbors. Slowly, she was soon able to make a business to help make payments.

Martha needs a loan of $375 to buy material to make her products so she can sell them on "Día de Muertos" holiday (Day of the Dead), when many people buy arranged flowers. With your help, Martha will be able to advance and bring up her family as desired.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha Isabel M. y su esposo, quien trabaja como asistente en un centro de rehabilitación, tenían un ingreso asegurado con los sueldos de los dos, sin embargo u día sin esperarlo, hubo un recorte de personal en su empresa y Martha se quedó desempleada, con unos gastos en el hogar que tenía que pagar. Así fue como poco a poco y con la ayuda de su esposo que comenzó a comprar material para elaborar arreglos florales y venderlos entre sus vecinos. Y así poco a poco se fue haciendo se un negocio para poder ayudar en los gastos del hogar.

Martha necesita un préstamo de US $375 para poder comprar material para elaborar sus productos y sí poder tener qué vender este día de muertos que es cuándo más compra la gente arreglos florales. Con tu ayuda Martha podrá salir adelante, y así poder formar la familia que tanto a deseado.

loans.use: to buy material to make crafts

loans.name: Samey's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. U. Samey was selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are five families, including hers.

1-Mrs. U. Samey (on the left of the photo are Samey and her son) has been a widow for more than 16 years, and she has six sons and three daughters. She is currently in the business of buying and selling many kinds of materials for recycling. She began this business in 2002. Previously, she was in the business of selling fruit at home and being employed to harvest rice for villagers. All of her children are living under her custody. However, some of her children are employed. Two sons work as construction workers and one daughter works at the garment factory. Three are studying and the other children stay at home. She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $200. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike.

2- Mrs. SOEURNG Sothea (Sothea and her husband are pictured next to Samey’s son) got married in 1998 and has two sons and one daughter. She has been in the business of planting and selling vegetables since 2005. She is currently planting vegetables in her village and bringing the products to sell at Prek Ho market. Her husband, Mr. Pol Sopheap, has been a construction worker for four years. She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $100. She will use this money to expand her business of planting and selling vegetables.

3- Mrs.T. Sokhom (Sokhom and her husband are next to Sothea’s husband) married in 1984 and has three sons and two daughters. She has been in the business of planting, purchasing, and reselling vegetables since 1979. She plants vegetables in her village, and also purchases thE. from villagers. She then resell those products at Ta Khmao market. Her husband, Mr. San Sophal, has been a construction contractor since 1984. Sometimes, he makes a contract for construction work with people in his community and in other villages as well. She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $200. She will use this money to expand her business by purchasing more vegetables from villagers to resell at Ta Khmao market.

4- Mr. E. Sophea (Sophea and his wife are pictured next to Sokhom’s husband) married in 2000, and has one son. He has been rU. a motor taxi business in Phnom Penh city since 2004. In the morning, he transports his neighbor, who lives in the same village, to the market. He leaves home early in the morning and returns in the late evening. He is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $100. He will use this money to repair his motorbike so that he can provide better service for passengers.

5-Mrs. KhU. Sarin (Sarin and her husband are pictured next to Sophea) married in 1957 and has two sons. She has been purchasing and reselling vegetables for the last 12 years. She is currently purchasing vegetables from villagers and taking thE. to resell at Prek Ho market. Her husband, Mr. Prak Thul, is a disabled person and stays at home. Her two sons live under her custody, however, they are employed. One works as a construction worker and another one works at the garment factory. She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $100. She will use this money to expand her business by purchasing more vegetables from villagers to resell at Prek Ho market.

loans.use: To repair a motorbike and purchase vegetables for reselling.

loans.name: Epasia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 46 year-old Epasia M.. She is married with four children, aged 6,16,18, and 23. In 2004 Epasia established a business selling fish, and now requests a loan of $350 in order to purchase additional stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is an organization that is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania. Through leasing and leaseback, SELFINA provides a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. As they lack tangible collateral assets, they are termed not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment. The process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk.

loans.name: Arturo Armando

texts.es:
Mr. Arturo F.' business is a cell phone repair shop located in his own locale outside of the market Santa Ana in the beautiful city of Chinandega. He started the business 3 years ago with a capital of one thousand dollars to buy the tools, displays, and set up his locale.

He started this business because he needed to marry his wife, and when their two children were born, he had the need to have his own profession that would yield the income necessary to support his household. This is the reason that Arturo acquired these spare parts and display cabinet to set up his business.

His greatest need right now is investing in his business (infrastructure), so he went to Ceprodel so he could benefit from loans, which will help him improve his locale and support his family. He has a record of 18 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica el Señor Arturo F. es a la reparación de celulares ubicado en un local propio en las afueras del mercado Santa Ana en la bella ciudad de Chinandega. Su negocio lo inicia hace 3 años con un capital de Un mil Dólares para la compra de las herramientas, vitrinas y acondicionamiento de su local.

Comienza este negocio por la necesidad de que al contraer matrimonio con su esposa y al nacer sus 2 hijos debia de tener un oficio propio que le brindara ingresos para su hogar. Por este motivo es que Arturo adquiere estos repuestos y vitrina para ubicar su negocio.

Su mayor necesidad actualmente es la inversión en su negocio (infraestructura) por lo que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con Créditos que le sirvan para mejorar su localidad y a la vez mantener su núcleo familiar. El tiene un record de 18 créditos.

loans.use: Cell phone repair (Reparación de celulares)

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is an energetic young man who is interested in building a poverty-free family. Married with a child, Ibrahim started his business five years ago on a very small scale. He purchases the items he sells on credit from a supplier which increases his costs, leaving him with minimal profit.

With several loans from SMT, Ibrahim began to build his own capital. His capital adequacy is now enough to purchase half of his stock with cash and the other half on credit.

Ibrahim is requesting a loan of US$ 1200. This, he says, will finally free him from purchasing goods on credit which generates less profit. He is happy that this loan will enable him to stop paying his hard earned profits to his creditors.

loans.use: begin purchasing his goods with cash

loans.name: Roudayna

texts.en: Roudayna is 36 years old and lives with her family in a town in south Lebanon known as Nabatieh. She works as an agent, selling plastic containers for a living. This is the first time Roudayna has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. She will use it to buy the inventory she needs to maintain and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell to her customers

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama S. is a carpenter, single but responsible for one child. His workshop is in Camberene in a very well-placed location and he is asking for a loan to purchase wood to build a wardrobe which he plans to sell.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Adama S. est un menuisier, célibataire avec un enfant en charge.Son atelier se trouve à Camberene dans un local très bien placé et il sollicite un prêt pour acheter du bois pour la construction d’une armoire qu’il va vendre.

loans.use:
purchase wood to build a wardrobe to sell

Acheter du bois pour construction d’une armoire qu’il va vendre

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.en: K. Nozigul has been running her business for six years. She is 37 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a farmer. To help her husband support the family and provide the best future for her children, she has a trading place in the market where she sells seeds.   She began this small business because she didn’t have a job and she needed to find an activity to support her family and provide her children with an education. Working 8 hours a day, 6 days a week, she earns about 70 $ US Dollars every month from this business. Now Nozigul requests a loan 300 $ US Dollars within 6 months to purchase additional seeds to increase her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to sell.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa B. is a young shopkeeper who lives in the Grand Thiès neighborhood. He has been married for some time and manages a grocery store. He has already received a loan from Kiva, which he fully repaid. With this new loan, he would like to increase his supply of merchandise in order to earn a more consistent profit.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Moussa B. est un jeune commerçant qui vit au quartier Grand Thiès ; il est marié depuis quelques temps et gère une boutique de denrées alimentaires. Il a eu à bénéficier d'un prêt avec Kiva qu'il a remboursé avec succés. Avec ce prêt il veut renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de réaliser des bénéfices plus consistants.

loans.use: Increase his supply of merchandise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria O. is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria with her family. Gloria  sells women's wrappers. Gloria enjoys doing her business. She learned this business for 5 years and she started her own business in 1995. She needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more women's wrappers for sale. Gloria is a LAPO client. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more women's wrappers for sale

loans.name: Bibiroy

texts.ru: Давлатова Бибирой жительница района Яван. Возраст 50 лет, вдова , имеет 5 детей. Бибирой занимается пошивом женской одежды. Имеет опыт в этой деяйтельности более 12 лет. Этот бизнес помогает содержать ей свою большую семьюь.Дети Бибирой еще учатся в средней школе. В данный момент клиентка хочет купить более современную швейную машинку.Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 9 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bibiroy D. lives in Yavan. She is 50 years old, a widow, and has five children. Bibiroy tailors women’s clothes. She has been doing this for more than twelve years. This business helps to support her large family. Bibiroy’s children are still in high school. Now, the client wants to buy a more modern sewing machine. Therefore, she has decided to take out a loan for nine months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a sewing machine

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Srta. Norma L. de 43 años de edad vive en la casa de sus padres a quienes les cuida y se responsabiliza de ellos ya que son muy adultos ya.

La señorita Norma empezó el negocio hace 3 años con un capital que consiguió trabajando en el extranjero donde estuvo trabajando por 4 años, empezó con una mercería y con el correr del tiempo lo convirtió en una ropería.

El sueño de Norma es que su negocio crezca cada día y con eso aumentar sus ingresos mensuales, para que el día de mañana pueda llevar una vida más cómoda.

Solicita este préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como jeans, remeras, calzados deportivos, carteras, conjunto de buzos, camisa, desodorantes, ropa interior, bijouterie, zapatillas, perfumes en general. Así aumentará su Stock de mercaderías y ofrecer de esta forma variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Norma Lopez is 43 years old and lives in the house of her parents, who she takes care of and is responsible for, as they are elderly.

Ms. Norma started her business 3 years ago with money she earned working abroad, where she worked for 4 years. She began with a hardware store and, with the passage of time, converted it to a clothing store.

Norma's dream is that her business will grow every day and, with this, will increase her monthly income so that tomorrow can bring a more comfortable life.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as jeans, t-shirts, tennis shoes, wallets, track suits, shirts, deodorants, underwear, jewelry, footware, and perfume. With this she will increase her stock of merchandise and in this way offer more variety to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as jeans, t-shirts, tennis shoes, wallets, track suits, deodorants, underwear, jewelry, footware, and perfume

loans.name: Mun

texts.en: Mrs. Mun P. lives in Kor village in Kandal Province. She is 40-year-old widow of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory; the other four children attend the local school. Mrs. Mun P. owns a plot of land and cultivates rice to earn her living. Although Mrs. Mun P. and her two children have jobs, they do not have enough money to support their expenses. Mrs. Mun Phal would like a loan of $500 to buy pigs and rice seed. She hopes this loan will increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pigs and rice seed.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs S. lives in Hung Yen commune, Hung Nguyen district, Nghe An province. She is 45 years old and has five children, two in school. She is a member of TYM since 2002. Her main income comes from raising pigs. Her husband is a physician and her son is a worker, so her family’s income is stable. But she would like to have more income to secure her children's future, so she is requesting a loan to expand her pig-raising business.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and and pig food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Medical Supplies

loans.name: Hoang Thi Loan` Group

texts.vi:
Hoàng Thị Loan sinh năm 1976( Mã số: 010107050014 )  hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học tại thôn Văn Thượng. Gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, ngoài ra chị còn đi chợ, chồng đi làm thuê( phu hồ, xây,…). Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ với mục đích đi chợ. Cùng vay vốn với chị còn có:
 Nguyễn Thị Tiền sinh năm 1972( Mã số: 010107050013), tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ với mục đích mua giống cây cảnh về trồng và bán.
 Hoàng Thị Hằng sinh năm 1982( Mã số: 010107050015 ), gia đình chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ,
 Đặng Thị V. sinh năm 1950( Mã số: 010107050012), thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi.
 Đào Thị Ánh sinh năm 1976( Mã số: 010107050016)  . Hàng ngày chị thường đi mua trứng đem ra chợ bán, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ.

loans.use: small retail business

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr:
A. Adjoavi est une demoiselle très dynamique qui fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle habite le quartier d’agoè démakpo et fait ce commerce depuis 2005, son lieu d’approvisionnement est le grand marché de lomé. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de wages et sollicite un prêt de 150000F pour s’acheter des marchandises pour les besoins de son commerce. 
Elle n’est pas mariée mais elle a deux enfants qui sont à sa charge
texts.en:
Adjoavi A. is a very energetic young woman who's been selling food staples since 2005. She lives in the Agoè Démakpo neighborhood, and gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. She never got a loan from Wages before, and she's now seeking a loan of XOF 150'000 (ca US$ 300) to buy supplies for her business. She's not married but has two children to support.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resells staples

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena B. is 53 years old and married to Primitivo. She is a mother of four:  Edwin, 33 years old, now a security guard in Manila, Eduardo, 27 years old, also a security guard; Mylene, 31 years old, a plain housewife; and the youngest is Primitivo B. Jr., 23 years old, who also works in Manila. Elena and husband sacrifice the long distance between them and their three male children who are all working in Manila but the distance encouraged them to live out of their own way since her only daughter already had her own family in Barangay Del Pilar Alicia, Isabela, too.

Elena used to manage a food vending business for almost 30 years but due to some bad circumstances, she had lost business capital but still thankful for she retained her village store business that had served as their source of income since they no longer work in the farm due to their age and it has been of great help to her family. Her weekly income out from the business is PHP700. Major parts of the generated amount are being rolled into the store since they no longer have children to send to school. Elena also wants to borrow a loan amounting to PHP5,000 to purchase more stocks which paves her way to sustain the business so they will not depend on her children’s support when get weak.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks

loans.name: Nga Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Nga năm nay 52 tuổi, ở Mê Linh - Hà Nội. Chị có hai con đều đã lớn  và đã đi làm. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2001, hiện nay thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị là 6.000.000/tháng với nguồn thu chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi bò và lương thợ xây cảu các con. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 10.000.000 để mua thêm bò về nuôi nhằm tạo thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nga Thi N. is a 52 years old woman in Me Linh, Hanoi. Both of her two children are construction workers. Mrs. N. joined the TYM fund in 2001 and borrowed money to raise cows. At the moment her family’s income of about 6,000,000 VND per month comes from her business and her children’s salary. She wants to borrow 10,000,000 VND to buy more cows.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more cows

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en:
Wassim is a 33 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Wassim has been working as a taxi driver for nine years. He requested a loan of 1,300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car that he uses as a taxi. Wassim has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

Wassim got into this work because he wants to increase his family’s income. When he first started, he didn’t have the start-up capital. His previous loan helped him improve his business, which caters to all kinds of clients. In the future, he plans to grow his taxi business.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his taxi.

loans.name: Uy

texts.en:
Mrs. Uy R. is 45 years old, married, and blessed with five childR.. Four of Mrs. R.'s childR. are single and the other one is married. Three of her single childR. are employed, working in different jobs. Mrs. R.'s husband, Mr. Pay, is 50 years old and works as a community consultant adviser and as a local farmer as well.

Presently, Mrs. R. raises animals for sale in a stall behind her house. Besides her work, she is also the best housewife. She cooks tasty meals for the family and cares for the childR.. Mrs. R. will use the loan for the business operations, to buy piglets to raise and to pay for plowing farmland. The family lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and to pay for plowing farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a crusher for palm nuts

loans.name: Samina Ashiq Ali Group

texts.en:
Samina baji is the wife of A. A. and they live in Borewala, Pakistan. They feel themselves lucky to be a part of a city which is famous for its shrines. Samina baji operates a clothes-sewing business. She does this work to pay off the utilities.

Her husband is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver with three years experience. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw because its repair has become essential otherwise its engine becomes seized.

Samina baji is the group leader of two other women from her locality:

Jamila baji wants a loan to buy items (chairs, scissors and creams) for her barber shop.

Irshad baji wants a loan to buy ice to sell.

loans.use: To repair her husband's auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Mohammad Nahim

texts.en:
Mohammad Nahim is the son of K. W.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 52 and father of 6 children. He has been working as a farmer for more than 10 years and he is a really hard working man. He is very interested in his business and grows different kinds of seeds to have a harvested land. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for purchasing seeds that are not available in his land. 
He would like to say that the small loan process is really effective for business progress.

loans.use: Buying new kinds of seeds.

loans.name: Parveen Muhammad Arif Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is a wife of M. A. who is a driver by profession. He has had five years of experience in this profession. and can drive every type of vehicle very easily. They both are very active persons and have been citizens of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods.

Parveen baji operates an embroidered-clothes business to share the financial burden of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor-vehicle) for her husband so he earns a good income as driver of his own vehicle. 

In the photo, Parveen baji is showing her embroidered dress.

This group loan consists of four additional people:

Razia baji and Parveen baji each want a loan to repair their auto-rickshaws.

Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy vehicle wheels to sell.

Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy materials (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food-selling business.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Loko Group

texts.en:
Here are Abie N., Fatmata M., Isatu K. and Marie C.. They call their group Loko Group, named after their tribe. This will be the first loan this group is accessing from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses by adding more goods to their businesses. This will enable them to make better profit so that they can better meet their children’s academic, nutritional and medical needs. 

Abie N. (left) is the leader of this group. Abie was born in Gbemdembu village about fifteen miles from Makeni city. She is married to a road constructor and they have three children. Abie and her husband have to work hard to pay school fees and other school-related charges for their three children who are still attending school. Abie has been selling fire-wood and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) for the past seventeen years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Greetings from K. LOUSE  in Gasabo District, Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda . KABHIRE is 44, married, and has 7 children: 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, 9, and 5 years old. She also take care of another person who is 23.

She has owned a spare parts shop  for 3 years and employs 1 person to help run the business.  She works every day from 7:30 a.m. to 18:00 p.m. and earns a profit of approximately 250,000 Rwandan Francs per month .  She requests a loan of 500000 Rwf and with the increased profits, K. hopes to  expand her business.

loans.use: Expanding her store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 33 years old and married with a child. She sells jewelry in front of her house. She has been in this business for the past 3 years. She hopes for the loan amount of 60,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more jewelry to sell; she says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: 29 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
"Hương N. Thị (192) is a 39-year-old woman who lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. Hương is the leader of a 6-member loan group that is sponsored by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 29 (029 - Nam Ngạn).

Hương is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Hương makes and sells a variety of food products in the local community. Hương has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hương has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1963500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will be used to expand her business. This will be Hương's third loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. P. Thị T.nh (193) is a 30 year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

2. N. Thị Tuyết  (191) is a 52 year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

3. C. Thị Duyên (190) is a 45 year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her food stall.

4. M. Thị Phượng (189) is a 38 year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

5. N. Thị Sáu (258) is a 45 year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her general store.

* Mrs. Thinh does not appear in the picture because she was in the hospital giving birth to her youngest child. 





About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.




*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.




Hương N. Thị (192) là 39 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Hương là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 29 (029 - Nam Ngạn).




Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hương thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hương kiếm được khoảng 4000000 VND. Vào 2008, Hương đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hương đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,963,500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.




Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.




Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:




1. P. Thị T.nh (193) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.




2. N. Thị Tuyết  (191) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.




3. C. Thị Duyên (190) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.




4. M. Thị Phượng (189) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.




5. N. Thị Sáu (258) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.




Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.




*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en: Genevieve V. is from the village of Mauswagon. She is 50 years old. Genevieve is married and has 1 child. To make a living, Genevieve owns & operates a business venture.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling grocery items. Genevieve has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities. In 2000, Genevieve joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genevieve has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Genevieve is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery supplies. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Genevieve from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: Additional grocery items for her grocery store

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 46 years old, is married to Cornelio B., and they are blessed with four children: Marvin - 21 years old, fourth year college student at Isabela State University; Maybel - 16 years of age, a high school graduate; Morena - 15 years of age, in fourth year high school at Villa Concepcion National High School, and Mark Carlo - 7 years old, a grade one pupil. Their house is located near the Barangay hall and elementary school.

Myrna has managed a typical village store for almost a year now, earning a daily net income PHP 500.00. Her husband, who works as an electrician, a farmer, and a private driver, earns PHP 1,000.00 for each trip. Myrna is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000.00 from KIVA lenders for the additional requirements of her business. She is hopeful that the loan will result in increased income from her store.

loans.use: Additional capital in her retail store

loans.name: Starch Factory B1 Mirriam Owor Group

texts.en: Mirriam O. is 24 years old and married with 2 children, one of whom is in school, and she also has 1 dependent. She has dealt with tailoring services so far for 3 years and provides sewing services. She does not have enough capital, whereby she cannot purchase material for making dresses and other designs for sale. She is requesting the loan to purchase material. She hopes her business is going to be boosted because she is targeting the Christmas season. Mirriam is a business lady whose dream is to educate her children, and she wishes to raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase material for making different designs for sale

loans.name: Mercilita

texts.en:
Mercilita L. is from the village of Bobontugan, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. Mercilita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mercilita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Mercilita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mercilita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercilita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her store's product offering. This will be the first loan taken out by Mercilita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Mr. Julie A. has been married to Ruth since 2004. Their four-year-old child adds joy to his little family. He wants to make a happy home and to save for his child’s future.

To provide income for the family, he ventured into rice farming. He tills his farm with patience. Julie also shared that he is in need of financial assistance for his farm. He asked to borrow 12,000 PHP. He will use this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and farm supplies. This loan will also help Julie save for his child’s future.

loans.use: Farm supplies, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djekafo sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Fantombougou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de commerce. 
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’avoir constamment un appui financier pour leurs activités. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été correctement remboursés. 
Quant à l’utilisation du nouveau prêt, elles  comptent acheter,  une grande quantité de céréales et des condiments alimentaires. 
Les condiments sont achetés le plus souvent en gros à Bamako et les céréales sont achetées dans le village et environnants et  le tout est revendu au marché aux clients venant de Bamako pour les céréales et aux résidents pour les condiments alimentaires.  
Elles estiment réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 50.000FCFA  par mois. Les bénéfices sont partagés entre la nourriture,  la santé et  les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Djekafo group are married women of an average age of 46, with an average of four children. They live with their husband and children in large traditional families in the village of Fantombougou, in the subprefecture of Fana,which is found in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. They met through neighbours and through their business activities. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation in the hope of having constant financial support for their business activities. The women are on their tenth group loan and all previous ones have been successfully repaid. They intend to use their new loan in order to buy a large volume of cereals and food condiments. The condiments are usually bought in bulk at the Bamako market, and the cereals are bought from the village and neighbouring areas. Everything is sold at the market to customers who come from Bamako for their cereals, and condiments are sold to local residents. The women hope to make an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA each; profits are distributed between food, health and business activities.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals and condiments.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. G. is fifty-three years old and married with three adult children. Her husband is in the same business and they hope to buy a plot and build their home. Her business is located at Mukuru Kwa Njenga in Nairobi where she has been selling timber to the local constructors for the last five years.

Her major challenge is the lack of enough funds, and that's why she is requesting a loan to buy more beams and timber to grow her business, open another timber yard and buy a lorry to enable her to supply her products to more customers. Mary is hardworking, disciplined, honest and caring.

loans.use: More beams and timber

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La señora Rosalina I. se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y que siempre se ha preocupado por el bienestar de su familia. Trabaja arduamente en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua atendiendo su pulpería donde ofrece todo tipo de productos que son comercializados a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

La razón por la que está solicitando el crédito es para la compra de los productos para la pulpería tales como los comestibles, productos personales, entre otros. Con el crédito se beneficia grandemente y beneficia a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosalina I. is known for being a hardworking woman who is always concerned about the welfare of her family. At the wholesale market in Managua, she manages a grocery store where she sells all types of products every day. She opens her business in the early hours of the morning.

Rosalina is requesting a loan because she needs to buy merchandise for her store such as food, personal products, and other items. This loan will benefit her family greatly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Lourdes Tagaloguin Group

texts.en: Lourdes T. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old and is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lourdes T. Group. Lourdes is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Nav's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nav N. is a 54-year-old married woman who lives in Angk Chruk village, Takeo province. She is the village bank president of a 15-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, AMK. Each member's loan will be used for different purposes.
Mrs. Nav N. and her husband, Mr. Ok Koch, are farmers who own a one-hectare field to cultivate rice. Mrs. Nav N. wants to take a loan of 800,000 KHR from AMK to buy piglets for breeding, fertilizer and rice seed, and to hire someone to plow her land. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living. The couple has two children, both of whom are married. All the borrowers are presented in the picture but one of them cannot be seen.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding, fertilizer and rice seed, and to hire someone to plow the land

loans.name: Santos Ramon

texts.es:
el señor Santos Ramon C. tiene 30 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora Maria Estela C. Aguilar quien se dedica a cuidar a sus dos hijos y realiza los oficios de la casa.
ellos viven en la aldea San Martin. Santos Trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una empresa privada en la ciudad de San Lorenzo. labora de lunes a sabado.
Ramon esta solicitando el prestamo para el comienzo de una construccion en la aldea Guanacastillo 
Pavana en donde construira una casa, ya que en dicho lugar adquirio un terreno y se van a ir a vivir ahi cuando termine de construir, ya tiene varios materiales pero le hacen falta unos para empezar con su casa. 
Terminando de construir su casa les dara una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Ramon C., 30, lives with his life partner, Maria Estela C. Aguilar, who cares for their two children and does the household chores. They live in the village of San Martin. Santos works as a security guard in a private firm in San Lorenzo, Monday through Saturday. Ramon is asking for funding to start a building project in the village of Guanacastillo Pavana where they will build a house because they bought a lot there and will move there when the house is finished. He has some of the materials but still needs others to start the construction project. Finishing the house will improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Bel

texts.en: Bel K. is widowed and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business of selling porridge in the morning at her home, earning approximately USD 4 in revenue per day. She has been with the business since 2007.  Her son operates his motorbike as a driver, earning an income of USD 4.16 per day. Their standard of living has improved since they have had these businesses, so they want to have a loan to expand their businesses. K. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase more groceries to stock her business. With the remainder, she wants to repair her roof. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva. (K. is pictured with her son.)

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her business and repair her roof.

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es:
La Sra. Benigna  tiene como actividad la venta de fruta en el mercado Rodriguez de la ciudad de La Paz a demas de tener esta actividad tiene tambien una pequeña tienda de barrio en la zona donde vive donde vende articulos de primera necesidad la misma  que es atendida por su hija, estas dos actividades son la principal  fuente de ingreso para ellla y su familia. 
El destino del credito sera para la compra de mercaderia para equipar mejor su tienda y tambien comprar fruta de temporada para su correspondiente comercializacion, ella es una buena cliente, puntual y ya que tiene bastante tiempo trabajando junto a  nosotros, es una persona responsable y trabajadora y siempre esta buscando una actividad para tener un dinerito extra y asi poder mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Benigna makes a living selling fruit in the Rodriguez market in the city of La Paz. In addition, she also has a small neighborhood store in the area where she lives, where she sells essential items while taking care of her daughter. These two activities are the main sources of income for Benigna and her family. Benigna will use this loan to purchase merchandise so that she can keep her store better stocked, and also purchase seasonal fruits to sell at the market. She is a good customer who is punctual and has worked with us for a long time. She is very responsible and hard working, and is always looking for activities that will allow her to earn a little extra money and thus improve her whole family’s quality of life. Benigna is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have given her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise and seasonal fruits

loans.name: Sear

texts.en:
Sear P. is 24 years-old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She is a garment factory worker who is able to make US $2 profit every day. Her husband has a business selling wood. He has been doing this business since 2005 and is able to make US $3 per day. 

Sear P. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase cows and a trailer for her husband to transport wood to sell.

loans.use: To purchase cows and a trailer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing a land plot

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila I. is a 53-year-old mother of three children. She has sold different kinds of food since 2008. Jamila and her husband opened their own shop as they are both on a pension and needed some other source of income. 

Jamila applied for a loan of 800 Azerbaijan New Manats to diversify and purchase more products to increase her profit.

loans.use: To purchase more products to increase profit

loans.name: Umut's Group

texts.en: Umut M. is a widowed 68-year-old who sells convenience goods at the kiosk she set up near her house. She began this business with an initial investment of 3,000 KGS and now she makes a monthly profit of 2,500 KGS. She would like to use her loan to purchase more convenience goods to increase the turnover at her kiosk. Umut has been in this business for ten years. Currently, she is living with her 36-year-old son and his wife. Her longer-term goal is to purchase cattle, since raising cattle would bring her much more profit. Umut has three partners: As the treasurer of the group, 64-year-old, Zhumabubu T. has a family that has been breeding livestock for at least two decades. She herself is retired and is married with three sons and two daughters. All her children are older now and live separately with their families. Zhumabubu plans to use the loan to buy livestock. Like Umut, Azina N. sells convenience goods in a kiosk near her house. She has also been doing this for a decade and started with an initial 2,000 KGS investment. Today, Azina makes 2,000 KGS per month. She is 74, a widow, and has one son who works as a police officer. Azina will also use her loan to purchase convenience goods to increase her turnover. She dreams of someday going to a resort. Tashbubu T. is a retired 69-year-old, but she sells milk to earn more money. She began selling milk twenty years ago. She started with 10,000 KGS and, through her profits, was able to marry off her first grandson. She has two children who live separately with their families, yet some of her grandchildren live with her. Tashbubu is also a widow and plans to use the loan to purchase farm animals to increase the number of livestock she owns. Her goal is to marry off her second grandson. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more convenience goods to increase her turnover

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Believe In God” group. They are small-scale-business women in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT, a Kiva partner. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and make better profits. 

Kadiatu B. is the leader of this group. She was born in Port Loko, in Northern Sierra Leone. She is 30 years of age, married to a businessman, and they have two children, one of whom is attending primary school.

Kadiatu sells clothes – T-shirts, trousers, underwear, shoes, etc., and has been running this business for six years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying more of the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: To buy more T-shirts, trousers, underwear, shoes, etc., to sell

loans.name: Ngi

texts.en: Ngi S., 36, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She produces and sells doormats for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 5 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more doormats to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more doormats for resale.

loans.name: Linet Kemuma

texts.en:
Linet Kemuma N. is a 33-year-old enterprising lady and mother of three children who are 10, 7 and 4 years old.  She is married to John Ongeri who operates a motorcycle transport business in the same town. She has been operating a green grocer business for the last nine years in Kehancha, a town located in the western part of Kenya along the shores of Lake Victoria.

Kemuma buys her stock from the nearby main markets and sells it in small quantities to her clientele who are mainly women within the Kehancha Administrative Centre. She is taking her fourth loan from Kadet Limited and intends to use it to buy cereals to sell. At the moment, she will buy maize and beans because they are in high demand.

Her dream is to own a cereal store and move from her current makeshift stall to a permanent premise. She hopes to get Kiva lenders to enable her achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy more cereal (maize and beans) to sell

loans.name: God’S Blessing Group

texts.en:
Abel T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of two borrowers called God’s Blessing. Abel is 32, married, and has three children who range from 5 months to 8 years old.

He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 4 years, he has been selling soap, candles, milk, candy, copy books, ink pens, envelopes, mosquito spray, etc. in Doe’s Community in Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 25,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian dollars business loan to buy more cartons of soap, candles, milk, candy, copy books, ink pens, envelopes, mosquito spray, etc.

He describes himself as easy-going. His goal is to improve his business, make a profit and open a shop.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of soap, candles, milk, candy, copy books, ink pens, envelopes, mosquito spray, etc.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie B. is from the village of Lagag. She is 42 years old. Rosie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosie owns a business venture in the transportation sector, running a motorcycle transport business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport in the local community. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to buy materials needed for her motorcycle. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used for motorcycle maintenance. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 3 años se dedica al servicio de costura, elaborando las bases para sombreros, fustanes entre otras prendas típicas de su zona. De esta manera realiza este servicio acompañada de su herramienta, que es su maquina de coser, puesto que los clientes le proporcionan tela y demás materiales para elaborar su trabajo. Manifiesta que le agrada trabajar en  la costura porque para ella es un pasatiempo que le genera buenas rentas a la vez. Por otro lado se dedica también a la crianza de animales y al cultivo de papa, maíz, habas y arveja, pero cuando es temporada de  siembra y cosecha es donde más esfuerzos requieren para poder realizar un buen trabajo, asimismo lo que cosecha es vendido en el mercado de su ciudad.  Por el momento desea extender sus cultivos en terrenos que posee, así mismo tener un taller de costura con maquinas de ultima generación para facilitar el trabajo de costura. Es su crédito numero catorce con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos y la reparación de su máquina de coser, asimismo desea comprar una terreno más amplio para aumentar su productividad.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 42, lives with her husband and six children in her own house. For over three years she has been a seamstress. She makes bases for hats and women’s skirts among other typical items of clothing from her area. She carries out these tasks with help from her work tool: a sewing machine. Her customers supply the other supplies like fabric. She states that she enjoys sewing because for her it’s a hobby that also produces profits at the same time. On the other hand, she also raises small farm animals and farms corn, lima beans and peas. When planting and harvest times come is when the hardest effort is required to do a good job. The crops are sold in the city market. For now, she’d like to extend her fields as well as have a workshop with the latest model sewing machines to facilitate the jobs. This is her 14th loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial help since she has always been very responsible with her repayments. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually-supportive people. She is grateful to all those who will fund the loan that will be very useful for her to continue with her business. She will use the requested funds to buy replacement parts and repair her sewing machine. She also wants to buy more farmland to increase productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts and repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.es:
El señor Leónides Muñoz A. tiene 46 años de edad es casado con la señora Fructuosa Peredo de Muñoz tienen 4 hijos dependientes de diferentes edades que estudian en nivel secundaria y primaria, la familia viven en zona Santa Barbará área rural Colomi, se dedican a la producción agrícola tienen 4 cabezas de ganado vacuno que los utilizan en las faenas agrícolas para economizar gastos en el tractor agrícola;

El señor Leónides y su esposa vinieron a consultarnos para sacar un préstamo, porque les falto dinero para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa, de tal modo se tuvo la oportunidad de pasar por la zona justamente visitando al domicilio del señor Leónides, por último el señor Leónides nos cuenta que su sueño es aumentar de producción y tener mejores recursos económicos para mantener a su familia como también para su estudio de sus hijos vivir más cómodos y felices.
texts.en:
Mr. Leónides Muñoz A., 46, is married to Mrs. Fructuosa Peredo de Muñoz.  They have four dependent children of various ages who are in secondary and elementary school.  They live in the Santa Barbara zone, a rural area of Colomi. They are farmers and have four heads of cattle that they use in the farming chores in order to avoid costs associated with using a tractor.

Leónides and his wife came to consult with us in order to request a loan because they needed funds to buy manure and potato seed.

The opportunity to visit the area arose, precisely visiting Leónides’property.  He commented that his dream is to increase production and have better economic resources to support his family as well as for his children’s education so that they can live more comfortably and happy.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer A. is from the village of Bungad. She is 37 years old. Jennifer is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Jennifer makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ice cream to the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,400 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Jennifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman with seven children, two of whom attend school. The others have graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a hardware store and a barbershop. Constance faces the challenges of theft and seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her hardware shop in the future. 

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bags of cement and chemicals for her barbershop. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cement and hair chemicals for her barbershop

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong S., 47, is married and lives with her six children in Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 each day, while her husband works as a consultant to the commune chief making US$2 each day.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Kong S. included. Two of the children are employed, while the other four are students. Kong S. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina S. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Paulina is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Paulina owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ready to wear clothing & shoe products in the local community. Paulina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Paulina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paulina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Paulina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Paulina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Restuta

texts.en:
Restuta N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 5 children, 3 of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren ).    

Restuta has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Restuta sells her products from home by means of retail.    

Restuta has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income through room rentals.   The main business challenges for Restuta include thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and to build more rental rooms.   

Restuta lives in a home that she owns.  She doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and  medication.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children. He has worked in the agriculture field since 2005. His specializes in cultivating the land with an agriculture tractor.  From the time he started his work, he began to build his experience in the same occupation. He is the only income source in his family. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client with on time payments during the long term. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform some maintenance to his tractor to make his work faster so he can deal with more customers and, thus, increase his productivity and his profitability.

loans.use: To perform some maintenance to his tractor

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona semitropical que se caracteriza por producir principalmente frutas como mango y limón. La localidad pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades relacionadas con la crianza y venta de animales. Ella cría ganado ovino y vacuno en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, los engorda alimentándoles de pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general  y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente comercializa entre sus vecinos la leche que producen sus animales. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Rosa desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza de sus animales y lograr que se desarrollen de mejor modo. Con ello logrará percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 28-year-old mother who lives with her husband and three children in one of the hamlets that make up the Tambogrande agricultural district, a semitropical zone known for mainly producing fruits such as mango and lemon. This area belongs to the Piura region and is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She works in activities related to raising and selling animals. She raises sheep and cattle in corrals located near to her home. She fattens them up with natural foods. When the animals have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the general public and to the businesspeople who normally visit her area. She also sells the animals' milk to her neighbours. This work allows her to help her husband with the family's costs.

Rosa wants to acquire balanced food to improve the raising of her animals and allow them to develop better. With this loan, she will achieve a better income from her sales. In order to achieve her goal she has decided to request a loan of 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire balanced food to improve the raising of her animals, so that they will develop better.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man with three children.  He earns his living from mixed farming.  He is able to educate his children with the income he gets from his business.  He hopes to improve his business in the future and become financially independent.   With the loan of 40, 000 Kes, he will buy a dairy cow and farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and farm inputs

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Consolee is 28 years old, married, and has one child who is three years old. Consolee sells clothes for a living.  She has been in this business for the past five years. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. 

Consolee will use this loan to purchase more women's clothes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Consolee plans to renovate and expand her current house. She dreams of importing the clothes herself in order to make more profits.

loans.use: To purchase women's clothes to resell

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan R. is a 31-year-old married woman and mother of one child. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Baray commune, Kompong Tom province. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on her land, such as cabbages and cucumbers, which she will sell to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. Chan R., her husband, and her child appear in the photo. Chan R. will use this loan to pay for cutting down small trees on her farm to allow for more farming.

loans.use: to cut down trees on her land to allow farming.

loans.name: Tukole Kakindo Group

texts.en: Christine, with hand raised, is a member of Tukole Kakindo group. She is 43 years old and the mother of six. Her spouse is a business man and they live in their own three-room house in Hioma, Uganda. She started her business selling clothes and textiles with a capital of 200,000ugx and now she has  3,000,000ugx in working capital. She faces the challenge of customers who fail to pay their debts; her aspiration is owning a boutique. Christine needs the loan to buy more clothes for sell.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and textiles to sell.

loans.name: 3 Tien Phong - Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Hoa H. T. (10) is a 36-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Hoa is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.12.1.3 Nam Ngan (3 Tien Phong - Nam Ngan).

Hoa is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, she owns and operates a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community.  She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $96 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  

She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be her 2nd loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Thuyet (11) is a 39 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


2.  P. T. Vuong (12) is a 52 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.
