3.  N. T. Hien (14) is a 41 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoa H. T. (10) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.12.1.3 Nam Ngan (3 Tien Phong - Nam Ngan).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hải sản như cá và tôm trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.963.500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Thuyet (11) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  P. T. Vuong (12) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  N. T. Hien (14) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional seafood products to sell

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 49 year-old widow and mother of two children. Jamila lives and works in Tyre.  She opened a small bakery in 1997, specialized in making  manaqish (Arabic: مناقيش‎ manāqīsh; sometimes called معجنات mu‘ajjanāt 'pastry'), which is a popular Levantine food consisting of dough topped with thyme, cheese, or ground meat. Similar to a pizza, it can be sliced or folded, and it can either be served for breakfast or lunch. The word manaqish is the plural of the Arabic word manqūshah (from the root verb naqasha 'to sculpt, carve out'), meaning that after the dough has been rolled flat, it is pressed by the fingertips to create little dips for the topping to lie in.

Traditionally, Levantine women would bake dough in a communal oven in the morning, to provide their family with their daily bread needs, and would prepare smaller portions of dough with different toppings for breakfast.

Jamila has 16 years in this field.  She started working when her husband died and she found herself alone and responsible for two children. Jamila is a hard worker, she's a person with good reputation and all of her customers and friends speak about her good manners and her shyness. They also described her courage when struggling to prove herself in front of her children and society. 

Jamila is working on expanding her shop through adding upgraded machines that will help increase her income in less time.  She is also willing to do some small decoration to her shop. 

Jamila will also buy a big tent that will expand her working area, and will be used to start a new business. She plans to start a hookah cafe.  Also known as a waterpipe, a hookah is a single or multi-stemmed (often glass-based) instrument for smoking in which the smoke is cooled and filtered by passing through water. The tobacco smoked is referred to as narghile or shisha (sheesha) in the United Kingdom, United States and Canada. According to Cyril Elgood, who does not mention his source, it was Abu’l-Fatḥ Gīlānī (d. 1588), a Persian physician at the court of the Mughal emperor Akbar I, who “first passed the smoke of tobacco through a small bowl of water to purify and cool the smoke and thus invented the hubble-bubble or hookah.” However, a quatrain of Ahlī Šīrāzī (d. 1535) refers to the use of the ḡalyān, thus dating its use at least as early as the time of Ṭahmāsp I (1524–76). It seems, therefore, that Abu’l-Fatḥ Gīlānī should be credited with the introduction of the ḡalyān, already in use in Persia, to India. Smoking the hookah has gained popularity, especially in the Middle East and is gaining popularity in North America, South America, Europe and Australia.

This new business will provide her with extra income helpful for her family, Jamila has been a borrower in good standing  at Al Majmoua for ten cycles.  Each loan was requested to improve a specific part of her business. She hopes to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy new upgraded tools for her business

loans.name: Martha Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Martha Alejandra S. es madre de tres hijos uno ya mayor de edad, el mediano estudiante de preparatoria y uno pequeño de 8 años lo cual lleva muchos gastos escolares, Ella trabaja como cocinera en una guardería y  para obtener más ingresos vende  ropa usada en una de las colonias de esta misma ciudad donde ya varios comerciantes se instalan para ofrecer variedad de producto, pero este lugar se encuentra retirado de la casa de Martha y por el momento no cuenta con automóvil propio para trasladar la mercancía lo cual le esta afectando en su economía. 
A Martha se le esta presentando la oportunidad de comprar una camioneta a un precio muy accesible por lo cual solicita de capital para que su ingresos incremente y de esta manera ofrecer a sus una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha Alejandra S. is the mother of three children, one adult, one a high school student, and one eight year old with many school expenses.  She works as a cook in a day care center and, in order to earn extra money, she also sells second hand clothing in an area of town where lots of salespeople set up.  This area is far from her home and she doesn’t have her own car to transport her merchandise.  This is affecting her financially.

Martha has the opportunity to buy a van at a good price, so she is requesting this loan.  This will allow her to increase her income and be able to provide a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a van for her business

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvin V. V., tiene la edad de 39 años de edad, está casado  y vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende con su crédito comprar los alimentos necesarios para poder engordar sus animales para su posterior venta el mercado loca. El ya tiene los animales a su poder lo q necesita es el concentrado para poder sacarlos gordos para la temporada de venta. El pretende generar ganancias y también ampliar el proyecto donde el tenga la cría y su posterior engorde para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia con las ganancias que pueda obtener de este proyecto.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marvin V. V. is 39 years old, married, and he lives with his 3 children and his wife, all of whom are his greatest priority. With his loan he plans on purchasing the feed that he needs to fatten his livestock for later resale at the local market. He already has the livestock but what he needs is concentrated feed to be able to fatten them for the sales season. He expects to generate a profit and to expand his business to have the livestock to raise and fatten. He will be able to provide is family with a better quality of life with the help of the profits he will earn from his project.

It is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). He has not had previous loans from state-run banks, but Fudecosur has provided him with a loan with greater ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his livestock.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Cinthya Johanna

texts.es:
Cinthia de 30 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Su esposo trabaja como controlador de bus de transporte intercantonal. Es consultora de comesticos y ventas de bisuterías.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás trabajaba con la mama en la venta de comesticos y bisuterías un día ella se caso y decidió abrir su propio negocio con un préstamo que hizo compro ropa para aumentar sus ingresos y complementar mas sus negocio . Actualmente es consultora de comesticos y vende ropa de toda ocasión. Vende sus productos como perfumes y cremas a 25 por unidad, labiales y lociones a 12 por unidad y ropa para damas a 16 por ropa. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas productos como perfumes, blusas para mujer, labiales , diferente mercadería para aumentar sus ingresos. Las metas de Cinthia y su esposo es poner un local para la venta de bisutería y comesticos y una pequeña papelería paras tener ingresos para terminar de construir su vivienda y dar la colegiatura de su hija.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 30 years old and lives in a subdivision named Playas which is one of Ecuador's tourist sites with a diverse selection of seafood. Her husband works as an inter-subdivision bus driver. She is a cosmetics consultant and also sells costume jewelry.

She used to work with her mother selling cosmetics and costume jewelry. When she married she decided to open her own business and with a loan she bought clothing to increase her profits and compliment her business. Currently, she is a cosmetics consultant and she sells clothing for all occasions. She sells her products such as lotions and creams for 25 per unit, lipsticks and lotions for 12 per unit and clothing for women at 16 per piece. With the help from this loan she wants to buy more products such as perfumes, women's blouses, lipsticks and different merchandise to increase her income. Cinthia and her husband's goals are to have a store to sell costume jewelry and a small grocery and stationary store so that they can have income to finish building their home and to pay for their daughter's tuition.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, shirts, blouses, lipsticks and lotions.

loans.name: Algarrobo Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Algarrobo” y está conformado por 22 socios, quienes se dedican a diversos rubros, principalmente comerciantes, artesanía, zapatería, cortinaje y venta de plantas. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Bernardita, quien en la foto se encuentra agachada y viste una pañoleta color naranjo, se dedica al rubro de la artesanía en general, desde retapicería, alfarería el trabajo en cueros, en madera, también realiza telares y ocupa material de reciclaje. El taller donde realiza su artesanía lo tiene desde hace 9 años y lo denomina taller múltiple debido a la diversidad de trabajos que puede realizar. Para realizar su artesanía Bernardita compra leña a bajo costo, pero generalmente los materiales gruesos son reciclados.
Sus productos también los realiza a pedido, pero también realiza artesanía innovadora, como letreros de madera.
Con el préstamo comprará lijas, pinturas, lanas, diluyentes, betún de Judea y además mandará a reparar una herramienta eléctrica para utilizarla en su artesanía.
Sus metas son seguir desarrollando cursos y talleres para mantener activos los conocimientos artesanales. De ésta manera sus sueños son compartir y transmitir con las demás socias los aprendizajes en artesanía. Anhela seguir siendo artesana y continuar trabajando. 
Bernardita realiza cursos en forma gratuita de telares con la cultura mapuche.
Ella está muy agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, no solo por el crédito sino también por los valores que fomenta Fondo Esperanza, en cuanto a la solidaridad, la unión y la confianza.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called Algarrobo, is made of 22 members, who work in diverse fields, principally artisan crafts, shoe-making, selling plants and making curtains. They all live in the city of Valparaíso. 

Bernardita, who is bent down in the photo and wearing an orange kerchief, works doing all types of crafts, including re-upholstery, pottery, work in leather, and work in wood. She also works on a loom and often uses recycled materials. She has had the workshop where she does her work for 9 years and they call it the "multiple" workshop because she of the diversity of artwork that she produces. To make her crafts, Bernardita buys wood at low prices, but most of her other heavy materials are recycled. 

She takes commissions but also creates her own innovative work like wooden signs. With the loan, she will buy sandpaper, paint, wool, paint thinner, Betumen of Judea (used to create a patina effect) and will repair an electric tool that she uses in her artwork. 

Her goals are to continue developing classes and workshops to keep her craft skills up to date. Her dreams are also to share and transmit to the other members of the communal bank everything she has learned about crafts. She wants to continue being an artist and to continue working. Bernardita completed free classes in weaving with the Mapuche (indigenous people of Chile). She is very grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her, not just for the loans but also for the values that Fondo Esperanza promotes, like solidarity and trust. 

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago. It is the regional capital and also the headquarters of the country's legislature. It is Chile's first port and offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places, like the home of Pablo Neruda, winner of the Noble Prize for his poetry.

loans.use: to buy sandpaper, paint, wool, paint thinner, Betumen of Judea (used to produce a patina effect) and get an electric tool repaired that she uses in her crafts.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is a 43-year-old single mother with four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has had a bar business for two years. She started with two crates of beer and now has 10 crates and four jerrycans of super local brew. Her hardship is bad debtors, and her vision is to stock 50 crates of beer, plus educate her family. Dinah needs the loan facility to buy cement for renovating her business premises and buying crates of beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy cement for renovation plus 10 crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Francisco Marcelino

texts.es: El señor Francisco es soltero no tiene hijos, de dedica a manejar un taxi el cual es alquilado eligió este tipo de trabajo por que le generaba un buen ingreso viene realizando esta labor desde el 2008, los desafíos que enfrenta el señor francisco es la competencia que hay en la zona, pero el los enfrenta saliendo a trabajar mas temprano para así ganar un poco mas de dinero, el dinero que esta solicitado el señor francisco es para comprar unas herramientas de mecánica,como llaves, juego dados, gata alicate, desarmadores entre otros, ademas de hacer algunos arreglos a su casa, francisco tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es tener su propio vehículo, para que le genere mayores ingresosy asi tener una mejor calidad de vida, francisco esta muy agradecido con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Francisco is single and doesn't have any children.  He drives a rented taxi.  He chose this type of work because it made him a good income.  He has been in this line of work since 2008.  The challenge that Francisco faces is the competition that exists in his area.  However, he meets this challenge by going out to work earlier each day so that he can make a little more money.

Francisco is requesting this loan to buy some tools for his car such as wrenches, a socket set, a jack, pliers, screwdrivers, etc.  He would also like to make some repairs to his home.  Francisco has many dreams.  One of them is to own his own vehicle so that he can make more income and thereby enjoy a better quality of life.  He is very grateful for the support he has received.

loans.use: to buy tools for his car such as wrenches, a socket set, pliers, a jack, etc.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 38 years old and married with three children who are in school.  Elvie works very hard to provide for them.

Elvie runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, canned goods, snack food, etc. 

Elvie has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory.

Elvie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Nelson Del Carmen

texts.es: Nelson Del Carmen es casado trabaja como comerciante de productos varios como cosméticos, ropa, calzado y otros. Solicita su crédito para invertir en una gran cantidad de productos. tambien tiene su otro negocio que es ofrecer los ervicio de tricitaxi, pues este medio lo utiliza para trsnportar su mercaderia.  El se prepara todos los días para salir a ofrecer a sus clientes que lo esperan con los nuevos productos.  Cuenta con apoyo de su esposa quien le brinda la ayuda para obtener nuevos clientes. Nelson está agradecido con este crédito que solicita  pues tiene las esperanzad de mejorar sus ingresos con las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en: Nelson Del Carmen is married. He works as a merchant of various products, such as cosmetics, clothes, shoes and more. He is asking for the loan to invest in a large quantity of products. He also has another business offering a bicycle taxi service. He uses the taxi to transport his merchandise. He prepares everyday to go out and offer his customers what they expect in new products. He has his wife's support; she helps him get new customers. Nelson is grateful  for this loan and hopes to improve his income with the earnings he obtains.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes, shoes and more.

loans.name: Dieudonne

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 40 ans, marié et Père de trois 3 enfants dont l’age varie entre 2 et 9 ans.
Par manque d’appui pour soutenir son cursus scolaire à partir du cycle secondaire, il juge mieux de créer une micro-entreprise dont la vocation est la vente en détail des Cassettes et CD.
Vu la croissance démographique de sa zone de vente et  la rareté de certains produits de musique, le microcrédit permettra d’appuyer l’activité pour assurer sa croissance et la réalisation de sa vision qui n’est autre que devenir Grossiste distributeur agrée des entreprises de production. Faisant face aux obligations liées à son statut, il est exemplaire dans sa communauté.
texts.en:
The client is 40 years old, married and father of 3 children aged between 2 and 9 years.
As he didn't have the means to continue his secondary studies, he decided it would be best to start a micro-enterprise specialising in the retail sale of tapes and CDs.
Given the population growth in his area and the scarcity of certain music items, microcredit allows him to grow his business and to realise his vision of becoming  an authorized wholesale distributor for production companies. He lives up to his obligations and is a model citizen in his community.

loans.use: to buy tapes, CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a 42-year-old married woman living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has 3 school-aged dependents who have assisted her sometimes in the feeding and caring of the animals. The small piggery she is working on at this time commenced 2 years ago. While not the only source of income, Pacita earns a total of about PHP 5,000 a month. 

Pacita joined GDMPC earlier this year to access financial services offered by the organization. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feeding supplies for piglets. She wants to give the best possible nourishment for them so as not to be hesitant in naming the price when selling them. The profit to generate from this investment is planned for buying more piglets to gain more income and improve family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase feeding supplies for piglets.

loans.name: Elida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elida, vive con su hija y un nieto, ella se dedica a una granja y venta de pollos, los cuales los vende cada 6 semanas pero ya lavados, este negocio comenzó por iniciativa propia.
Por segunda ocasión está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pollos, concentrado, además este préstamo le permitirá crecer y contar con lo necesario para alimentar a las gallinas. Ella quiere crecer, que su granja sea más amplia, aumentar su clientela, desarrollarse en el comercio y atender la demanda de su clientela, también contribuir a mejorar la condición económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Elida lives with her daughter and a grandson. She earns her living by raising and selling poultry. The chickens are dressed and sold every six weeks. She began the business through her own efforts.

Elida is now seeking her second loan to buy chicks and feed so that she can expand her business and have food on hand to feed the chicks. She wishes to see her business grow, have a bigger business, increase the number of customers, develop her business knowledge, fulfill her customers' orders, and also contribute to the improvement of her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for her poultry business

loans.name: Trọng's Group

texts.en:
Trọng  is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong distict - Bắc Ninh province. She is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên trà 04 (8).

Trọng is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Trọng owns and operates a waste-management business. Her main source of income comes primarily from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Trọng has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

Trọng joined SEDA in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase scrap metal to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 8,736,000 VND to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This will be her third loan from SEDA. Trọng plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve her business.

About the other borrowers: 

Kim is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 7,840,000 VND loan to support her agricultural business raising pigs and chicken.

Sự is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her agricultural business raising pigs.

Quy is a 30-year-old male who is requesting a 7,840,000 VND loan to support his manufacturing business making furniture.

Chúc is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business making furniture. 

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Disciples Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
In a group of six members made up of five women and a man, Abena, aged 47, is the leader who sees to it that the group accesses the loan capital, organizes them for group meetings and ensures that all repayment schedules are met accordingly.

Abena is married and has five children who are between the ages of 10 and 17. She says all are in school.  Abena works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a food vendor and wants to use the loan to buy food stuffs and other ingredients in bulk.

She desires to build a house for her family.  Abena has been in the chop (food) bar business for four years.

Since trading is a source of livelihood to many in most communities in Ghana, the other group members are into all kinds of trading activities and food processing business.  The group requests a loan to enable them procure goods and raw materials in bulk to revamp their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: G.s. La Colonia Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario La colonia lo conforma Cristina, Ingrid y Luis. La señora Cristian tiene 41 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos de 7, 13 y 16 años de edad. Ella se dedica al negocio de pulpería, la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace más de 3 años. Desea este crédito para invertirlo en granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, papel higiénico entre otros. Ingrid del Carmen  es otra integrante del grupo. Ella tiene 25 años de edad, es  soltera y aun no tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante, trabaja con Vogue principalmente en la distribución de productos. Ella desea invertir el crédito en la compra de cosméticos para distribuirlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The La Colonia communal bank is comprised of Cristina, Ingrid, and Luis.

Cristina is 41 years old and married.  She has three children; ages 7, 13, and 16.  She has had a grocery store, which is located in her house, for over three years.  She wants this loan to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergent, and toilet paper, among other things.

Ingrid del Carmen is another member of the group.  She is 25 years old, single, and does not yet have children.  She sells cosmetics in an itinerant manner.  She mainly works with Vogue in the distribution of her products.  She wants to use the loan to buy cosmetics to distribute to her customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergent, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is 44 years old and lives in Barnersville. She is married and has five children between the ages of 8 and 25. One is presently in school, others are working and living on their own, and the youngest one is living at home.  Her husband is a social worker. 

For the past four years Mama has been selling oil, rice, pepper and eggs, and is now requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business.  She like the ways people respond to her business.  Her plan is to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and eggs for her business.

loans.name: Maria Lucinda

texts.es:
María  Lucinda,  tiene  53 años de edad, con 3 hijos de  18, 22 y 25 años de edad, vive en una aldea del Rosario Comayagua. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Lucinda trabaja junto con su esposo,  desde hace 30 años se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como de maíz, frijoles y café. Tiene una manzana de terreno cultivada. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local y tiene un cliente que se lo compra directamente a su casa.

Este préstamo es el primero que solicita y lo va a invertir en compra de abono y fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos y lograr una mejor cosecha. 
Con sus ganancias quiere terminar de construir su  vivienda y otras cosas que necesita.
texts.en:
María Lucinda is 53 years old and has three children who are 18, 22 and 25 years old.  She lives in a village in Rosario Comayagua.  Her husband's a farmer.

Lucinda works alongside her husband.  For the last 30 years she's been farming basic grains like corn, beans and coffee.  She has a manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] of farmland in production.  She sells her crops in the local marketplace and has a customer that comes directly to her house to buy.

This is the first loan she's requested and will use it to buy manure and fertilizer to care for her crops and obtain a better harvest.  With her profits she wants to finish building her house and get some other things she needs.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica es una mujer muy joven D. 20 años que a pesar D. su corta edad es emprendedora y trabajadora. Cuenta su propio negocio D. abarrotes en su casa que elL. misma atienD. para ofrecer un mejor servicio. Anteriormente trabaja en una maquiladora D. L. ciudad pero recortaron personal y le toco ser una D. ellas recibiendo su liquidación lo cual lo quiso utilizar en algo productivo y fue D. L. forma que inicio su negocio.  En este momento Verónica quiere un préstamo para comprar mercancía como refrescos, tortillas, botanas, lácteos, abarrote y mas, D. esta manera su negocio será prosperando.
texts.en: Verónica is a very young woman of 20 who, in spite of her young age, is entrepreneurial and hard-working.  Verónica has her own grocery store business in her home in which she serves herself in order to offer a better service.  She used to work in a cross-border assembly plant but they cut back on staff and she was one of those to receive her severance pay.  She wanted to use this money for something productive and this is how she started her business.  Right now, Verónica would like a loan to buy merchandise such as soft drinks, tortillas, snacks, dairy products, groceries, etc.  In this way, her business will thrive.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snacks, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 52 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. She has had a sari-sari store business for the last 10 years. Felicidad sells items like canned goods, school supplies and daily-use products such as soap and shampoo. She earns 10000 PHP each month with her business.

Felicidad has requested this loan to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and soft drinks. Felicidad hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 25 años, vive con Wilbert de 25 años y fruto de esta relación tienen un hijo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de LLochegua. Karina es una joven emprendedora que desde niña trabajó muy duro, realizando múltiples negocios a lado de su madre. Con el pasar del tiempo, ella y su madre decidieron realizar su propio negocio, su mamá en la venta de abarrotes, mientras que Karina decidió abrir un restaurante. Al principio  en un local pequeño y alquilado, no tan amueblado donde sus ventas no eran tan rentables, pero poco a poco fue mejorando su restaurante, captando más clientela. Y esto se debe a la sazón que le pone a sus comidas. En un futuro anhela ser la persona más exitosa con un ingreso económico rentable y una cartera de clientes amplia. por ello éste será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles invertirá en la mejora de su restaurante.
texts.en: Karina, 25, lives with Wilbert, 25, and together they have one child.  They live together in their home, located in the Llochegua district.  Karina is an enterprising youth who, from the time that she was a child, worked very hard, in multiple businesses at the side of her mother.  Over time, she and her mother decided to have their own businesses; her mother sells groceries while Karina decided to open a restaurant.  At first, it was in a small rented space where she did not have much furniture and her sales were not very profitable.  But gradually she's been improving her restaurant and attracting more customers, due to the good taste of her dishes.  In the future, she wants to be a very successful person with a profitable business and a big customer base.  To do this, she will take her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to be punctual in making her payments.  With the 3,000 Peruvian soles, she will invest in improvements to her restaurant.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of her restaurant

loans.name: Gloria Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 11 años y un bebé  de 4 meses el último, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Vende en su local pues tiene unas cabinas telefónicas y allí logra realizar sus ventas, allí mismo vende helados, útiles escolares,  tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00. Tiene 4 años con su local y las ventas de Avon tres años, estos productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, helados, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es seguir creciendo con su negocio.

En la foto está la socia con dos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Comunal Proyecto 2003 communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo (Manta) canton.  This is a place known for its beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this lovely place.  Most of the population here are very hard-working and devoted to the sea-related businesses.

This is where we meet 36 year old Gloria.  She is married and has three children; ages 16, 11, and the last is a four month old baby.  The two oldest children go to elementary school and high school.  Her husband is a driver.

She is a housewife who sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories) in order to get her own income.  She sells at her place; she has some telephone booths.  That is where she manages to make her sales.  That is where she also sells ice cream, school supplies, and telephone cards and recharges.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  She has had her place for four years, and she has been selling Avon for three years.  She leaves these products on credit, and she collects every week.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, ice cream, and telephone cards and recharges.  She has been in her communal bank since it started.  She likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to continue growing in her business.

Gloria is in the photo with her two children.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, ice cream, and telephone cards and recharges.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
This is Teodoro, 39, a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. He is married to Flordeliza, a housewife, and a father to their child. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teodoro oversees operations of their Jeepney transportation business. They have one unit of Jeep that carries up to 16 passengers to their destination within the community. He earns from the boundary (daily quota) their driver remits everyday. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. He will be using the loan for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

He dreams of giving his family a good future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is a 49 year old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. Florencio is a farmer and grows rice crops to sell. Florencio earns about 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month from his farming. He works hard to improve his income and sustain his family, especially his children's education.

Florencio has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farming materials. In the future, Florencio hopes to have his own money for capital so he will not need to borrow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farming materials.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 60 years old and lives in Buenavista, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children. 

Juanita has a snack-vending business and earns approximately PHP 1,200 each month from it. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Juanita has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Juanita hopes to have a lot of capital in order to earn money. Juanita wants to buy a space in the market where her business is.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy is 50 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has six children with two of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Tracy has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, sugar and salt, etc. 

To help expand her business, Tracy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Tracy to generate greater profits and improve on her standard of living. Tracy hopes that in the future she will be able to become a powerful entrepreneur. 

Tracy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Tracy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Nathaly

texts.es:
La señora Nathaly y el señor Walter son casados y tienen 3 hijos, los esposos de carácter sencillo y amable viven por la zona de Arocagua, la primera se dedica a vender almuerzos y su esposo cerrajero quien empezó su actividad recientemente por un accidente de tránsito que tuvo toda la familia incluyendo uno de sus pequeños hijos de este mismo salieron con varias lesiones ambos  y siendo el más perjudicado el esposo de ahí que la señora Nathaly se empeño en seguir adelante con su pequeño negocio que sin embargo lo supo llevar muy bien, ella comercializa sus comidas por la zona de Quintanilla siendo una las paradas de Trufis y los chóferes son los comensales más frecuentes además de los vecinos del lugar que degustan de su comida y que fue agrado de los mismos su esposo en este momento se encuentra trabajando como independiente conoce de cerrajería agarro un contrato de tinglado por provincia también ahora viene aportando a los gastos familiares y que siguen adelante con sus negocios.
El préstamo que la señora Nathaly requiere es para ampliar su negocio de comida y ofrecer más alternativas a sus comensales y de esta manera generar mas ingresos que ayudaran a su familia.
texts.en: Nathaly and Walter are married and have 3 children. The simple and friendly couple lives in Arocagua zone, she works selling lunches and her husband is a locksmith. She began her work recently due to an traffic accident that the whole family experienced, including one of their little children. They got out with several injuries and, with her husband being more injured than her, Nathaly determined to get ahead with her little business that she nevertheless knows very well. She sells food in the Quintanilla region, which is one of the taxi stops and the drivers are most frequent diners, in addition to the local neighbors who enjoy her food and it was to their taste. Her husband now is working independently. He knows locksmithing and got a broad contract through the province and also now comes contributing to the family expenses and they get ahead with their businesses.

loans.use: to expand her food business in such a way as to offer more varied and better dishes.

loans.name: Lorna Graciela

texts.es: LORNA GRACIELA: Es una señora sonriente y emprendedora de 63 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos, mayores de edad. Su esposo trabaja como docente. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, vende ropa usada en un tramo que alquila en uno de los mercados del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Anteriormente era integrante de un grupo solidario, gracias a los créditos otorgados por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido adquirir garantías, por lo que solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa de hogar, equipada con sabanas, edredones, cubre colchones, fundas. Ella sueña con tener su propio tramo

loans.use: para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa de hogar, equipada con sabanas, edredones, cubre colchones, fundas

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo is working in a small tacos sales business, he is 44 years of age and he is married, Arnulfo is a very hard-working person. He has two young boys, who help in the family business in their free time. He worked as worker in a private company, and then he was fired and with his retirement pay he started his small business, the main idea was from his wife because her family knows all about the food sales.

Arnulfo is requesting for a loan of $475 USD. To purchase of raw materials as tortillas, oil, meat and more for the elaboration of his delicious tacos, which have had too much acceptance and every day his demand increases. In a term of 6 months he wants to repay the loan. He and his beautiful family require your help and support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Arnulfo se dedica a vender “Tacos”, con 44 años de edad y casado, Don Arnulfo es una persona tenaz y muy trabajadora. Tiene dos jóvenes los cuales ayudan en el negocio familiar en su tiempo libre. El trabajaba como obrero en una empresa privada, fue despedido y con lo de su retiro inició su pequeño negocio, la idea la tuvo su esposa porque su familia esta muy relacionada con la venta de comidas.

Don Arnulfo y su familia requieren un préstamo de $475 USD. para comprar materia prima como tortilla, aceite, carne y mucho más para la elaboración de sus exquisitos tacos, los cuales han tenido mucha aceptación y cada vez aumenta la demanda de don Arnulfo. En un término de 6 meses el desea devolver el préstamo. El y su hermosa familia requieren de tu ayuda y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials as tortillas, oil and meat.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.en:
Ayaba N. is 58 years old and lives in Agbanakin (Les Lacs prefecture), where she runs a business selling smoked fish. Having six people to look after, she lives day after day on a meager income from this business of hers. For 20 years, she has been utilizing a traditional business arrangement, in which she acquires fish on credit from fishermen and then pays them back after selling the smoked fish. This arrangement prevents her from doing well or from meeting family needs.

Her experience with the «tontine» system (which is a kind of group savings/investment system) and tontine loans has, little by little, given her a certain financial independence. However, her goal is to pay for the fish up front from now on, to increase her production of smoked fish, and to augment her income. To accomplish this, she is requesting a loan of $800 to construct the new ovens and grills necessary for her business to succeed. This financing will make a noticeable difference in reducing poverty in her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 58 ans, Madame N. Ayaba vit à Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs où elle mène son activité : la vente des poissons fumés. Avec six personnes en charge, elle vit au jour le jour avec les maigres recettes de son activité. C’est une activité qu’elle exerce depuis 20 ans avec un système traditionnel qui consiste à prendre le poisson à crédit chez les pêcheurs et payer ces derniers après la vente. Ce qui ne lui permet de faire une bonne affaire et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

L’expérience de tontine et de crédit qu’elle a entreprises lui donne peu à peu une autonomie financière et c’est dans le but de payer désormais comptant les poissons, multiplier sa production et augmenter ses recettes qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour fabriquer de nouveaux fours et grilles nécessaires à la réussite de ses activités. Le financement de ce projet contribue à réduire sensiblement l’état de misère de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fish and build new ovens and grills for smoking fish

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio is a native of Salitre, Ecuador, and he has been working in rice farming his entire life. On his farm, he has rice and also some cows and bulls. With the loan, he will buy fertilizer for rice farming as he hopes to increase his productivity. The fertilizer helps increase the yield per plot and it also provides rice of better quality. He dreams of fixing his home, which is made out of wood and is vulnerable to rains. On his farm he also has a couple of horses.

He is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the 10 de enero Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water basins that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. The loans will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the freshwater Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provide services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to sell them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in a rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
At forty-nine years old, Esther has six girl children and she also adopted two children from a deceased uncle. These children are her big responsibility and she works hard by selling plastic utensils and palm oil to earn income for her family. All the eight children are in school, and with her small business, Esther is able to provide them with their basic needs.

Esther has an innovative business. She buys goods from the capital, Freetown, and distributes them among her agents in remote villages around Kabala, and collects the receipts every week. Her activity has provided needed goods to the more remote areas of the district. Esther’s vision is to see all her children acquire a good education. She is requesting a $350 loan to expand her inventory and would like to purchase the goods from Conakry where she said it is cheaper than Freetown.

loans.use: Expand her wholesale inventory

loans.name: Faavevela

texts.en: Faavevela F. is a 35-year old mother of four children; she’s also a new member to the programme, running a fishing business. Faavevela feels confident about her business - that it’s earning good money with fewer expenses. All they have to buy and keep in stock are the batteries and strings unless there’s a need for replacement for equipment. Faavevela doesmost of her fishing on Saturday night, to sell on Sunday morning at the fish market where fish sell quickly for a good price. With her requested loan, she plans to buy a cooler to keep her fish in when selling it, instead of hanging them out which gives the fish an off taste.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase a cooler

loans.name: Michelle

texts.fr:
Mrs. Michelle d'Almeida was born in 1970 in Aného in the Lake prefecture of southern Togo. She stopped her secondary studies to learn sewing. Unfortunately she doesn't practice this skill, and has instead begun a small grocery business. She lost her husband very early and was left responsible for their three children. This has been very difficult for her, but with her grocery business she's done her best to cope. Her objective today is to increase her product stock, increase her sales and her income, and especially to make her business profitable. In order to do this she is seeking a $1000 loan.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Michelle D. est née en 1970 à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs au sud du Togo. Elle arrêta ses études aux secondaires pour apprendre la couture. Malheureusement elle n’exerça pas ce métier mais s’adonne aux petits commerces. Elle perdit très tôt son mari l’obligeant à prendre seule en charge leurs trois (03) enfants. Ce fût très difficile pour elle, mais avec son commerce d’alimentation générale elle est arrivée tant bien que mal à s’en sortir. Son objectif aujourd’hui est d’augmenter son stock de marchandises, augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu et surtout rentabiliser son commerce. Pour cela, elle sollicite un financement de $ 1000.

loans.use: Product stocking

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Miss T. Phun is single and lives with her retired parent, together with her younger sister. She is currently in the business of buying and reselling silk products and weaving silk as well. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production in 2002. Her younger sister, who learned to weave from her neighbor, also weaves silk at home.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now she is requesting another loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on her sister's and her looms so that they can expand their silk production businesses.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms

loans.name: Chito

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 34 year-old Chito M.. She is single with one child, aged 8. In 2005 Chito established a livestock business and now requests a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional livestock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is an organization that is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania. Through leasing and leaseback, SELFINA provides a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. As they lack tangible collateral assets, they are termed not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment. The process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock.

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Mrs. Khut M., 34, is a widow who earns about $5 a day selling corn at a busy local market. She lives with her one child and mother in Batambong province, Cambodia. Because her income is so limited, Mrs. M. is unable to save any money. But she is humbly requesting a loan that will allow her to buy a large amount of corm to sell to her customers. If she is able to do this, it will mean a big increase in her income.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of corm to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ivelisse Melania

texts.en:
Ivelisse Melania is thirty-seven years old, and she has a son that attends school.  Ivelisse has been selling a collection of pants for a long time in the Alceviejo community of Los Alcarrizos in Santo Domingo, the capital.  The entrepreneur, a very active and passionate woman, operates her business from her house, but she plans on using her loan to rent a small local, as well as purchase new styles of pants and shirts to increase her sales volume and attract new clients.
Ivelisse’s business supports her son’s education, and helps with other family costs.

loans.use: To buy pants and shirts to restock a small business.

loans.name: Yei Road 2001-3 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Edina M.. She is currently in the business of selling breads and charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Edina is a 40-year-old married woman. Her husband works as a security guard . They have 6 children ranging from age 6 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Edina makes approximately 140 Sudanese pound in profit and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay fees for her children.

Asha M., Kaku J., Waron J., and Poni J. join Edina in her small group. Asha M. has a business in selling greens and wants to expand the business. Kaku J. is currently operating a business in brewing alcohol and wants a loan to expand the business. Waron J. operates a business of selling shorgum and wants to expand her business. Poni J. is currently in the business of selling breads and is requesting a loan to to open a bar.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Djawagne Group

texts.fr:
Guédé is a village of 6000 inhabitants, of whom 3120 are educated, including those from surrounding villages. There are a middle school and two primary schools, but the inhabitants' crucial problem is the inaccessibility of a library. In other words, they have to go 30 kilometers to use a library. This makes it necessary to create a bookstore so that the people from these villages will be able to develop their intellectual capacities. This will also allow access to school supplies, improve the level of both students and teachers, and create jobs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Guédé est un village de 6000 habitants dont 3120 intellectuels y compris ceux des villages environnants. Il y a un collége et 02 écoles primaires mais les populations font face au crucial probléme de l'inaccessibilité d'une bibliothéque. En d'autres termes, elles parcourent 30 Km pour accéder à une bibliothéque d'où la necessité de créer une librairie afin que les villageois et ceux environnements puissent accroitre leurs capacités intellectuelles, faciliter l'accès des fournitures à l'école, relever le niveau des éléves et des enseignants, créer des emplois

loans.use:
creation of a library (traveling bookstore)

Création d'une bibliothéque ( librairie ambulante)

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 42-year-old father of four children. He lives with his family in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Hussein is in the painting business. This is the first time he has applied to Al Majmoua for a loan. He needs to buy material to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa works serving customers in her small shop each day, and she has been doing so for 5 years. She started working with a small amount of capital and over time she has seen her business grow. She would like to make her shop bigger and see it grow. She would also like her last 3 kids to keep studying. Your help with Luisa's loan is very important for her continued development.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Luisa trabaja diariamente en la atención D. su pequeña tienda, lo viene haciendo desD. hace ya 5 años, ella comenzó trabajando con un pequeño capital y con el tiempo ha visto crecer su negocio, tiene como proyecto agrandar su tienda y crecer ella misma. Su deseo también es que sus 3 últimos hijos sigan estudiando. Tu apoyo en el préstamo D. Doña Luisa es D. suma importancia para que continue con su desarrollo.

loans.use: To make the shop bigger and for her kids' education/Ampliación de su tienda y estudios de sus menores hijos.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
The Kuña Katupyry women’s committee was formed after the disbanding of another group in the zone. Some of the women of that group decided to form a new group because they were too far from the meeting place. Just like all the other groups, they attended four meetings prior to receiving the loan and agreed to the terms and conditions set by the program. 
Upon getting started, 18 women, who each received 300,000.00 Paraguay Guarani, used the funds for their businesses. Many of the members make handicrafts while others have food, drink, or natural remedies businesses, among other activities. The program is currently in its 5th cycle. The group is pleased to work with Fundación Paraguaya and invite the other women in their neighborhood to participate in the program since aside from the loan benefits, they also receive training in order to help their businesses succeed, while their children receive both free music lessons and money saving courses. 
 Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.
El comite de mujeres " Kuña Katupyry", se conformo debido a la desintegracion de un grupo de la zona, un grupo de ese comité decidio conformarse en uno nuevo, ya que ellas se encontraban muy alejadas del lugar de reunión. Al igual que todos los comités asistieron a cuatros reuniones previas al crédito y estuvieron de acuerdo con todas las condiciones ofrecidas por el programa.
 Al iniciar formaron parte del comité 18 señoras que recibieron un crédito de 300.000Gs cada una, que lo destinaron para sus negocios, dentro del comité hay muchas personas que se dedican a la artesanía y otras tienen negocios de ventas de comidas, bebidas, remedios naturales, etc. Actualmente se encuentran en el 5to ciclo del programa, El comité se encuentra muy a gusto trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya e instan a las demás señoras de su barrio a participar del programa, pues además del beneficio de obtener créditos, las mujeres reciben capacitación para llevar adelante sus negocios y sus hijos reciben educación musical gratuita, educación para el ahorro infantil.

loans.use: Purchase milk, sugar, machinery, thread, sweets, meat, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Komshot

texts.en: Mrs. Komshot P.  is 29 years old, and her husband, Pouv Pho, is 32 years old. They are fishermen on the Tonle Sap Lake. They live with three children, all of whom are students who live in the Anlong Somnor Commune, Sieap Reap Province. To develop their business she has decided to request a loan of US$250 to purchase more fishing tools (fishing nets etc.). Mrs. Komshot hopes the loan will improve their business so that they can sufficiently support their family.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing tools including nets

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina radica en el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo – Puno. Tiene 21 años de edad, es conviviente, progenitora de un niño de 04 meses y estudió hasta primero de secundaria.

Hace un año decidió integrar el Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría” del Centro Poblado de Acari – Yunguyo. Desde los 12 años de edad empezó a vender habas tostada los días domingo en la ciudad de Yunguyo, a los 20 años de edad formó su hogar. Desde ese entonces se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno y ovino, a su vez su esposo viaja semanalmente para comprar ají al Departamento de Tacna (Sama, Ite) para vender los viernes en la ciudad de Desaguadero. Con su primer crédito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles compró 04 ovinos a S/.75.00 cada uno.

Con este crédito de S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelada en 03 cuotas, comprará 01 cabeza de ganado vacuno con S/. 1,400 y con  S/.100 comprará alimento balanceado para ganado de engorde.

Su mayor deseo es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Yunguyo, poner una tienda de abarrotes y educar a su hijo para que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Agustina is located at Centro Poblado de Acari in the district and province of Yunguyo D Puno. She is 21 years old, is living common law, and is the mother of a 4-month old little boy. She went to school until grade 7.

One year ago she joined the community bank Banco Communal "Fe y Alegria" located Centro Poblado de Acari D Yunguyo. Since she was 12 years old she started selling toasted fava beans on Sundays in the city of Yunguyo. When she was 20 years old she started her own family. Since then she has been tending to beef and milk cattle. Her husband travels weekly to purchase hot peppers at the Departmento de Tacna (Sama, Ite) and then resells them on Fridays at the city of Desaguadero. Her first loan of S/.500 she purcharged 4 beef cattle at S/.75 each one.

With this loan of S/.1,500, which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase 1 cow for S/.1400 and for S/.100 she will purchase a balanced feed so that her cattle can be well nourished.

Her greatest wish is to purchase a house in the city of Yunguyo, to set up a grocery store, and send her son to school so that he could be a professional.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cow and feed.

loans.name: Choum

texts.en:
Mr. Choum C. was born in 1973. He lives in Pnouv Lek Village in Kampong Cham Province. He is a laborer who works in the fields.

He also owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife Mrs. Lo Saveun is a farmer. Even though they have different jobs, they do not make enough money to earn a good living. Therefore Mr. Choum C. has decided to ask for a loan to start a new business. He will buy ducks and duck food to start the business. He hopes this new business will increase his income and improve his living conditions.

He is a father of three young children.

His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy ducks and duck food

loans.name: Yoeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeung L., 28, is a widow and a farmer who grows rice and vegetables, such as water-lily and cabbages. She started in this job in 1999 and has had much experience. She works hard and is also a good mother who can provide her two young children with food and with education. Yoeung lives in Svayloung Commune in Pursat Province.

Yoeung is requesting a loan of 200,000 riel ($50) to buy chickens to raise, and is hopeful that a loan will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Né en 1971 à Tabligbo, Monsieur N. Komi vit aujourd’hui avec sa famille à Momé-Woédjépé. Enseignant, il est père de cinq (05) enfants. Avec les difficultés de faire vivre décemment sa famille avec son maigre salaire, il veut associer une activité parallèle qui lui servira de source de revenu additive.
Ainsi il veut acheter une moto qu’il mettra en circulation comme taxi. Avec ce financement, il compte réaliser ce projet. Cela lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Tabligbo, Mr. Komi N. now lives with his family in Momé-Woédjépé. A teacher, he is the father of five. With the difficulties he has making a decent living for his family with his meager salary, he wants to add concurrent work as a source of additional income. To do so, he wants to buy a motor-bike to put to use as a taxi. With this financing, he intends to realize this project, allowing him to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor-bike

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara H. is a 55-year-old woman who is married and has four children. The diligent search for a source of additional income has been a permanent and difficult task for Sara. She chose a livestock field.  She started this business more than 20 years ago with the support of her husband. Now Sara has experimented and acquired the necessary knowledge regarding this activity. So she would like to expand her activity by purchasing more cattle so she can increase her earnings and continue to improve her family’s quality of life. Sara is requesting a loan of 1200 USD. She has agreed to repay this loan within 15 months. She appeals to your good hearts in her request to make her dreams become reality.

loans.use: Purchase two head of cattle

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
Florentino se dedica desde haces más de veinte años a la venta de repuestos y reparación automotriz. Cuando tiene la oportunidad de comprar autos descompuestos lo hace y luego de repararlos logra revenderlos una vez más a un mejor precio.

Toda su vida a trabajado con el fin de mantener su hogar. Hoy se siente orgulloso de ver a sus dos hijos mayores. No obstante, aún tiene la responsabilidad de velar por la educación de su nieto de nueve años, el cuidado de su esposa y el mantenimiento de su casa.

El sueña con abrir una tienda de repuestos en su casa y poder prescindir del local alquilado donde trabaja actualmente.
texts.en:
Florentino has been working for the past 20 years as a cart parts salesman and a mechanic. When he has the chance to buy broken-down cars, he does. He then fixes them up and sells them for a profit. All of his life he has worked to support his family. Today he feels proud to see his older sons. He is also responsible for paying for the education of his nine year old grandson. In addition he must provide for his wife and pay for the cost associated with their home. He dreams of opening a car parts store and operate it out of his house. Then he would be able to let go of the space that he presently rents and work out of his home.

(Translated by Alex and Jasmine of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Parts and Pay for Shop

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is a 27 year old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Ayman has been selling bread for four years. Ayman requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a van for his bread transportation. This is the first time that Ayman has requested a loan. In the future, Ayman plans to expand his business thanks to the van he will purchase.

loans.use: Ayman will use the loan to purchase a van for his bread transportation.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en: This group of borrowers consists of three members. Its leader, S., 55, is a mother of three children: all of them are students. She is married to Dy, 44, who is a motor taxi driver. S. has been selling Khmer noodles since 1990 to the whole commune. She is famous for making tasty food and she is a responsible neighbor. She earns a good income for her family. She has a big piece of land behind her house that she could possibly use to start another business for her family's income. Therefore, S. decided to take a loan to buy piglets for the family to raise. The other group members are: S., 37, who sells a kind of junk food (fried banana) and is taking a loan to pay for the electric service into her home; and T., 54, who works as security for a private company, wants a loan to buy a fan and home accessories for the family.

loans.use: To buy piglets for the family to raise

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es: Jhon tiene 30 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, también cuida de su madre. Todos viven en su casa propia. Por las mañanas, en su casa, se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales (naranjas, mandarinas, granadillas, entre otras variedades de frutas que produce su zona), y por las noches vende comida en una plaza cercana, para ello lo apoyan su esposa y su madre. En esta actividad ya lleva un periodo de 7 años y le va muy bien, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es vender y dar una muy buena atención a sus clientes, además le es rentable porque sus productos se venden diariamente y le generan buenos ingresos. Jhon está muy satisfecho con su trabajo, porque las ganancias le están permitiendo reparar algunos desperfectos de su vivienda. Para más adelante quiere implementar un restaurante amplio para la acogida de todos sus comensales. Con MFP tiene 3 préstamos, Jhon menciona que le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque existe orden y puntualidad entre sus integrantes. Con el dinero que ahora viene solicitando implementará sus dos negocios, tanto el de venta de frutas, como el de comida. Con otra parte también arreglará algunas estructuras de su casa.
texts.en:
Jhon is 30 years old and married with two children. He also takes care of his mother and they all live together in his house. Each morning he sells fruit from his house (such as oranges, mandarins, grapefruit and other types of fruit that are grown in his region) and at night he sells meals in a nearby plaza in order to provide for his wife and his mother. He has been engaged in this activity for the last seven years and it is going well for him. What he likes about his work is the selling and giving good service to his customers. It is also profitable for him because he can sell things every day and they bring him a good income. Jhon is very satisfied with his work because his earnings are allowing him to make some repairs on his house. In the future he would like to open a restaurant big enough to accomodate all of his guests. Jhon has three loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA and he mentioned that he likes working with his communal bank because of the order and punctuality that exists among the members. The funds that he is requesting will be invested in his two businesses, selling fruit and selling meals, and part of it will also be used to repair some parts of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to resell and to fix up his house.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
H. Ahmad is 44 years old and is married with two children. He runs a jewelry shop and has been in this business already for 12 years. Ahmad produces jewelry like earrings and silver and gold rings. As a rule, he purchases the input materials from the general public.

So that Ahmad is able to purchase the input materials, like fragments, precious and semi-precious stones, and reagents for producing the jewelry, he requests a loan of $2000. Ahmad is a repeated client of IMON with a positive credit history, and he promises to pay this loan on time.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy input materials like fragments, precious and semi-precious stones and reagents

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Since 1986, Kate M. has worked as a trader selling material and clothing at Anafo near Cape Coast. She is married with 1 child and her husband works as a refrigerator repairman.  Kate is responsible for paying her family’s water bill and her child’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase additional material and clothing to support her business.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to purchase additional material and clothing to support her business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion D. resides at Sapang Dalaga and has been a regular member of PMPC’s PDP-LP program for almost two years. She is happily married with five children and her husband is a farmer and also a fisherman. She’s asking a loan of 5,000 PHP to maintain fishing boat and fishing net for her husband. She thanks PMPC for helping her financially. Her husband in pictured above on the blue boat, preparing for fishing.

loans.use: additiional capital for fishing

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort G., married with six dependents, received education through primary school. She sells fresh foodstuffs such as fresh tomatoes in Abortoase while her husband fishes on a domestic basis but earns little income for a living. Comfort uses her income to cover the financial needs of the children and the family at large. She is requesting the loan to purchase a variety of fresh foodstuffs to sell, and with the new profits from her expanded business, plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan to purchase a variety of fresh foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Maria Filibertina
