texts.es: Doña Filibertina de 37 años de edad, con dos hijos, el mayor de 17 años, tiene una trabajadora de 13 años de edad, ella no descansa atiende su negocio en todo momento tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, le nació la idea de poner una tienda por el sector donde vive no hay ninguna tienda cerca y las pocas que hay quedan muy lejos, también los sábados venden pollo por libra y los domingo venta de refacciones ella se esfuerza para poder darle a sus hijos educación porque quiere verlos profesionales, su sueño es poder construir una casa mas grande porque la que tiene es pequeña y también que sus hijos tengan una habitación cada uno y darles calidad de vida y tener una familia feliz.
texts.en:
Mrs. Filibertina is 37 years old and has two children. Her oldest child is 17-years-old. She has a 13 year old girl to help her with her business. Mrs. Filibertina never rests. She takes care of her business every waking moment. She has a general store that she got the idea to open near her home because there weren’t any stores in the area. On Saturdays, they sell chicken by the pound and spare parts on Sundays. She tries hard to give her children a good education because she wants to help them become professionals. Her dream is to build a bigger house since the one they have is very small. She would like each of her children to have their own room and provide them with a higher standard of living and have a happy family.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de articulos de consumo diario

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina sells drinks and snacks. She is 33 years old and married with three children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan amount of 3,000 NGN to purchase juice and other drinks. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase drinks and snacks

loans.name: Mrs. Saren Eam Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of twenty-four people, is located in Slab Ta Aon village in Kandal province. Mrs. Saren E. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members.

Mrs. Saren E. has four children two of whom are firewood sellers in the local village and the others are too young to work or study because they are at the age of two and four years old. Her husband, Mr. Meas Sophy, works in the Disabled People Center.

Mrs. Saren E. owns a small restaurant in the local village where she sells Chinese noodles. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her  business

loans.name: Luis Alonzo

texts.es:
el sr. Luis Alonzo B. se dedica al servicio de transportar personas, el tiene un taxi, un nissan sentra año 1984, dicho carro le ha dado muchas ganancias, pero ahora necesita pintarlo por completo ya que las autoridades de servicios de transportes le exigen que tienen que andar con los carros bien pintados y tapizados para darles mejor servicios a sus clientes. 
en estos momentos Luis no tiene dinero para pintar el taxi y es por tal razon que esta solicitando el credito para poderlo pintar si no lo pueden castigar y queda sin prestar servicios la unidad.
Tambien piensa tapizarlo todo el carro.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Alonzo B. transports people for a living, he owns a taxi, a Nissan Sentra 1984. This car has given him good earnings, but now he needs to paint it to meet a requirement from the transportation service authorities, demanding that cars be well painted and upholstered to offer better service to the customers.

Presently Luis does not have money to paint the taxi and therefore he is requesting the loan to be able to paint it, if not they may penalize him and he will not be able to offer service with the unit. He also wants to upholster the entire car.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material to paint a taxi.

loans.name: Akouvi Victoire

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est spécialisée dans la vente d’huile dans le marché d’Akodessewa à lomé. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 1991 pour pouvoir apporter sa contribution financière à son mari menuisier pour l’éducation de leurs 02 enfants. Elle s’approvisionne le plus souvent à Agbodrafo, ville située à quelques kilomètres de Lomé. Elle dispose de beaucoup de clients fidèles, à cause de la bonne qualité de ses huiles, faites à partir de la noix de coco. Certaines revendeuses viennent aussi s’approvisionner auprès d’elle en bidons d’huile. Elle a un besoin urgent de s’approvisionner en bidons d’huile, c’est pour cette raison qu’elle voudrait avoir un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 50 bidons d’huile.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is specialized in selling oil at the Akodessewa marketplace in Lomé.  She started this business in 1991 to be able to do her financial share to help her husband, a carpenter, to educate their two children.  She usually stocks up in Agbodrafo, a city located a few kilometers from  Lomé.  She has many loyal customers because of the good quality of her oils, which are made from coconuts. Also, some retailers come to her to supply themselves with drums of oil. She has an urgent need to stock up with drums of oil.  This is the reason she would like to obtain a WAGES loan, so as to buy 50 of them.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy containers of oil

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 27 year old business woman who owns a boutique in Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last four years. She is requesting for a first loan of Kes. 30,000 in order to add stock of shoes. A mother of one, Grace hopes to educate her child to the highest level  using her business profits, buy a home for her family and buy rental units. She describes herself as social hard working and determined.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 29 years old and married with two children. She sells groceries. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia sells tailoring materials and sarongs. She is also a commercial tailor and makes beautiful clothes for her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 38 years old and married with three children.

This is the high season for Felicia’s business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda G. is from the village of Bobontugan, Jasaan Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old, and married with 10 school-aged children.

To make a living, Imelda runs a sari-sari (variety) shop. Her main source of income comes from selling both food and daily use products to the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting her first loan from HSPFI, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of children.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a 60-year-old farmer. She explains that, even at her age, she can still manage to perform farming duties. She has been married for 30 years, and she has four children. Her oldest child, who is 39 years old, does not live with the family anymore.

Ofelia does not have sufficient capital to satisfy her farm’s financial needs, so she joined CEVI to gain access to its loan service and for other benefits. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP ($325), which she will use to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farming necessities. With the loan proceeds, she will also purchase diesel for her tractor.

loans.use: To improve her business by purchasing farming necessities (e.g., seeds, fertilizers, and fuel)

loans.name: Yeno

texts.en:
Yeno B. sells items including salt, books, sugar, beans, and biscuits.  She is requesting a loan to buy bags of rice and beans to sell.  Yeno is 26 years old and is her husband is a business man. She has four children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. M. is 45 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Her husband is a security guard at International House in Nairobi. The couple hope to build a home and educate their children to college level. Elizabeth is innovative, hardworking, caring, and honest.
Elizabeth's business is at Pipeline and is known as Leems Beauty Shop. She sells beauty products to supermarkets, salons, and local people. She also engages in midwifery. Her major challenges are lack of funds, harassment from the local authority, and few permanent customers. She is using her loan to buy more hair extensions, hair chemicals, and treatments, and to open a small general store. In the future, she hopes to open a beauty supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and treatments, and to open a small general store

loans.name: Đặng Thị's Group

texts.en: S. Đặng Thị (10114070001) is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh, Hà Nội. She is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cổ Dương (2). S. is married and has two school-aged children. She operates a business raising pigs for sale. S. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month. In 2003, S. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,148,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. S. is now requesting a new loan of 5,014,000 VND which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 8th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Đinh Thị L. (10114070004) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business running a general store. 2. Nguyễn Thị Y. (10114070003) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 6,322,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 3. Đinh Thị T. (10114070016) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 4,142,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** S. Đặng Thị (10114070001) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. S. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cổ Dương (2). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. S. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, S. kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND. Vào 2003, S. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. S. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6,148,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Đinh Thị L. (10114070004) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 2. Nguyễn Thị Y. (10114070003) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,322,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 3. Đinh Thị T. (10114070016) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,142,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Carolina Cobero Group

texts.en:
Carolina C. is from the village of Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Carolina is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Carolina is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Carolina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Carolina has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Carolina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carolina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Carolina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Carolina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie T. is from the village of D’Ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children.

Lenie owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2003, Lenie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Lenie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 11th loan taken out by from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba tiene 52 años, por lo que su actividad es la una librería y la venta de ropa. Por lo que tiene más de 32 años de dedicarse a este negocio, Alba siempre está buscando la manera de obtener ingresos para su familia. Esta no es la primera experiencia con financiamientos por lo que le han sido de ayuda necesaria para su negocio, además con ciertas ganancias logro comprar un poco de ropa para venderla a unos cuantos clientes. Sus 4 hijos trabajan de manera independiente y le ayudan en la atención con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cuadernos, lápices, borradores e invertir un poco en la compra de ropa. Su deseo es prosperar con sus 2 negocios.
texts.en:
Alba is 55 years old. Her activity is a bookstore and selling clothes. She has been working at this business for more than 32 years. Alba is always looking for a way to get income for her family. This is not her first experience with financing; it has been a necessary help for her business. With some earnings, she was able to buy a little clothes to sell to a few clients. Her four children work independently and they help her attend to customers. The financing she is asking for is to purchase notebooks, pencils, erasers and to invest a little in the purchase of clothes. Her wish is to prosper with her two businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tafaoga

texts.en:
Tafaoga F. is 28 and married with 1 child.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Tafaoga has 1 year of experience in this business.  Tafaoga needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tafaoga joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Tafaoga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Tafaoga F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.7 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 23 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo que Yolanda se dedica, es el cultivo de papa y arvejas, es así que todos los días desde muy temprano, empieza su labor, tratando de mejorar la calidad de su producción, para luego ser vendidos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, cuyas ganancias le ayudarán a cubrir sus propios gastos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, por lo que lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus cultivos, ya que pone en riesgo su salud. Más  adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para que pueda aumentar su producción. Este es su Primer préstamo con MFP, considera que el crédito que necesita, le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Asimismo en su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros, por ser muy solidaria con ellos. Los mil nuevos soles que solicita, los invertirá en la compra de insecticidas, para evitar que la plaga de insectos afecten sus campos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 23, is a very hardworking and responsible young woman. She lives at home with her parents, and her biggest wish is to improve her quality of life. The work that Yolanda does is growing potatoes and field peas. Every morning she starts work very early, trying to improve the quality of her production, so that she can sell her products in the wholesale market in Tarma. The earnings that she receives help her cover her own expenses. What she likes most about her work is to cultivate the fields. In this she sees the results of the months of work as the fruit of her labor. She has been doing this work for the last 3 years and finds the most difficult part is fumigating the crops since this puts her health at risk. In the future she would like to buy new fields so that she can increase her production. This is her first loan with MFP. She feels that the loan is necessary to help her progress in her work. She is very well-liked by the rest of the members of the communal group. She is considered a supporter of all. The nine thousand soles that she is requesting will be used to buy insecticides, to avoid the plagues of insects that affect her farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy insecticides to protect her crops from plagues

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Mr. Sophan B., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Sambo Soun, 43, live in a small village along National Road Number Three, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. One of their sons is a driver and two have full-time employment.  
 
Sophan has been a construction worker for 22 years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for ten years. He is asking for his first loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike to get work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 28 years of age, married with four children and all her children go to school. She resides and rents a two-room house where she stays with six people. Maria doesn’t take care of additional family members.  Maria sells cold drinks in Kalerwe market, one of the markets in Kawempe division in Kampala district. She sells cold drinks like passion juice, water and soda.  She wants to use this loan of 300,000/= to buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, a sack of passion fruits and 10 kilograms of sugar. 

Maria has been in this business for two years and with MCDT for one and half years, servicing her third loan. Besides this business, she also owns bicycles for hire, which brings 4,000/= per day. Maria pays  market dues of 1,000 /= per day worked and 2,500 to rent her refrigerator. Maria gets all types of customers ranging from cyclists to vendors. Maria works six days a week. Her business challenges are the rainy season and defaulters. Maria aspires to see her business grow big, to buy her own refrigerator and to employ two girls. She joined MCDT because she wanted to increase her capital base. Maria’s monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more soda, mineral water and sugar

loans.name: Bulowooza B Namulawa Irene Group

texts.en:
N. Irene, a hardworking businesswoman, is 47 years old. She is married with 10 children, four of whom are in school. She is also looking after five dependents who are in school too. She has a retail business, which she has been operating for over four years. 

She is using the loan to purchase retail items, such as sugar, soap, salt, flour, paraffin, etc., for sale. She is an encouraging businesswoman whose dream is to work very hard for the welfare of her family and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase retail items, such as sugar, soap, salt, flour and paraffin, for sale

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mr. Bun S. is a middle-aged man whose his wife appears in the photo here. Bun S. currently makes wooden beds for sale. He sells his finished product to buyers who come directly to his house. He makes many sets of beds before selling out. His wife is a cloth sewing laborer in a garment factory. The couple helps each other to earn money in order to meet all the needs of their family or to make sure that a small child attains a good level of education and gets enough food. Recently, Bun S. has run out of essential materials from his supply stock and he hopes to acquire other raw materials to continue making beds. He depends on using his Kiva loan as an advance.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Family Affairs Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale-business people in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and make more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living.

Ibrahim J. is the leader of this group. He was born in Kono, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. He is 27 years of age and is married with one child. His wife is a businesswoman and his child is still not of school-going age.

Ibrahim is a carpenter and has been in this profession for nine years now. He is seeking this loan in order to buy planks, nails, polish and other carpentry supplies.

loans.use: To buy planks, nails, polish and other carpentry supplies

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia A. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 48 years old. Lilia is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale like "kangkong," eggplant, okra and etc., in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for her crops

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha S. is from the village of Obay, Polanco. She is 41 years old. Editha is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Editha works in someone else's business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal care products to tourists and local community members. Editha is just starting this business.

In 2010, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used  to purchase additional products to sell. Editha is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Editha from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yainkain

texts.en:
This is 31 year-old Yainkain. She is married, and has 2 children aged 6 years and under one year. She has 3 additional dependents, who live with her because they need assistance, since one comes from a divorced home and the other 2 from a village where facilities for good education are not available.

In the year 2000, Yainkain established her hair dressing and cosmetics business. She began this business because she wants to fight poverty; she started as an apprentice and later opened her own business. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 1,261,500 SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Yainkain requires a loan in order to buy synthetic hair, perming cream, and shampoos. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 252,300SLL. In the future, Yainkain plans to provide everything her customers may need in her salon. Yainkain hopes to utilize this loan well and repay it. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more hair products.

loans.name: Shakirah

texts.en:
Shakirah N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. Single with no children, she has had a business rearing poultry for two years. Shakirah also sells vegetables

To help expand her business, Shakirah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more feed for the chickens (maize brand) to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to become a lawyer. Shakirah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by creating a job for her that has helped the family in paying school fees.

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans and giving Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more feed for her poultry (maize brand)

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El Sr. Julio vive en la localidad de San José municipio de la Guardia, distante a 29 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es separado, tiene un hijo, a quien le ayuda con una pensión mensual, es de ocupación chofer propietario, brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros de la ciudad de Santa Cruz a la localidad de el torno, el destino del crédito es para cambiar el motor de su vehículo que se encuentra en mal estado, es nacido en el la provincia Caballero de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, hace 4 años que se dedica al transporte, le va muy bien ya que se levanta desde tempranas horas de la mañana para trabajar, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Julio lives in the la Guardia district of San José, located 29 km from the city of Santa Cruz. He is separated and has one child, who receives a monthly payment from him. He owns a car and drives passengers from Santa Cruz to his area. He will use the loan to change his vehicle's motor, which is in bad shape. Julio was born in Santa Cruz's Caballero province. He has been working in transport for four years and is so doing well that he has to get up early to go to work. He is grateful for the support he has received from the Emprender microfinance partner.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motor

loans.name: Alba Leoneris

texts.es: La Sra. Alba Leoneris R. C. posee una pulpería tiene tres años de trabajar en este ramo, esta trabajando con nuestra institución por primera vez y ha manifestado su gran interés y entusiasmo por ver aun mas crecimiento en su negocio también hemos realizado correspondiente supervisión y pudimos constatar la veracidad de la demanda de sus productos los cuales son granos básicos y otros  productos de mucha demanda en el hogar, este negocio esta ubicado en un barrio de la ciudad de Estelí.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alba Leoneris R. C. has had a small grocery store for the last three years.  

This is her initial collaboration with our institution and she has shown great interest and enthusiasm to see her business grow even more.  

We have conducted the relevant study and have confirmed the demand which exists for her products which are basic grains and other highly sought after goods for the home.

The store is located in a neighborhood in the city of Estelí.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna G. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 34 years old. Lorna is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling used clothing in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lorna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jane Njoki

texts.en:
Jane started selling clothes in Naivasha town in January of this year.  She finds the business very  profitable.  She is 53 years old, married to Jimmi M., and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes to selll as she targets the coming holiday season.

In future, Jane hopes to have a big boutique selling different types of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran is the mother of 2 sons. Her elder son has a construction supplies business and the younger one grows seasonal crops. She is married to S. M. who is a security guard by profession. She lives with her family in a 2 room brick house in Pakpattan, famous for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. She moved there 20 years ago.

Manzooran supports her family by selling cow milk from her dairy cow. She takes care of it and sells its milk to her neighboring clients. She is also a very good housewife who does her household responsibilities very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her son who wants to buy some fertilizers and seeds to get maximum output from his fields. He has been doing this business for over 10 years and Manzooran is hopeful that an investment will be more profitable for her son and his income will double.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. She is a responsible client and has always paid installments on time and attended every meeting. This is a group loan. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Manzooran.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer & seeds for agriculture business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She operates a grocery business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Gladys faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to build her own house in the future. With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, sukuma wiki (green vegetables) and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, sukuma wiki (green vegetables) and potatoes

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children. 

In 2006, after working for 2 years in another grocery shop, Haidar decided to open his own grocery shop. Now he has a a lot of experience in this field. He is well-known in his local community and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to renovate his shop and add an outside stand. He aims to expand his business and improve his family's life style.

loans.use: Renovate his shop and add an outside stand

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife. Since 1995, he has acquired good experience working as a home painter. He works on a freelance basis upon the customers’ request. He is the main source of income for his wife. Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his business tools and purchase paints for his newest project. He wants to be ready to please the client and earn a good business reputation. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his business and be able to take construction projects in order to expand his business operation.

loans.use: To renew his business tools and purchase paints

loans.name: Mi Progreso De San José Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Mi Progreso D. san José, inicia su ciclo 6 con 21 socias. Roberta es L. Presidenta del Banco Comunal, tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Se dedica a L. venta D. comida. Roberta venD. alimentos todos lo domingos en L. feria D. animales, paradero D. L. ruta No “6”, los demás días D. L. semana se dedica a bordar correas, tapices y bolsos. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en L. compra D. insumos para L. preparación D. alimentos. A Roberta le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal porque le dan capacitaciones que le sirven para progresar, le dan créditos y pueD. ahorrar. Su sueño es que sus hijos puedan estudiar y que crezca su negocio.
texts.en:
The 'Mi Progreso D. San José' community bank is beginning its 6th loan cycle with 21 members.  Roberta is the president of this community bank.  She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children.  Her business is selling meals.

Roberta sells food every Sunday on the 'feria D. animales' (animal market) stop on the "No. 6" bus route.  The other days of the week, she embroiders belts, tapestries and bags.

Roberta will invest the loan she is requesting in buying supplies for preparing her meals.  Roberta likes her community bank meetings because they receive training which helps them to make progress, they receive loans and they are able to save.  Her dream is for her children to be able to study and for her business to grow.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Mwanasada

texts.en:
Mwanasada is a widow with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a fruit selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanasada faces a major challenge of competition in her business. She hopes to increase sales to generate more revenue in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase fruits and flavourings for making natural soft drinks for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and flavourings for making natural soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en: Samrith O. has been spending his life with cultivating crops in the province of Kompong Cham. He learned this skill from his grandparent when he was young. Samrith O. is now married and has four kids, two of whom are single, and two are married. His wife works in the farm fields frequently alongside him. Besides of farming business, Samrith O. and his wife also grow a few molds for making additional profit behind his house. Soon they will start a new step of planting mold, but they lack some material to do it. In order to solve this problem, Samrith O. would like a loan to buy raw material, and other equipments for growing small mold.

loans.use: To purchase raw material, and other equipments for growing small mold.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Nhlanhlayethu Group

texts.en:
Ntombikayise is 47 years old and married with 7 children between the ages of 10 and 33. She sells mats house to house in Mtubatuba, KwaZ. Natal in South Africa. She is wearing a black and white head scarf in the photo above.

She's been in this business for 10 years. She also earns income from the government's child support grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is that her customers do not pay on time.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses to buy material for making mats. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her children to school. In the future, she would like to see herself being a mats supplier.

She thanks WDB and Kiva very much.

loans.use: Buy material for making mats

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits for resale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is currently in the business of washing clothes. She is 39 years old, married, 8 children and 5 of them go to school. Mariam borrowed a loan to stock more water, soap, basins and an ironing box to use. She hopes to pay her children in school with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: purchase more water, soap, basins and an ironing box

loans.name: Rosario Del Socorro

texts.es: Rosario Del Socorro se dedica a una pulpería, tiene más 7 años en este medio de vida. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora que disfruta de interactuar con sus clientes. Rosario recibe a sus clientes con una atención muy esmerada además de esto siempre trata de brindarles a sus clientes los productos que le solicitan. Atiende su negocio desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues casi no tiene mucha competencia.  Este financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes, refrescos, pan, sopas, enlatados y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Rosario Del Socorro owns a grocery store.  She has been in this business for more than seven years.  Rosario is a very enterprising woman who likes interacting with her customers.  She greets her customers with great care and always tries to provide them with the products that they request.

Rosario works in her business from 6.00am to 9.00pm.  She doesn't have much competition.  She will use this loan to buy basic grains, candies, detergents, soft drinks, bread, soup, canned goods and soda.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, detergents, soft drinks, bread, soups, canned goods and soda

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina es una madre de familia  de 31 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos, es de material rústico (adobe), cuenta solamente con servicio de luz, ubicada en el caserío Santa Rosa de Curvan a unos 10 minutos de distrito de Tambgrande  y a 40 minutos del  departamento de  Piura.  Todas esta zonas se dedica ha la actividad agricola,  ganadera y turismo.

Martina ha puesto  en su domilcilio su tienda de productos de primera necesidad (leche, azúcar, arroz, azúcar, todo tipo de golosinas, etc.),  para seguridad y comodidad de ella y de algún modo pueda atender a cualquier hora a sus  clientes, en la cual  encuentran todo lo que necesitan para su uso diario, con el negocio que a colocado trata en lo posible de que sus clientes estén satisfechos y por ende brindar un mejor nivel de vida para su familia.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Martina trata de adquirir un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda de más insumos y así pueda satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, con la finalidad de incrementar  sus ingresos.  

Martina es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y una madre que tiene como  objetivo que su familia salga adelante a punta de esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Martina is a 31 year-old mother who lives in her own home together with her husband and children.  Her house is made from basic building materials (adobe) and only has electricity.  It is located in the small village of Santa Rosa de Curvan, 10 minutes from Tambogrande district and 40 minutes from Piura department.  In all these areas, locals work in agriculture, livestock raising and tourism.

Martina has set up a grocery store, where she sells milk, sugar, rice, all sorts of candies, etc, in her home.  She did this for her own safety and comfort and also so that she could serve her customers at any hour of the day.  In her store, her customers find everything they need to use on a daily basis.  Martina tries to ensure that her customers are happy with her business and, as a consequence, she is able to provide her family with a better standard of living.

Martina visited Edpyme Alternativa to acquire a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles so that she could stock her store with more supplies and thereby meet her customers' needs and increase her income.

Martina is known by her neighbors as being a cheerful woman who is ready to help others.  She is also known as a mother whose goal is to get her family ahead in life through her efforts and hard work.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her business

loans.name: Rugiatu A.'s Group

texts.en:
The photo shows teachers of the Kulafai Rashideen Primary School in Lumpa, a village near Freetown, Sierra Leone.  This school was established in 1996 by Sheik Sulaiman to teach Arabic and promote education to the community's children.  

Rugiatu is the leader of the group of teachers.  She is a native of Bo City and has one child.  She has applied for a loan of SLL 1,200,000.00 to buy electrical appliances for her house.  

The school staff are part of Kiva partner Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) and are applying for loans. The loans help them to invest in or buy items that their salaries cannot cover. At the end of each month, the school bursar deducts repayment amounts directly to pay SMT on the teachers’ behalf.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances for her house

loans.name: Pedro Francisco

texts.es: Pedro Francisco tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos, de manera ambulante ya que sale a diferentes lugares para ofrecer sus productos, fue así de esta manera que pudo conseguir muchos clientes. Ahora está solicitando un financiamiento que será utilizado para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, maíz, concentrado entre otros. Pedro tiene el sueño de incrementar su negocio para que el día de mañana esto le asegure el futuro a su familia.
texts.en: Pedro Francisco has two adult children.  His economic activity is being a basic grains vendor.  He goes out to different places to sell his products and this is how he managed to acquire many customers.  Now, he’s asking for a loan that he’ll use as working capital to buy rice, beans, oil, corn and concentrate, among others.  Pedro’s dream is to increase his business so that he can assure his family’s future.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, corn and concentrate, among others.

loans.name: Jerus Tan Group

texts.en:
Jerus is married and has 2 children. She is 33 years old and lives in Baliangao.

Jerus sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,400 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 3,000 to purchased a variety of products for her general store. 

Jerus has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. She is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchased additional inventory.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 56 years old and lives in Plaridel. She is married with no children.

Rose has a shop where she sells ready-to-wear clothing. She has had this business for 3 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her ready-to-wear clothing business.

Rose explains that she has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, Rose hopes to better meet her family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her ready-to-wear clothing business

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en: Sevil is a hardworking woman who is married with four children. Her husband is a workman and doesn’t have a permanent job. For the past three years, Sevil has been running her sheep-feeding and farming business. She usually buys lambs from local vendors or from the livestock bazaar and after six to eight months she resells the grown sheep and fleece. With the profits she hopes to make, Sevil plans to enlarge her herd. Her husband helps her in this business. Sevil would like to request a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase sheep and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase eight sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Glenda Yamileth

texts.es:
Glenda, se dedica al comercio de ropa, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 4 años de edad, trabaja en el negocio desD. hace 6 años, todos los días de la semana, ofreciendo la mercadería en el centro de la ciudad y en los pueblos cercanos.
Ella necesita un financiamiento para la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio, comprando blusas, ropa interior, camisas y más prendas que sean necesarias para ofrecer a los clientes, su propósito es siempre estar preparada para atender la demanda.
Su visión es algún día tener su local de venta, que sea propio y fijo, para estabilizarse mejor con los clientes y poder estar más pendiente de su hijo y sus estudios.
texts.en:
Glenda sells clothes.  She lives with her husband and a 4-year-old son.  She’s been in business six years.  She works every day selling her merchandise in the center of the city and in nearby towns.

She needs a loan to buy merchandise to stock the business.  She will buy blouses, underwear, shirts and other articles of clothing she needs to offer her customers.  Her goal is to always be prepared to meet demand.  Her vision is to someday have a fixed locale of her own to become better stabilized with her customers and to be able to watch over her son and his schooling.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Lucie Elviath

texts.fr:
Cliente de 48 ans, célibataire sans enfant, a l’arrêt de ses études en classe de terminal , elle se lance dans la vente des grillades de poissons, des viandes et des cotes de porcs.Elle a des recettes de 35000 a 55000frs par jour,comme elle exerce a cote d'un bar, ses clients sont les gens qui viennent boire tous les soirs.

A l'octroi de ce prêt elle va acheter 2  cartons de cotes de porcs ,4 des cartons de cuisses et ailes de poulet 
2 cartons de saucisses.
Tres entreprenante , elle veut a la longue ouvrir un restaurant , c'est pour cela qu'avec ses bénéfices elle est entrain d’épargner pour qu'elle puisse s'acheter des chaises et tables en plastique, des couverts et des marmites pour mener a bout son projet.
texts.en:
Our client is 48 years old, unmarried, and without children. She dropped out of her last year of high school and then began selling grilled fish, meats, and pork chops. Her receipts range from 35,000 to 55,000 francs a day. Since she operates next to a bar, her customers are people who come to drink every evening. 

Upon being granted this loan, she is going to buy 2 boxes of pork chops, 4 boxes of chicken thighs and wings, and 2 boxes of sausages. A very entrepreneurial woman, she wants to open a restaurant in the future. For this reason, she is in the process of saving money, so that she may buy plastic chairs and tables, some place settings, and cooking pots to carry out her project.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken thighs, chinchards (fish), chops, and sausages

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 43-year-old single woman with seven children; all are living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a dream of educating her children up to university. Joyce has been earning her living by selling bananas, which she has been farming for the last 10 years, and she has also started building rental houses. Her major challenge has been inadequate capital to add onto her savings to complete her rental houses, and that is why she needs the loan -- to add onto her savings and complete the houses.

loans.use: To buy materials for the construction of rental units and house renovation.

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es: José Dolores de treinta y ocho años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia y en uno de los municipios mayormente poblados del país. El posee un taxi con el que recorre la ciudad y transporta a pasajeros  a diferentes lugares. Últimamente su taxi ha sido más solicitado por sus clientes pues saben que José es un hombre confiable y responsoble, además con precios accesibles, además hay una creciente demanda de pasajeros a razón de algunas deficiencias con que cuenta actualmente el sector de transporte en el país.  José es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo, para él solo los que luchan logran vencer; su taxi necesita reparaciones para dar un servicio al cien por ciento y no decepcionar a la clientela, es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la reparación de su vehículo de transporte, el taxi y no perder la clientela que posee. José Dolores tiene la esperanza que de esta forma le dará siempre a su familia lo necesario para su sostenimiento.
texts.en:
José Dolores is 38 and lives with his life partner and children in his own home in one of the most populated municipalities in the country. He owns a taxi with in which he travels the city, transporting passengers to different places. Recently his taxi has been requested more often by  passengers because they know that José is a dependable and responsible person and his prices are reasonable. As well, there is a growing demand from commuters because of some current problems in the country’s transportation sector.

José is a man who is dedicated to his work. For him, only those who fight succeed in winning. His taxi needs repairs in order for him to provide 100% service and not disappoint his clients. That is why he is requesting a loan from Integral to repair his taxi and not lose the customers he has. José Dolores hopes that in this way he will always be able to give his family the support they need.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 41 years of age. She is a very supportive person in nature, supporting her husband in operating his livestock business. She gets up early in the morning and gets milk from the buffalo and cows so her husband can sell them to his clients and earn income for the family.

She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well.  She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Her son is studying in a nearby school while her daughter stays with her.

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband's business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits. Her husband has a good number of clients in his community who purchase milk from him regularly. He is very experienced in his business and Naseem hopes that an investment will make his business more profitable.

She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia de 29 años, convive con cesar de 30 años, con quien tiene 02 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Sivia. Desde muy pequeña aprendió el trabajo de carpintería, pues sus familiares se encagaban de fabricar muebles, pero para ello este negocio no le era suficiente y atractivo. Con el pasar del tiempo, logró montar su propia tienda, en ella expende toda clase de productos de primera necesidad. Pero en un inicio le fue un reto capatar clientela pero el estar cosntantemente en su negocio ha logrado obtenerlos. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se siente comprometida en cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Virginia is married and lives with her husband of 30 years, and they have 2 children. They live together in their own house in the district of Silvia. From the time she was little she learned the craft of carpentry.Her relatives assembled and made furniture but she was not attracted to or fulfilled by this line of work.

As time went by she started her own store expanding into all sorts of staples. In the beginning it was hard to get customers but she was there all the time and she began to get them.

This will be her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time.
With the 2000 soles she is asking for, she will buy more supplies of staples for her store.

loans.use: to buy products in order to supply her store

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del banco comunal "Mujeres Triunfadoras" del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Recién lleva tres ciclos  trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.  Ella se dedica a la comercialización de pescado, los lleva a vender por la carretera junto a su esposo, él maneja su furgón que compraron especialmente para este negocio que es ir a distintas partes llevando a vender el pescado.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles comprará:5 tinas de pescado bagre, 2 tinas de bocachico,1 tina de sardinas, 1 bandeja de lisa. 
Su movilidad no tiene más capacidad, pero es regular lo que pueden transportar, solo tiene pena cuando deja a su hijo para salir a trabajar.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad de ser parte de su familia..
texts.en:
María is a member of the "Mujeres Triunfadoras" (Triumphant Women) Communal Bank in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 29 years old, married, and has one son. She has recently completed three loan cycles working with loans from Manuela Ramos. She works selling fish along the highway with her husband. He drives the van that they bought especially for this business, going to different locations transporting fish to sell.

With her new loan of 1,000.00 nuevo soles, she will buy 5 tubs of catfish, 2 tubs of bocachico fish, 1 tub of sardines, and 1 tray of grey mullet. Her van does not have room for more than that, but that is the normal amount they can transport. The only thing she regrets is leaving her son when she goes to work. She is thankful for the opportunity to be a member of the Manuela Ramos family.

loans.use: buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en: Kebbeh is 24 years old and lives in Barnersville. She is single and has a three-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past four years she has been selling oil, rice, pepper and beans. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and beans for her business. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She hopes to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and beans for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa, necesita un nuevo préstamo para la compra D. ingredientes para hacer tamales, como maíz, condimentos, hojas, pollo, esta compra le ayudara para mantener en el negocio todo lo necesario, así también mejorara la capacidad para la producción.
Ella ha tenido una mejoría en el negocio, y además en este lapso D. tiempo ha sido madre D. una niña que ahora tiene 4 meses D. nacida, ha sido realmente una bendición contar con un nuevo miembro en la familia.
texts.en: Rosa needs a new loan to buy ingredients to make tamales, such as corn, toppings, leaves and chicken. This purchase will help her to have everything  her business needs as well as improve her production capacity. Things have gotten better at her business, and also at this time she has become a mother. She has a 4 month old daughter, and it has really been a blessing to have a new member of the family.

loans.use: to buy corn, toppings, leaves and chicken.

loans.name: Ma Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Ma Elizabeth es una mujer muy trabajadora tiene sueños y proyectos en su vida. Hace 4 años puso su negocio de mercería-papelería y abarrotes donde ofrece   moños para niñas que ella misma elabora y parte de utiles escolares que le solicitan sus clientes y también tiene todo en abarrote en general, refrescos, lácteos,  botanas  de marcas reconocidas a un bajo precio.Elizabeth requiere de un préstamo para pagar a uno de sus proveedores y comprar material de listón para la elaboración de los moños ya que le ha resultado muy bien ya que en este momento esta de moda, de esta manera no tendrá solo los estantes y exhibidores. Necesita realizar esa compra para que su negocio este bien surtido y de esta manera reciba mayores ganancias para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mrs. Ma Elizabeth is a hard-working woman who has dreams and goals for her life. She opened a grocery store four years ago. She sells hair bows for girls that she makes herself and makes parts of school uniforms that her clients ask for. She also sells all sorts of groceries: soda, dairy products, snacks, and more. She sells brand names at low prices. Elizabeth is requesting a loan to pay one of her providers and buy ribbon to make the bows, since they are very fashionable right now and she has done well selling them. In order to keep her shelves full she needs to make this purchase. This way she will make a better income in order to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pop, snacks, dairy products and grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is married with two children. He is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Nelson owns and operates a business venture selling fresh eggs in the local community to earn a living. He has been doing this for seven years, and every month he earns 3000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 25000 PHP to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.

Nelson has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Nelson hopes to help his children finish their studies and to double the income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve his business.

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es: Claudia, quiere invertir en mercadería, por eso solicita un préstamo para hacer el pedido de blusas, faldas, camisas, vestidos, para ofrecer a los clientes mercadería nueva y poder mejorar las ventas en los meses que faltan del año, ella continua con su tienda de productos de primera necesidad, ademas de eso quiere iniciar con un nuevo rubro que es el comercio de ropa. Ella ha incrementado el negocio y sus  clientes han aumentado dándole una mejor solvencia y seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Claudia wants to invest in merchandise, so she is asking for a loan to buy blouses, skirts, shirts and dresses to be able to offer her customers new merchandise and improve her sales during the slow months. She continues to work in her general store, and in addition to this wants to start a new venture, which is selling clothing.

She has increased her business and her customers, giving her greater financial solvency and economic security.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, shirts and dresses.

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca es socia del banco comunal Rosa Rojas, vive en la ciudad Paute lugar que tiene un clima cálido, lugar propicio para el cultivo de las más hermosas flores y de una gran variedad de frutas, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y muy carismáticas mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Blanca tiene 29 años, es madre soltera de un niño de dos años de edad. Vive en casa de su madre con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, la casa es propia. 

Ella trabaja en una plantación de flores hace un año, labora de lunes a sábado todo el día. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes.
 
Este es su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para continuar con este negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio estable como una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the Rosa Rojas communal bank. She lives in the city of Pauta, which has a hot climate, and is a propitious place for the cultivation of the most beautiful flowers and a wide variety of fruits. Its people practice agriculture and raise animals. They are kind and very charismatic people, and they maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

Blanca is 29 years old. She is a single mother of a two-year-old boy. She lives in her mother's house, and she shares household expenses with her. Her mother owns the house.

She has worked on a flower plantation for one year. She works Monday through Saturday, all day. At home she raises chickens and guinea pigs.

This is her fourth loan with her communal bank, and she is going to use it to purchase chickens to continue with this business.

Her goal is to have a stable business like a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es: La señora Gilda con 64 años de edad, habita sola en su propia casa. Ella posee una pupuseria la cual ha sabido adecuar en su hogar de habitación. Tiene mucha clientela ya que ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer carismática, trabajadora, dedicada y responsable. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de ella ya que con el tiempo y su trabajo ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos. A pesar de su avanzada edad no se cansa de trabajar ya que para ella su pupuseria es su principal  satisfacción. La ubicación del negocio es muy accesible y transitada. La señora Gilda es muy emprendedora ya que siempre está pensando en la forma de hacer crecer su negocio. Su sueño es poder cubrir una mayor demanda del mercado, por lo que ha decidido invertir en su negocio con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos que le permitan accesar a una mejor calidad de vida. Todo esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL ya que no cuenta con el efectivo suficiente para la inversión. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de los insumos necesarios (maíz, arroz, queso, chicharon, tomates, repollos, etc.) para la producción y venta de las deliciosas pupusas. La señora expresa estar muy agradecida con esta institución ya que en el pasado recibió la ayudo de dicha institución para invertir en su negocio. Espera recibir resultados favorables en esta ocasión.
texts.en: Gilda is 64 years old and lives by herself in her own house. She has a shop where she sells pupusas [stuffed tortillas], which she has managed to set up in her home. She has many customers since she is a charismatic woman, hard-working, dedicated, and responsible. Many people give her a good reference since over time and through her work she has earned the confidence of her neighbors. Despite her age, she does not get tired of working, especially since her pupusa shop is her main satisfaction. Her business is located in a very accessible, high traffic area. Gilda is very enterprising, especially since she is always thinking of ways to increase her business. Her dream is to be able to respond to an increase in demand, which is why she has decided to invest in her business. Her goal is to improve her sales and revenues, which will allow her to enjoy a better quality of life. For this reason she has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL, especially since she currently lacks the necessary capital to cover the investment. She will invest the loan by purchasing ingredients such as corn, rice, cheese, chicharrón [pork skins], tomatoes, and cabbage, etc., which are necessary for the production and sale of her delicious pupusas. Gilda is very grateful to the institution for the help she received from it last year to invest in her business. She expects to have favorable results again.

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, cheese, chicharrón [pork skins], tomatoes, and cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. Allan has a rice field and he harvests & sells rice grains during harvest time. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for the farm. Allan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Allan hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice farm.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco, es una persona humilde, honesta, responsable  y trabajador, curso hasta la primaria, no pudo concluir el bachillerato por problemas económicos, viéndose en la necesidad de buscar trabajo desde muy joven y por tanto dejar de lado los estudios; de estado civil soltero. El Sr. Francisco lleva más de 20 años en la venta de periódicos, ingresos con los que actualmente cuenta, su lugar de trabajo es la Plaza Luis de Fuentes lugar muy concurrido en la ciudad. El motivo por el cual el Sr. Francisco solicita el crédito es para poder refaccionar su vivienda ya que se encuentra deteriorada ya que en estas épocas de lluvia es cuando el mas padece es por esta razón que necesita de recursos económicos para poder mejorar la misma  y de esa forma sentirse más satisfecho, ya que tiene el deseo de vivir en mejores condiciones de vida y gracias al crédito que solicita podrá lograrlo.
texts.en: Francisco is a humble, honest, responsible and hardworking person who is single, he completed primary school studies but was unable to continue high school studies due to financial difficulties, finding it necessary to go out and find work at a young age and consequently put studies to the side. Francisco has spent more than 20 years selling newspapers, his current source of income, he works in the Luis de Fuentes plaza, a well-frequented place in the city. The reason for which Francisco is seeking the loan to repair his home as it is damaged, given that it is during these rainy seasons that it suffers the most, that is why he needs financial resources to be able to repair it and in this way feel more satisfied, as he wants to live in better living conditions, and it is thanks to the loan he is seeking that he will be able to achieve it.

loans.use: to repair his home.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice O., a 52 years old dynamic client of LAPO. She has proved her worth of experience in her line of business. She is maintaining her repayment schedule with LAPO without fail. She needs this money ($500) to keep her business booming.

loans.use: Sales of Clothes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Born in 1968 in Lomé, Mrs. Rose B. is married to an unemployed accountant and has two (02) dependent children. In this difficult situation, she chose to go into business and began selling fabrics. She is the only one taking care of the household needs, since her husband is unemployed and cannot contribute financially.

In spite of Mrs. B.'s continued efforts, her family's financial situation keeps worsening, since her business is not profitable enough. She is asking for a loan of $800 for the first time, to increase her capacity of buying textiles in department stores at a reduced cost, which would result in a bigger profit margin that will in turn help her provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1968 à Lomé, Madame B. Rose est mariée à un comptable en chômage et a deux (02) enfants à charge. Dans cette situation difficile, elle opta pour le commerce et commença la vente des tissus pagnes. Elle s’occupe seule des besoins du ménage étant donné que son mari ne pouvait rien apporter financièrement car lui aussi est au chômage. Malgré les efforts permanents de madame B., la situation financière de la famille ne cesse de s’aggraver, puisque ses activités commerciales également ne sont pas trop rentables. Pour augmenter sa capacité d’achat des pagnes dans les grands magasins à un coût réduit afin de dégager une marge bénéficiaire importante et subvenir à tous les besoins de sa famille, elle sollicite pour la première fois un financement de $800 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce.

loans.use: Wholesale and resale of fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry and feed for her poultry business

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 42 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her elder son served in the army and now has arrived home. The other two 2 are minors and study at school. Her husband works in local wood processing factory in a construction brigade. The money earned by him is not sufficient for the maintenance of the family.
