Desde hace un año, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca; dice que empezó porque su madre vendía y así la animó a ofrecer a sus amigas y conocidas. Le esta yendo muy bien pues obtiene ganancias mensuales que le permiten pagar sus estudios de diseño de modas y también se dedica a diseñar ropa, y por esta razón necesita un capital que le permita invertir en tela y los implementos necesarios para empezar a fabricar modelos para  cambio de estación. Aunque ya empezó con el negocio de confección de ropa, quiere aumentarlo pues tiene muchos contactos, y así espera aumentar sus ganancias. Como es una joven muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de venta de ropa, pero ella quiere crear su propio estilo y moda. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Jakeline tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de tela para empezar a confeccionar pantalones de polar y también comprará algunos productos de belleza, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jakeline is 20 years and lives with her parents and younger siblings.  Despite her young age she has worked hard every day to get ahead.  For a year now she has been selling a well-known brand of beauty products.  She started this activity at the suggestion of her mother who was already selling the products and thought her daughter could sell to her friends and aquaintances.

Business is going well and she is able to obtain enough monthly income to cover the cost of her fashion design course.  She also designs cloths and needs capital to purchase fabric and necessary items to begin making clothes for the upcoming season.

Although she has already begun her dressmaking business she wants to expand and increase her customer base and earnings.  As a young entrepreneur she plans to open a clothing store and sell her own styles and fashions.  This is her first loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time since she would not want to disappoint the lenders who are helping her to develop and improve her lifestyle.  Jakeline plans to use the loan to purchase fabric to make polar trousers and to buy beauty products so she can increase earnings.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and beauty products

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan lives with his wife, his disabled mother, and his sister, who is a student.  He is an engineer by trade, but the family's main source of income comes from his construction materials shop in the market.  Vardan would like to enlarge his business and increase sales, so he has applied for a loan to make this happen along with the purchase of new inventory for the shop. He hopes that these additions will bring more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase new construction materials to be sold in his shop

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a 33-year-old single mother of two.  For seven years, she has been operating a salon.  She also runs a grocery store for extra income.  In the past, she has operated a retail shop.  

Naomi has experienced a lot of change since she joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because she used her previous loans to boost her business.  Naomi has requested for 58,000 KES to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos.  Julia tiene grado de instrucción primaria. 
Hace un año que viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 200.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta por menor de prendas de vestir.  Julia nos cuenta que ella compra sus prendas en Desaguadero para luego venderlas en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 400.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos docenas de chompas, faldas, mantas, blusas, aguayos y prendas surtidas en general.
Su sueño es mejorar y engrandar el negocio.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el plazo de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the community bank "Las Retamas" which is located in the Puno district in the province and department of Puno. She is 45 years old, is widowed and has two children. Julia's level of education is elementary school. 

She has been working with field partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year. Her initial loan was for 200 nuevos soles (PEN) which she used in her business selling clothes. Julia buys her clothes in Desaguadero so that she can sell them at the different markets in the city. 

With this new loan of 400 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy two dozen sweaters, skirts, blankets, shirts, aguayos (multicolored wool cloth used for adornment or as carrying bags) and a general assortment of clothes. 

Julia's dream is to improve and expand her business. What she likes about her community bank is the terms of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase two dozen sweaters, skirts, blankets, shirts, aguayos, etc.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
Maria Margarita nació en la ciudad del Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú. Ella tiene 56 años edad y tiene cinco hijos. Ella vivía en la ciudad D. Taray pero por el desastre  que ocurrió se traslado y actualmente ella vive en la ciudad Pisaq. (Pisaq se encuentra a 50 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco y se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes y por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola).

Maria Margarita es profesora y trabaja en el colegio nacional D. “Señor D. Huanca” D. la ciudad D. San Salvador, ya son 20 años que se enseña en el colegio y le va muy bien. Maria Margarita nos cuenta con mucha pena que en el mes D. febrero del año 2010 la ciudad D. Taray sufrió un desastre natural pues el rio se desbordo y los pobladores perdieron sus negocios y se cayeron sus casas. 

Maria Margarita tenía una tienda D. abarrotes en la ciudad D. Taray y lo perdió todo por culpa del desastre, ahora ella abrió el negocio en la ciudad D. Pisaq. En esta oportunidad Maria Margarita requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. 
     
Maria Margarita pertenece al banco comunal “Señor D. la Agonía D. Taray” D. la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el cuarto y medio D. año D. funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita was born in the city of Paucartambo, in Cusco department, Peru.  She is 56 years old and has five children.  She used to live in the city of Taray but, as a result of the natural disaster that happened there, she moved and currently lives in the city of Pisaq (Pisaq is located 50 minutes from the city of Cusco and is noted for its beautiful landscapes and for the fact that its residents work in tourism, livestock raising and agriculture).

Maria Margarita is a teacher and works in “Señor D. Huanca” high school, in the city of San Salvador.  She has been teaching in the school for 20 years and is doing very well. Maria Margarita tells us tells us with a lot of sorrow that in February 2010, the city of Taray suffered a natural disaster since a river burst its banks, the residents lost their businesses and their houses collapsed.

Maria Margarita had a grocery store in the city of Taray and she lost everything as a result of the disaster.  She re-opened her business in the city of Pisaq.  On this occasion, Maria Margarita needs a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, noodles and many other products.

Maria Margarita is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Señor D. la Agonía D. Taray” community bank which has been going for four and a half years and is doing very well.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, noodles and many other products

loans.name: Progressive Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Progressive” group. They are small scale business people based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Lassana. Lassana is 35 years old; he was born in Blama. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has two children who are attending primary schools. Lassana sells used clothes and has been managing this business for many years now. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.name: Adela Maribel

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Mapasingue  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas de San Lorenzo.

La señora Adela es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos y no piden tantos requisitos. Tiene  32 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 12 años de edad el mismo que  estudian en  colegio. Vive sola con su hijo.

Ella es una gran madre que por su hijo está dispuesta a sacrificarse y a trabajar duro con tal de que a él nunca le falte nada, para esto hace tres años decidió poner en su casa un mini bazar con lo cual además de ganarse para el sustento diario también está al tanto de las necesidades de su querido hijo. Trabaja todos los días en su local, allí los clientes pueden encontrar variedad de  productos como ropa, juguetes, bisutería entre otras cosas, nos cuenta que su negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito y que poco a poco lo ha ido aumentando.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar ropa, juguetes, cosméticos, bisutería, etc. para surtir aun más su negocio.

Sus sueños son tener un gran local y que su hijo  sea profesional.
texts.en:
In the locality with the name of Mapasingue in Portoviejo's Colon Parish, known for its hard working people dedicated to farming and cattle raising, the “Damas de San Lorenzo” communal bank meets every two weeks.

Adela is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the ease in getting loans and because they don’t ask for so many requirements.  She is 32 years old and a single mother of a 12-year-old son who is in school.  She lives alone with her son.

She is a great mother who is willing to sacrifice and work hard for her son so that he will never lack anything.  For this, she set up a small store in her house three years ago so that, besides earning daily sustenance, she can also be watching over her beloved son’s needs.  She works every day in her store.  Customers can find there a wide variety of goods like clothes, toys and costume jewelry, among other things.  She tells us that she started the business with her first loan and gradually has been enlarging it.

She will use this loan to buy clothes, toys, cosmetics, costume jewelry, etc. to better stock her store.  Her dreams are to have a great store and that he son becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothes, toys, cosmetics, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него 2 детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Чамшед занимается строительными работами по найму. В этой области он более 10 лет. Кроме того на сегодняшний день Чамшед занимается растениеводством. При доме у него имеется участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и бобовые культуры. Кредит берет для повторного посева кукурузы и тыквы. То есть он хочет купить семена и минеральные удобрения.
texts.en: Jamshed lives in the Rudaki region. He's twenty-eight years old, married and has two children. His wife takes care of their household and Jamshed contracts out as a construction worker. He's worked in this field for the past ten years. Additionally, he grows vegetables and legume cultures on a plot of land adjacent to his home. He's asking for a loan to get assistance in planting a second round of corn and pumpkins. He needs to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to sow corn and pumpkins

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, a 54-year-old married mother of three children, resides in Lopez Jaena where she has a shop that sells a variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap. In this business for four years and a member of PMPC for eight years, Anita is requesting a loan of 10,000 to purchase more stocks of products for her general store.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of products for her general store.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif, age 48, sells fruits and vegetables in the central local market. He has been in this business for three years. Fresh fruits, vegetables, and greens are very popular in Azerbaijan as they are staple items in everyday meals. Considering the constant demand for this kind of item, Asif 's business is quite successful and brings a stable income for the family. years old. Asif and his wife have one son.

Today, Asif is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to purchase more seasonal fruits and vegetables to offer for sale, with the purpose of increasing the variety of goods he sells. Asif would like to thank everyone for their support and assures his lenders that the loan will be properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase more seasonal fruits and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Maréme

texts.fr: L’emprunteuse a démarré ses activités de location de chaises et de bâche pour les manifestations sociales sur un premier prêt de l’IMCEC. Ce prêt de 100000F a servi à l’achat de 25 chaises dont les produits de la location lui ont permis de solliciter plus tard deux autres prêts de 150000F chacun.Aujourd’hui, elle dispose de 3 bâches et de 100 chaises et a construit un magasin de stockage dans son domicile.Elle possède également une machine à coudre qui lui permet de varier ses sources de revenus et de mieux prendre en charge ses cinq enfants dont les trois fréquentent l’école.Elle sollicite actuellement un autre prêt pour terminer son magasin et augmenter son stock de chaises. Elle ambitionne de construire plus tard sa propre maison.
texts.en: This borrower got started with her business renting out chairs and tarps for social gatherings using her first loan from IMCEC. That loan of 100,000 F allowed her to buy 25 chairs and renting those out enabled her to ask for two further loans of 150,000 F each. Today she owns three tarps and 100 chairs and has built a storeroom in her domicile. She also owns a sewing machine which allows her to vary her income sources so that she can better support her five children, three of whom are enrolled in school. She is now asking for another loan to finish off her storeroom and add to her stock of chairs. She hopes later on to build her own house.

loans.use: finish her storeroom and add to her stock of chairs.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena has three children and is married to a gardener. She has received junior high education. Abena sells fish and local medicine. She has on her lap the local medicine. She moves around with it in the vicinity of Abura. 

Abena assists her husband to take care of the home. She will use the loan to obtain more local medicines to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to obtain more local medicines to sell.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en: Latifa is a 56-year-old woman who is engaged in farming. She has more than 15 years of experience in this field. She raises fruits and vegetables and sells them in the central bazaar. This is only one financial income in her family. She applied for 500 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Santiago Antonio

texts.es:
Santiago, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, vive con su esposa, sus hijos y un hermano, todos trabajan en la familia, el inicio el negocio con la ayuda de su madre, actualmente su esposa le ayuda a atender a los clientes y su horario es de 6:00am a 6:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de una refrigeradora, ya que en su negocio vende refrescos, gaseosas y jugos, la inversión le ayudara para tener el equipo necesario para la tienda.
Su propósito es tener el negocio bien establecido, ser un microempresario de éxito y atender a su familia en todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Santiago sells basic supplies. He lives with his wife, children and a brother.  Everyone in the family works. He began the business with the help of his mother. At present, his wife helps wait on customers and their hours are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m.

He is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator, since in his business he sells beverages: soft drinks and juices. The investment would help him have the equipment necessary for the store.

His goal is to have a well-established store: to be a successful small businessman and to provide his family with all the necessities.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for his business.

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran is a very supportive person by nature. She runs a sewing business at her home to supplement the income of her family. 
Her husband works in a livestock business. He has some buffaloes. He gets milk from them which he sells to his community clients and, thus, generates income for the family. 
Her husband started this business some time ago and it is working well for him. He has a good number of clients who purchase milk from him regularly. 
Ameeran is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well. She has given birth to 2 sons and 3 daughters. Her sons are studying while her daughters remain at home and do household work with Ameeran. 
Ameeran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits.
She is confident that her husband’s business will improve as a result of the loan investment and that her household income will increase.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her milk selling business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, necesita el préstamo para comprar concentrado, maicillo, granza y vitaminas, de esa forma atendera las gallinas para que estén bien y en buenas condiciones para que le sigan produciendo y obtener huevos, la decicion de tomar nuevamente el prestamo, es porque le parecio bien el trabajo, atencion que recibio y el tramite que fue rapido, ella necesita de estos aportes para mejorar cada dia el negocio.
texts.en: Miriam needs to loan to buy feed, millet, sorghum and vitamins to tend to her chickens so they are well and living in good condition, and continue producing, and to obtain eggs.  She made the decision to take a new loan because her work is going well, the attention she received and the transaction was quick.  She needs the contribution to improve her business on a daily basis.

loans.use: To purchase feed, millet, sorghum and vitamins to tend to her chickens well.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz tiene 23 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de tres años; vive con su familia en Salcedo que se encuentra ubicado a 20 minutos de Latacunga en la Sierra Centro de Ecuador. Luz se considera una persona buena, tranquila, sociable y amable.

Trabaja con su esposo en la crianza de cerdos. Es la primera vez que solicita crédito a Fodemi, este crédito invertirá en la compra de balanceado para la alimentación de sus cerdos lo que ayudará a que crezcan sanos y gordos para que esten de buena calidad al momento de la venta, ya que obtendrán buenos ingresos.

Su sueño es que su hijo crezca sano y necesita tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Luz is 23 years old, married, and has a 3-year-old son.  She lives with her family in Salcedo, 20 minutes from Latacunga, in Sierra Centro region, in Ecuador.  Luz considers herself to be a good, calm, sociable and kind person.

Luz works with her husband, raising pigs.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan from Fodemi.  She will invest this loan in buying nutritionally-balanced feed for her pigs.  This will help them to grow healthy and fat so that they are good quality when she comes to sell them.  This will make her good income.

Luz's dream is for her son to grow up healthy and to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her pigs

loans.name: Tinh's Group

texts.en:
Tinh is 56 years old with 3 children. She is living in An ninh village. She is running a small shop that sell fruits. This kinds of business creates stabL. income for her to manage her family life. She wants to a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy more fruits to sell.

Than is 54 years olds. She is a farmer who focuses on growing rice and raising pigs. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale

loans.name: Ernestina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ernestina, es madre soltera, vive con tres hijos de 11,9 y 1 año de edad, ella se dedica a crecer cerdos y venderlos, en su casa tiene la granja el cual atiende todos los días, no tiene un horario establecido.
Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar dos cerdos pequeños y poder crecerlos y luego venderlos a buen precio y así obtener mejores resultados en sus ganancias.
El sueño de Ernestina es siempre tener el negocio estable y darle una mejor vida a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Ernestina is the single mother of three children aged 11, 9, and 1. She earns her living raising and selling pigs. Her farm is next to her house and she works there every day but not to any established timetable.

Ernestina needs a loan so she can buy two young pigs, then raise and sell them for a good price, and earn good money from the process. Her dream is to have a stable well-established business so that she can provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy two young pigs

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling accessories and home products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more accessories and home products to sell in her stall.

Margie has been in this business for 7 years. Margie earns a significant portion of her income from buying and selling scrap gold.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more accessories and home products to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani, 45, is a talented lady. She is involved in two businesses: sewing and selling fertilizer and seeds. She manages her two businesses with a great sense of responsibility.  

Rani sews clothes for her neighboring clients and earns income by fulfilling her orders on time. She also sells fertilizer and seeds to the farmers and to different shops in the markets to increase her income. She does this work to support her husband financially.  

Rani's husband is a mason by profession. His income is not permanent because he sometimes gets work and sometimes not. Rani is the mother of five sons who are 13, 11, 9, 7, and 5 years old.   

With this loan, Rani will purchase fertilizer and seeds in larger quantity in order to increase her sales and earn better profits. She is hopeful that the loan investment will expand her business and improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for selling.

loans.name: Clara Alicia

texts.es: La señora Clara Alicia a sus 48 años es propietaria de una pequeña tienda que inició con sus propios ahorros hace menos de un año cuando vio la necesidad de prestar este servicio a los vecinos de su barrio quienes necesitaban tener una tienda cerca de sus hogares. La señora Clara Alicia requiere de la compra de surtido para su tienda tal como aceite, panela, arroz, café, gaseosas y snacks, que le permitan suplir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer un mejor servicio. Lo anterior, le podrá generar a la señora Clara Alicia mayores ventas y aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la señora Clara Alicia es llegar a tener un negocio líder en el sector y  poder prestar un excelente servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Clara Alicia is 28 years old and has a small store that she started with her own savings less than a year ago, after seeing the need to provide this service to her neighbors who needed a store close to their homes.  Clara Alicia needs to buy an assortment, such as cooking oil, brown sugar, rice, coffee, soft drinks, and snacks for her store, so that she can meet her customer demand and offer them better service.  This will also allow her to increase her sales and income, and improve her family’s quality of life.  Clara Alicia’s dream is to have a leading business in the sector and be able to provide excellent customer service.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio is a patient and hardworking man. He is a farmer who grows rice in his one-hectare field. Upon maturity of his crops, he sells to traders and this allows him to earn at least PHP 20,000 each harvest season (April and November). He has five children that attend school. Dionisio is proud that through the income from his farming activities he is able to provide for their school needs.

The profits from the last crop were used for the family's expenses and that is why Dionisio lacks funds to sustain his crop growing. He is now asking for loan of PHP 25,000 to buy three bags of rice seeds and seven bags of UREA (fertilizers) for his farming. He hopes that Kiva lenders will entrust him with a loan and he also promises to utilize it well for the improvements of their lives too.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice seeds and seven bags of UREA (fertilizers) for his farm

loans.name: Kimly

texts.en:
Kimly, 26, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She is a garment worker. Her husband refills gas into small cans that he sells to his clients for use with gas stoves. Additionally, he rents sound equipment for the villagers in his village. 

Kimly is requesting a loan of USD 600 to expand her husband's business by purchasing more gas to refill the cans in order to sell. 

In the future, she plans to add delivery service in her husband's business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more gas to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a married woman who has four children. She is 40 years old. She lives in Bocator, Tangub City, Philippines.

Raquel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. 

In 2011, Raquel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Raquel hopes to expand and improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Duo El Manzanillo Group

texts.es: Duo el Manzanillo.don Lorenzo de 54 años de edad el se dedica a la venta de verduras y a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad desde hace varios años mos comenta que conocer esta intitucion es un regalo de Dios por el apoyo que le puedan dar, el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de verduras y compra de productos comestibles y asi de esa manera seguir con su negocio y desde ya agradese la ayuda brindada.

loans.use: Compra de verduras y productos comestibles.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 45 year old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan who helps support 5 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy fabric for making traditional Arabic seating cushions. She would like to expand her current project so that she can open a shop to sell the projects. She also has future aspirations to open an electronics shop. Siham hopes that this will help improve her family's economic conditions.

loans.use: to pay for fabric to make traditional Arabic seating cushions

loans.name: Yohanna Datmen

texts.es:
Yohanna  tiene 32 años de edad, es madre y padre para sus dos hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la costura y también al diseño y elaboración de ropa de vestir. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo tela, hilos, agujas  y otras cosas más. 

Se encuentra contenta por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Yohanna is thirty-two years old, and acts as both the mother and father for two children.  Her main work is sewing, but also in design and in making clothing.  She has been in this business for several years and it is going well thanks to the determination she brings to her work.

In this opportunity, she requires a loan in order to buy work materials, like fabric, thread, needles, and other items.

She finds herself happy for the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.  She is thankful for the help offered to her.

loans.use: to buy work materials like fabric, thread, needles, and other items.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a smallholder farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya who is deep into dairy farming. Kapsowar's landscape is green and hilly and farmers make use of slopes by turning them into farmland. The problem is that these slopes are very steep and unfenced. 

Samuel is seeking a loan to fence his farmland. A fence would be a very important part of Samuel's land for it sets boundaries, protects property and most important, controls animal movement. On such contours, his animals could easily lose their footing and get injured or even fall to death. 

The fence will also improve feed management on his farm, which will lead to higher milk production.

loans.use: to fence his farm

loans.name: Ejoheza Group

texts.en: Adeline is a group leader; aged 48 years.She is married with 4 children aged between 10 and 2 years. The group is called EJOHEZA means “TOMORROW IS GOOD” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.Adeline owns a mini market  and has been running in a business for 4 years. With the loan, Adeline likes to buy more items such as cakes, breads and chocolates for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more items such as cakes, breads and chocolates for sale.

loans.name: El Buen Beneficio Group

texts.en:
San Bartolomé Jocotenango is a small town where nearly all of the population is indigenous K’iche Maya. The population holds fast to their traditions of language and colorful dress. Little girls are traditionally not given the same opportunities as boys. The result is that about 70% of women have had no formal education and 30% were only able to study until the 4th or 6th grades.

Ten women have joined together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “El Buen Beneficio” and are so pleased to be able to access loans and sustain and expand their small animal husbandry businesses. The ladies raise animals like bulls, cows, pigs, turkeys and chickens. They sell their animals in a local market and in the nearby large market in Quiche. 

The President of the group is 53 year old Isabel, who is the mother of nine children who range in age from 10-28. She has been able to afford to give all of them a primary school education. Isabel raises animals including cows, pigs, turkeys and chickens. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals as well as feed to fatten them up and then sell them. With her anticipated income, she will keep supporting the needs and education of her children and in addition, buy fertilizer for her corn and bean fields. 

The women realize that having access to education is of great importance to success in the future. Since the vast majority of them have had no education at all, they understand this and are motivated to see their children stay in school as long as possible. The ladies feel fortunate to participate in educational trainings in their monthly meetings with a Facilitator from Friendship Bridge. 

With capital and education, the women are taking steps to create a more prosperous future for themselves and their families. Thank you!

loans.use: To buy more animals as well as feed to fatten them up

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Mrs. Sandra O. a young woman of 25 years old. A dynamic client of LAPO who specializes in cooking delicious food for people in her environment. She bent on improving her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
A 62 year old woman, Mrs. Bernadette H. is married and has a family; today, she has six people in her care. Living in Agbanakin in the prefecture of Lacs, she has run for the past 18 years a general food store, which allows her to meet her expenses. Given that the income is used directly to pay the household expenses, she is unable to refurbish her display and satisfy market demand.

The tontine (investment) and credit system to which she subscribes keeps her better organized. Currently, she is asking for a sum of $600 to stock up on merchandise and increase her income. This will allow her to reasonably meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Femme de 62 ans, Mme H. Bernadette est mariée et mère de famille ; aujourd’hui, elle a en charge six personnes. Domiciliée à Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs, elle a installé depuis maintenant 18 ans une boutique d’alimentation générale qui lui permet de supporter ses charges. Etant donné que les recettes faites sont directement utilisés pour les dépenses familiales, elle n’arrive pas à ravitailler régulièrement son étalage et satisfaire les demandes du marché.

Le système de tontine et de crédit auquel elle a souscrit l’aide à mieux s’organiser. Actuellement, elle sollicite une somme de $600 pour s’approvisionner en marchandises et accroître ses revenus. Cela lui permettra de subvenir valablement aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock up on various goods
